translated: He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.

original: nāvidyāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /
analyzed: na avidyām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti
translated: He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.

original: nāvidyāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti nāvidyāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /🔽nāvidyāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: na avidyām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti na avidyām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na a nimittā iti  na avidyām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.

original: nāvidyāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti nāvidyāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /🔽na saṃskārān nityā ity upaparīkṣate nānityā iti /
analyzed: na avidyām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti na avidyām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na aviviktā iti 🔽na saṃskārān nityāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anityāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate ignorance as having a focus or as having no focus.🔽He

original: na saṃskārān sukhā ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti /
analyzed: na saṃskārān sukhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether formations are pleasant or painful.

original: na saṃskārān ātmā ity upaparīkṣate nānātmā iti /
analyzed: na saṃskārān ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na an ātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether formations are a self or not a self.

original: na saṃskārān śubhā ity upaparīkṣate nāśubhā iti /
analyzed: na saṃskārān śubhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether formations are beautiful or ugly.

original: na saṃskārān śūnyā ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyā iti /🔽na saṃskārān nimittā ity upaparīkṣate nānimittā iti /
analyzed: na saṃskārān śūnyāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāḥ iti  na saṃskārāt nimittāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na animittāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether formations are empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether formations have signs or are signless.

original: na saṃskārān praṇihitā ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitā iti /🔽na saṃskārān śāntā ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntā iti /
analyzed: na saṃskārān praṇihitāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāḥ iti  na saṃskārān śāntāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether formations have wishes or are wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether formations are calm or not calm.

original: na saṃskārān viviktā ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktā iti /
analyzed: na saṃskārān viviktāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether formations are void or not void.

original: na vijñānaṃ nityam ity upaparīkṣate nānityam iti /
analyzed: na vijñānam nityam iti upaparīkṣate na anityam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether consciousness is permanent or impermanent.

original: na vijñānaṃ sukham ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti /
analyzed: na vijñānam sukham iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti
translated: He does not investigate whether consciousness is pleasant or painful.

original: na vijñānam ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na vijñānam ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether consciousness is a self or not a self.

original: na vijñānaṃ śubham ity upaparīkṣate nāśubham iti /
analyzed: na vijñānam śubham iti upaparīkṣate na aśubham iti
translated: He does not investigate whether consciousness is beautiful or ugly.

original: na vijñānaṃ śūnyam ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyam iti /
analyzed: na vijñānam śūnyam iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether consciousness is empty or not empty.

original: na vijñānaṃ nimittam ity upaparīkṣate nānimittam iti /
analyzed: na vijñānam nimittam iti upaparīkṣate na animittam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether consciousness is a sign or signless.

original: na vijñānaṃ praṇihitam ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitam iti /🔽na vijñānaṃ śāntam ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntam iti /
analyzed: na vijñānam praṇihitam iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihitam iti  na vijñānam śāntam iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether consciousness is aimed or not aimed.🔽He does not investigate whether consciousness is peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na vijñānaṃ viviktam ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktam iti /
analyzed: na vijñānam viviktam iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether consciousness is isolated or not isolated.

original: na nāmarūpaṃ nityam ity upaparīkṣate nānityam iti /🔽na nāmarūpaṃ ŚsP II
analyzed: na nāma rūpam nityam iti upaparīkṣate na anityam iti  na nāma rūpam
translated: He does not investigate whether name-and-form is permanent or impermanent.

original: sukham ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti /
analyzed: sukham iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti
translated: He does not investigate whether name-and-form is suffering or not suffering.

original: na nāmarūpam ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na nāma rūpam ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether name-and-form is a self or not a self.

original: na nāmarūpaṃ śubham ity upaparīkṣate nāśubham iti /
analyzed: na nāma rūpam śubham iti upaparīkṣate na aśubham iti
translated: He does not investigate whether name-and-form is beautiful or ugly.

original: na nāmarūpaṃ śūnyam ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyam iti /🔽na nāmarūpaṃ nimittam ity upaparīkṣate nānimittam iti /
analyzed: na nāma rūpam śūnyam iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyam iti  na nāma rūpam nimittam iti upaparīkṣate na animittam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether name-and-form is empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether name-and-form is a sign or signless.

original: na nāmarūpaṃ praṇihitam ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitam iti /
analyzed: na nāma rūpam praṇihitam iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihitam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether name-and-form is aimed or not aimed.

original: na nāmarūpaṃ śāntam ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntam iti /
analyzed: na nāma rūpam śāntam iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether name-and-form is peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na nāmarūpaṃ viviktam ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktam iti /
analyzed: na nāma rūpam viviktam iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether name-and-form is isolated or not isolated.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanaṃ nityam ity upaparīkṣate nānityam iti /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanam nityam iti upaparīkṣate na anityam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the six sense bases are permanent or impermanent.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanaṃ sukham ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanam sukham iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the six sense bases are happiness or suffering.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanam ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanam ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the six sense bases are a self or not a self.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanaṃ śubham ity upaparīkṣate nāśubham iti /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanam śubham iti upaparīkṣate na aśubham iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the six sense bases are beautiful or ugly.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanaṃ śūnyam ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyam iti /🔽na ṣaḍāyatanaṃ nimittam ity upaparīkṣate nānimittam iti /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanam śūnyam iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyam iti  na ṣaṣ āyatanam nimittam iti upaparīkṣate na animittam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the six sense bases are empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether the six sense bases have signs or are signless.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanaṃ praṇihitam ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitam iti /🔽na ṣaḍāyatanaṃ śāntam ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntam iti /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanam praṇihitam iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitam iti  na ṣaṣ āyatanam śāntam iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the six sense bases have wishes or are wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether the six sense bases are peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanaṃ viviktam ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktam iti /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanam viviktam iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the six sense bases are isolated or not isolated.

original: na sparśaṃ nitya ity upaparīkṣate nānitya iti /
analyzed: na sparśam nityaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anityaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether contact is permanent or impermanent.

original: na sparśaṃ sukha ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti /
analyzed: na sparśam sukhe iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhe iti
translated: He does not investigate whether contact is happiness or suffering.

original: na sparśam ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na sparśam ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether contact is a self or not a self.

original: na sparśaṃ śubha ity upaparīkṣate nāśubha iti /
analyzed: na sparśam śubhe iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhe iti
translated: He does not investigate whether contact is beautiful or ugly.

original: na sparśaṃ śūnya ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnya iti /🔽na sparśaṃ nimitta ity upaparīkṣate nānimitta iti /
analyzed: na sparśam śūnye iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnye iti  na sparśam nimitte iti upaparīkṣate na animitte iti
translated: He does not investigate contact as empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate contact as a sign or signless.

original: na sparśaṃ praṇihita ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihita iti /🔽na sparśaṃ śānta ity upaparīkṣate nāśānta iti /
analyzed: na sparśam praṇihite iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihite iti  na sparśam śāntaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate contact as having wishes or wish less.🔽He does not investigate contact as peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na sparśaṃ vivikta ity upaparīkṣate nāvivikta iti /
analyzed: na sparśam vivikte iti upaparīkṣate na a vivikte iti
translated: He does not investigate contact as isolated or not isolated.

original: na vedanāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na vedanām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate feeling as permanent or impermanent.

original: na vedanāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na vedanām sukhā iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti
translated: He does not investigate feeling as happiness or suffering.

original: na vedanām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na vedanām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate feeling as self or not self.

original: na vedanāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /
analyzed: na vedanām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti
translated: He does not investigate feeling as beautiful or ugly.

original: na vedanāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /🔽na vedanāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na vedanām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti  na vedanām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na a nimittā iti
translated: He does not investigate feeling as empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate feeling as a sign or signless.

original: na vedanāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /🔽na vedanāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /
analyzed: na vedanām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihitā iti  na vedanām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate feeling as having wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate feeling as peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na vedanāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na vedanām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate feeling as isolated or not isolated.

original: na tṛṣṇām nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na tṛṣṇām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate craving as permanent or impermanent.

original: na tṛṣṇāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na tṛṣṇām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate craving as happiness or as suffering.

original: na tṛṣṇām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na tṛṣṇām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate craving as the self or as not the self.

original: na tṛṣṇāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /
analyzed: na tṛṣṇām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti
translated: He does not investigate craving as beautiful or as ugly.

original: na tṛṣṇāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /🔽na tṛṣṇāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na tṛṣṇām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti  na tṛṣṇām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti
translated: He does not investigate craving as empty or as not empty.🔽He does not investigate craving as a sign or as signless.

original: na tṛṣṇāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /🔽na tṛṣṇāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /
analyzed: na tṛṣṇām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti  na tṛṣṇām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate craving as having a wish or as wishless.🔽He does not investigate craving as peaceful or as not peaceful.

original: na tṛṣṇāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na tṛṣṇām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate craving as isolated or as not isolated.

original: nopādānaṃ nityam ity upaparīkṣate nānityam iti /
analyzed: na upādānam nityam iti upaparīkṣate na anityam iti
translated: He does not investigate grasping as permanent or as impermanent.

original: nopādānaṃ sukham ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti /
analyzed: na upādānam sukham iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti
translated: He does not investigate grasping as happiness or as suffering.

original: nopādānam ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti / ŚsP II
analyzed: na upādānam ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate grasping as the self or as not the self.

original: nopādānaṃ śubham ity upaparīkṣate nāśubham iti /🔽nopādānaṃ śūnyam ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyam iti /
analyzed: na upādānam śubham iti upaparīkṣate na aśubham iti  na upādānam śūnyam iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyam iti
translated: He does not investigate grasping as beautiful or as ugly.🔽He does not investigate grasping as empty or as not empty.

original: nopādānaṃ nimittam ity upaparīkṣate nānimittam iti /
analyzed: na upādānam nimittam iti upaparīkṣate na animittam iti
translated: He does not investigate grasping as a sign or as signless.

original: nopādānaṃ praṇihitam ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitam iti /🔽nopādānaṃ śāntam ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntam iti /
analyzed: na upādānam praṇihitam iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitam iti  na upādānam śāntam iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether appropriation is with-outflow or without-outflow.🔽He does not investigate whether appropriation is peaceful or not peaceful.

original: nopādānaṃ viviktam ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktam iti /
analyzed: na upādānam viviktam iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether appropriation is isolated or not isolated.

original: na bhavaṃ nitya ity upaparīkṣate nānitya iti /
analyzed: na bhavam nityaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anityaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether existence is permanent or impermanent.

original: na bhavaṃ sukha ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti /
analyzed: na bhavam sukhe iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhe iti
translated: He does not investigate whether existence is happy or suffering.

original: na bhavam ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na bhavam ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether existence has a self or is without a self.

original: na bhavaṃ śubha ity upaparīkṣate nāśubha iti /
analyzed: na bhavam śubhaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether existence is pure or impure.

original: na bhavaṃ śūnya ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnya iti /🔽na bhavaṃ nimitta ity upaparīkṣate nānimitta iti /
analyzed: na bhavam śūnyaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyaḥ iti  na bhavam nimitte iti upaparīkṣate na animitte iti
translated: He does not investigate whether existence is empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether existence has characteristics or is without characteristics.

original: na bhavaṃ praṇihita ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihita iti /🔽na bhavaṃ śānta ity upaparīkṣate nāśānta iti /
analyzed: na bhavam praṇihitaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitaḥ iti  na bhavam śāntaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether existence is with-outflow or without-outflow.🔽He does not investigate whether existence is peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na bhavaṃ vivikta ity upaparīkṣate nāvivikta iti /
analyzed: na bhavam viviktaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether existence is isolated or not isolated.

original: na jātiṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na jātim nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether birth is permanent or impermanent.

original: na jātiṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na jātim sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate whether birth is happy or suffering.

original: na jātim ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na jātim ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether birth is a self or not a self.

original: na jātiṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /
analyzed: na jātim śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether birth is pure or impure.

original: na jātiṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /🔽na jātiṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na jātim śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti  na jātim nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na a nimittā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether birth is empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether birth is with signs or signless.

original: na jātiṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /🔽na jātiṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /
analyzed: na jātim praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihitā iti  na jātim śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether birth is with wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether birth is calm or not calm.

original: na jātiṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na jātim viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether birth is void or not void.

original: na jarāmaraṇaṃ nityam ity upaparīkṣate nānityam iti /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇam nityam iti upaparīkṣate na anityam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether old age and death are permanent or impermanent.

original: na jarāmaraṇaṃ sukham ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇam sukham iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkham iti
translated: He does not investigate whether old age and death are happiness or suffering.

original: na jarāmaraṇam ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇam ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether old age and death are a self or not a self.

original: na jarāmaraṇaṃ śubham ity upaparīkṣate nāśubham iti /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇam śubham iti upaparīkṣate na aśubham iti
translated: He does not investigate whether old age and death are pure or impure.

original: na jarāmaraṇaṃ śūnyam ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyam iti /🔽na jarāmaraṇaṃ nimittam ity upaparīkṣate nānimittam iti /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇam śūnyam iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyam iti  na jarā maraṇam nimittam iti upaparīkṣate na animittam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether old age and death are empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether old age and death are with signs or signless.

original: na jarāmaraṇaṃ praṇihitam ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitam iti /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇam praṇihitam iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihitam iti
translated: He does not investigate whether old age and death are with wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether old age and death are calm or not calm.

original: na jarāmaraṇaṃ śāntam ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntam iti /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇam śāntam iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntam iti
translated: He does not investigate old age and death as peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na jarāmaraṇaṃ viviktam ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktam iti /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇam viviktam iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktam iti
translated: He does not investigate old age and death as secluded or not secluded.

original: na dānapāramitāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of giving as permanent or impermanent.

original: na dānapāramitāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of giving as happiness or suffering.

original: na dānapāramitām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of giving as self or not self.

original: na dānapāramitāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of giving as attractive or unattractive.

original: na dānapāramitāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /🔽na dānapāramitāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti  na dāna pāramitām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of giving as empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of giving as with signs or signless.

original: na dānapāramitāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /🔽na dānapāramitāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti  na dāna pāramitām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of giving as having wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of giving as peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na dānapāramitāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of giving as secluded or not secluded.

original: na śīlapāramitāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of morality as permanent or impermanent.

original: na śīlapāramitāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of morality as happiness or suffering.

original: na śīlapāramitām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of morality as a self or not a self.

original: na śīlapāramitāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽na śīlapāramitāṃ ŚsP II
analyzed: na śīla pāramitām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti  na śīla pāramitām
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of morality as good or not good.

original: śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /🔽na śīlapāramitāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti  na śīla pāramitām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of morality as empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of morality as with signs or signless.

original: na śīlapāramitāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /🔽na śīlapāramitāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti  na śīla pāramitām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of morality as having wishes or wish less.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of morality as calm or not calm.

original: na śīlapāramitāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of morality as void or not void.

original: na kṣāntipāramitāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na kṣānti pāramitām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of patience as permanent or impermanent.

original: na kṣāntipāramitāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na kṣānti pāramitām sukhā iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of patience as happiness or suffering.

original: na kṣāntipāramitām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na kṣānti pāramitām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of patience as a self or not a self.

original: na kṣāntipāramitāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽na kṣāntipāramitāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na kṣānti pāramitām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti  na kṣānti pāramitām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of patience as good or not good.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of patience as empty or not empty.

original: na kṣāntipāramitāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na kṣānti pāramitām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of patience as with signs or signless.

original: na kṣāntipāramitāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: na kṣānti pāramitām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of patience as having aspirations or as lacking aspirations.

original: na kṣāntipāramitāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /🔽na kṣāntipāramitāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /🔽na vīryapāramitāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na kṣānti pāramitām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntā iti  na kṣānti pāramitām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti  na vīrya pāramitām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of patience as peaceful or as not peaceful.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of patience as secluded or as not secluded.

original: na vīryapāramitāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /🔽na vīryapāramitām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na vīrya pāramitām sukhā iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti  na vīrya pāramitām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of perseverance as having a self or as being without a self.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of perseverance as having a self or as being without a self.

original: na vīryapāramitāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽na vīryapāramitāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na vīrya pāramitām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti  na vīrya pāramitām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of perseverance as having a self or as being without a self.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of perseverance as having a self or as being without a self.

original: na vīryapāramitāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /🔽na vīryapāramitāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: na vīrya pāramitām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti  na vīrya pāramitām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of perseverance as having a self or as being without a self.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of perseverance as having a self or as being without a self.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of perseverance as having a self or as being without a self.

original: na vīryapāramitāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /🔽na vīryapāramitāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na vīrya pāramitām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntā iti  na vīrya pāramitām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of perseverance as having a self or as being without a self.

original: na dhyānapāramitāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of concentration as having a self or as being without a self.

original: na dhyānapāramitāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of meditation as happiness or suffering.

original: na dhyānapāramitām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of meditation as self or not self.

original: na dhyānapāramitāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of meditation as beautiful or ugly.

original: na dhyānapāramitāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /🔽na dhyānapāramitāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti  na dhyāna pāramitām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of meditation as empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of meditation as with signs or signless.

original: na dhyānapāramitāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /🔽na dhyānapāramitāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti  na dhyāna pāramitām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of meditation as having wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate the perfection of meditation as calm or not calm.

original: na dhyānapāramitāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti

original: na prajñāpāramitāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of wisdom as permanent or impermanent.

original: na prajñāpāramitāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitām sukhā iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of wisdom as happiness or suffering.

original: na prajñāpāramitām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of wisdom as self or not self.

original: na prajñāpāramitāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of wisdom as beautiful or ugly.

original: na prajñāpāramitāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate the perfection of wisdom as empty or not empty.

original: na prajñāpāramitāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the perfection of wisdom is with signs or signless.

original: na prajñāpāramitāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /🔽na prajñāpāramitāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti  na prajñāpāramitām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the perfection of wisdom is with wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether the perfection of wisdom is peaceful or not peaceful.

analyzed: na prajñāpāramitām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti  śsp ii

original: nādhyātmaśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na adhyātma śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether internal emptiness is permanent or impermanent.

original: nādhyātmaśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na adhyātma śūnyatām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate whether internal emptiness is happiness or suffering.

original: nādhyātmaśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na adhyātma śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether internal emptiness is a self or not a self.

original: nādhyātmaśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽nādhyātmaśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na adhyātma śūnyatām śubha iti upaparīkṣate na aśubha iti  na adhyātma śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether internal emptiness is beautiful or ugly.🔽He does not investigate whether internal emptiness is empty or not empty.

original: nādhyātmaśūnyatāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /🔽nādhyātmaśūnyatāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: na adhyātma śūnyatām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti  na adhyātma śūnyatām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether internal emptiness is with signs or signless.🔽He does not investigate whether internal emptiness is with wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether internal emptiness is peaceful or not peaceful.

original: nādhyātmaśūnyatāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /🔽nādhyātmaśūnyatāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na adhyātma śūnyatām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti 🔽na adhyātma śūnyatām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether internal emptiness is secluded or not secluded.

original: na bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether external emptiness is permanent or impermanent.

original: na bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatām sukhā iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether external emptiness is happiness or suffering.

original: na bahirdhāśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether external emptiness is self or not self.

original: na bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽na bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti  na bahirdhā śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether external emptiness is pure or impure.🔽He does not investigate whether external emptiness is empty or not empty.

original: na bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /🔽na bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti  na bahirdhā śūnyatām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether external emptiness is with signs or signless.🔽He does not investigate whether external emptiness is with wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether external emptiness is calm or not calm.

original: na bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /🔽na bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti  na bahirdhā śūnyatām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether external emptiness is void or not void.

original: nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether internal and external emptiness is permanent or impermanent.

original: nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām sukhā iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether internal and external emptiness is happiness or suffering.

original: nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether internal and external emptiness is self or not self.

original: nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti  na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate inner and outer emptiness as good or not good.🔽He does not investigate inner and outer emptiness as empty or not empty.

original: na prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na prakṛti śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of nature as permanent or impermanent.

original: na prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na prakṛti śūnyatām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of nature as happy or suffering.

original: na prakṛtiśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /🔽na prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽na prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na prakṛti śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti  na prakṛti śūnyatām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti  na prakṛti śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of nature as self or not self.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of nature as attractive or unattractive.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of nature as empty or not empty.

original: na prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /🔽na prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: na prakṛti śūnyatām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti  na prakṛti śūnyatām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of nature as having signs or signless.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of nature as having wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of nature as peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /🔽na prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na prakṛti śūnyatām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti  na prakṛti śūnyatām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of nature as isolated or not isolated.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of all phenomena as permanent or impermanent.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of all phenomena as happy or suffering.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of all phenomena is a self or not a self.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽na sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti  na sarva dharma śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of all phenomena is beautiful or ugly.🔽He does not investigate whether the emptiness of all phenomena is empty or not empty.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of all phenomena is a sign or signless.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /🔽na sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti  na sarva dharma śūnyatām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of all phenomena is with a wish or wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether the emptiness of all phenomena is calm or not calm.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of all phenomena is void or not void.

original: na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of its own mark is permanent or impermanent.

original: na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of its own mark is happiness or suffering.

original: na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of its own mark is a self or not a self.

original: na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of its own mark is beautiful or ugly.

original: na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti / na ŚsP II
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti na
translated: He does not investigate whether the emptiness of its own mark is empty or not empty.

original: svalakṣaṇaśunyataṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nanimitteti /🔽na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: nimitta iti upaparīkṣate na nimitta iti  na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of its own mark as a sign or not a sign.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of its own mark as aimed or not aimed.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of its own mark as peaceful or not peaceful.

original: na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /🔽na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti  na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of its own mark as secluded or not secluded.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-apprehension as permanent or impermanent.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatām sukhā iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-apprehension as happiness or suffering.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-apprehension as self or not self.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-apprehension as beautiful or ugly.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /🔽nānupalambhaśūnyatāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti  na anupalambha śūnyatām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-apprehension as empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of non-apprehension as a sign or signless.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-apprehension as aimed or not aimed.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-apprehension as peaceful or not peaceful.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na aviviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-apprehension as being isolated or not isolated.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-existence as being eternal or not eternal.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatām sukhā iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-existence as being happiness or suffering.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-existence as being a self or not a self.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽nābhāvaśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti  na abhāva śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-existence as being pure or impure.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of non-existence as being empty or not empty.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /🔽nābhāvaśūnyatāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti  na abhāva śūnyatām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-existence as having signs or being signless.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of non-existence as having wishes or being wishless.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of non-existence as being calm or not calm.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /🔽nābhāvaśūnyatāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti  na abhāva śūnyatām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of non-existence as being isolated or not isolated.

original: na svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na svabhāva śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of own-nature as being eternal or not eternal.

original: na svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na svabhāva śūnyatām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of own-nature as being happiness or suffering.

original: na svabhāvaśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: na svabhāva śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of own-nature as being a self or not a self.

original: na svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽na svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na svabhāva śūnyatām śubhā iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhā iti  na svabhāva śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of inherent nature as good or not good.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of inherent nature as empty or not empty.

original: na svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /🔽na svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /
analyzed: na svabhāva śūnyatām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti  na svabhāva śūnyatām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of inherent nature as a sign or signless.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of inherent nature as having wishes or wishless.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of inherent nature as calm or not calm.

original: na svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti /🔽na svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na svabhāva śūnyatām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti  na svabhāva śūnyatām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na aviviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of inherent nature as isolated or not isolated.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ nityety upaparīkṣate nānityeti /
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām nityā iti upaparīkṣate na anityā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of the nature of non-existence as permanent or impermanent.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ sukhety upaparīkṣate na duḥkheti /
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām sukha iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of the nature of non-existence as happiness or suffering.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatām ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /🔽nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ śubhety upaparīkṣate nāśubheti /🔽nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ śūnyety upaparīkṣate nāśūnyeti /
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na anātmā iti  na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām śubha iti upaparīkṣate na aśubha iti  na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām śūnyā iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of the nature of non-existence as self or not self.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of the nature of non-existence as pure or impure.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of the nature of non-existence as empty or not empty.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ nimittety upaparīkṣate nānimitteti /
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām nimittā iti upaparīkṣate na animittā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of the nature of non-existence as a sign or signless.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of the nature of non-existence as having wishes or wishless.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ praṇihitety upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihiteti /🔽nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ śāntety upaparīkṣate nāśānteti / ŚsP II
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām praṇihitā iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitā iti  na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām śāntā iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of the non-existence of own-being as having a goal or as being without a goal.🔽He does not investigate the emptiness of the non-existence of own-being as peaceful or as not peaceful.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ viviktety upaparīkṣate nāvivikteti /
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām viviktā iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktā iti
translated: He does not investigate the emptiness of the non-existence of own-being as isolated or as not isolated.

original: na smṛtyupasthānāni nityānīty upaparīkṣate nānityānīti /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthānāni nityāni iti upaparīkṣate na anityāni iti
translated: He does not investigate the applications of mindfulness as permanent or as impermanent.

original: na smṛty upasthānāni sukhānīty upaparīkṣate na duḥkhānīti /
analyzed: na smṛtī upasthānāni sukhāni iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate the applications of mindfulness as happiness or as suffering.

original: na smṛtyupasthānāny ātmānīty upaparīkṣate nānātmānīti /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthānāni ātmāni iti upaparīkṣate na anātmāni iti
translated: He does not investigate the applications of mindfulness as self or as non-self.

original: na smṛtyupasthānāni śubhānīty upaparīkṣate nāśubhānīti /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthānāni śubhāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate the applications of mindfulness as lovely or as repulsive.

original: na smṛtyupasthānāni śūnyānīty upaparīkṣate nāśūnyānīti /🔽na smṛtyupasthānāni nimittānīty upaparīkṣate nānimittānīti na smṛtyupasthānāni praṇihitānīty upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitānīti /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthānāni śūnyāni iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāni iti  na smṛti upasthānāni nimittāni iti upaparīkṣate na animittāni iti na smṛti upasthānāni praṇihitāni iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāni iti
translated: He does not investigate the applications of mindfulness as empty or as not empty.🔽He does not investigate the applications of mindfulness as having a sign or as signless, as having a mental object or as signless, as having a mental object or as without a mental object, as calm or as not calm, as empty or as not empty, as having a goal or as being without a goal, as having a basis or as without a basis.

original: na smṛtyupasthānāni śāntānīty upaparīkṣate nāśāntānīti /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthānāni śāntāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāni iti
translated: He does not investigate the applications of mindfulness as peaceful or as not peaceful.

original: na smṛtyupasthānāni viviktānīty upaparīkṣate nāviviktānīti /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthānāni viviktāni iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the applications of mindfulness are secluded or not secluded.

original: na samyakprahāṇāni nityānīty upaparīkṣate nānityānīti /
analyzed: na samyakprahāṇāni nityāni iti upaparīkṣate na anityāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the right efforts are permanent or impermanent.

original: na samyakprahāṇāni sukhānīty upaparīkṣate na duḥkhānīti /
analyzed: na samyakprahāṇāni sukhāni iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the right efforts are happiness or suffering.

original: na samyakprahāṇāny ātmānīty upaparīkṣate nānātmānīti /
analyzed: na samyakprahāṇāni ātmāni iti upaparīkṣate na anātmāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the right efforts are a self or not a self.

original: na samyakprahāṇāni śubhānīty upaparīkṣate nāśubhānīti /
analyzed: na samyak prahāṇāni śubhāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the right efforts are good or not good.

original: na samyakprahāṇāni śūnyānīty upaparīkṣate nāśūnyānīti /🔽na samyakprahāṇāni nimittānīty upaparīkṣate nānimittānīti /
analyzed: na samyakprahāṇāni śūnyāni iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāni iti  na samyakprahāṇāni nimittāni iti upaparīkṣate na animittāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the right efforts are empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether the right efforts are signs or signless.

original: na samyakprahāṇāni praṇihitānīty upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitānīti /🔽na samyakprahāṇāni śāntānīty upaparīkṣate nāśāntānīti /
analyzed: na samyakprahāṇāni praṇihitāni iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāni iti  na samyakprahāṇāni śāntāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the right efforts are wished for or not wished for.🔽He does not investigate whether the right efforts are calm or not calm.

original: na samyakprahāṇāni viviktānīty upaparīkṣate nāviviktānīti /
analyzed: na samyakprahāṇāni viviktāni iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the right efforts are secluded or not secluded.

original: narddhipādān nityā ity upaparīkṣate nānityā iti /
analyzed: na ṛddhipādān nityāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anityāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the bases of spiritual power are permanent or impermanent.

original: narddhipādān sukhā ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti /
analyzed: na ṛddhipādān sukhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the bases of spiritual power are happiness or suffering.

original: narddhipādān ātmāna ity upaparīkṣate nātmāna iti /
analyzed: na ṛddhipādān ātmānaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na ātmānaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the bases of spiritual power are a self or not a self.

original: narddhipādān śubhā ity upaparīkṣate nāśubhā iti /
analyzed: na ṛddhipādān śubhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the bases of spiritual power are beautiful or not beautiful.

original: narddhipādān śūnyā ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyā iti /
analyzed: na ṛddhipādān śūnyāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the bases of spiritual power are empty or not empty.

original: narddhipādān nimittā ity upaparīkṣate nānimittā iti /
analyzed: na ṛddhipādān nimittāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na animittāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the bases of spiritual power are with signs or signless.🔽He does not investigate whether the bases of spiritual power are having a core or coreless.🔽He does not investigate whether the bases of spiritual power are calm or not calm.

original: narddhipādān praṇihitā ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitā iti narddhipādān śāntā ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntā iti /🔽narddhipādān viviktā ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktā iti /
analyzed: na ṛddhipādān praṇihitāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihitāḥ iti na ṛddhipādān śāntāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntāḥ iti  na ṛddhipādān viviktāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the bases of spiritual power are void or not void.

original: nendriyāṇi nityānīty upaparīkṣate nānityānīti /
analyzed: na indriyāṇi nityāni iti upaparīkṣate na anityāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the faculties are permanent or impermanent.

original: nendriyāṇi sukhānīty upaparīkṣate na duḥkhānīti /
analyzed: na indriyāṇi sukhāni iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the faculties are ease or stress.

original: nendriyāṇy ātmānīty upaparīkṣate nānātmānīti nendriyāṇi śubhānīty upaparīkṣate nāśubhānīti /
analyzed: na indriyāṇi ātmāni iti upaparīkṣate na anātmāni iti na indriyāṇi śubhāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the faculties are a self or not a self. He does not investigate whether the faculties are beautiful or not beautiful.

original: nendriyāṇi śūnyānīty upaparīkṣate nāśūnyānīti /
analyzed: na indriyāṇi śūnyāni iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the faculties are empty or not empty.

original: nendriyāṇi nimittānīty upaparīkṣate nānimittānīti nendriyāṇi praṇihitānīty upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitānīti /🔽nendriyāṇi śāntānīty upaparīkṣate nāśāntānīti /
analyzed: na indriyāṇi nimittāni iti upaparīkṣate na animittāni iti na indriyāṇi praṇihitāni iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāni iti  na indriyāṇi śāntāni iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the faculties are signs or signless, and he does not investigate whether the faculties are with or without aspirations.🔽He does not investigate whether the faculties are calm or not calm,

original: nendriyāṇi viviktānīty upaparīkṣate nāviviktānīti /
analyzed: na indriyāṇi viviktāni iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāni iti
translated: and he does not investigate whether the faculties are secluded or not secluded.

original: na balāni nityānīty upaparīkṣate nānityānīti /
analyzed: na balāni nityāni iti upaparīkṣate na anityāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the powers are permanent or impermanent,

original: na balāni sukhānīty upaparīkṣate na duḥkhānīti /
analyzed: na balāni sukhāni iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāni iti
translated: and he does not investigate whether the powers are happy or suffering.

original: na balāny ātmānīty upaparīkṣate nānātmānīti na balāni śubhānīty upaparīkṣate nāśubhānīti /🔽na balāni śūnyānīty ŚsP II
analyzed: na balāni ātmāni iti upaparīkṣate na anātmāni iti na balāni śubhāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāni iti  na balāni śūnyāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the powers are a self or not a self, and he does not investigate whether the powers are attractive or unattractive.

original: upaparīkṣate nāśūnyānīti /🔽na balāni nimittānīty upaparīkṣate nānimittānīti /🔽na balāni praṇihitānīty upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitānīti /
analyzed: upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāni iti  na balāni nimittāni iti upaparīkṣate na animittāni iti  na balāni praṇihitāni iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the powers are empty or not empty,🔽and he does not investigate whether the powers are with or without aspirations.🔽He does not investigate whether the powers are calm or not calm,

original: na balāni śāntānīty upaparīkṣate nāśāntānīti /🔽na balāni viviktānīty upaparīkṣate nāviviktānīti /
analyzed: na balāni śāntāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāni iti  na balāni viviktāni iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāni iti
translated: and he does not investigate whether the powers are secluded or not secluded.

original: na bodhyaṅgāni nityānīty upaparīkṣate nānityānīti /
analyzed: na bodhyaṅgāni nityāni iti upaparīkṣate na anityāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the limbs of awakening are permanent or impermanent,🔽and he does not investigate whether the limbs of awakening are happy or suffering.

original: na bodhyaṅgāni sukhānīty upaparīkṣate na duḥkhānīti /
analyzed: na bodhyaṅgāni sukhāni iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the factors of awakening are happiness or suffering.

original: na balāny ātmānīty upaparīkṣate nānātmānīti /
analyzed: na balāni ātmāni iti upaparīkṣate na anātmāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the powers are a self or not a self.

original: na bodhyaṅgāni śubhānīty upaparīkṣate nāśubhānīti /
analyzed: na bodhyaṅgāni śubhāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the factors of awakening are beautiful or ugly.

original: na bodhyaṅgāni śūnyānīty upaparīkṣate nāśūnyānīti /🔽na bodhyaṅgāni nimittānīty upaparīkṣate nānimittānīti /
analyzed: na bodhyaṅgāni śūnyāni iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāni iti  na bodhyaṅgāni nimittāni iti upaparīkṣate na a nimittāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the factors of awakening are empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether the factors of awakening have signs or are signless.

original: na bodhyaṅgāni praṇihitānīty upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitānīti /🔽na bodhyaṅgāni śāntānīty upaparīkṣate nāśāntānīti /
analyzed: na bodhyaṅgāni praṇihitāni iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāni iti  na bodhyaṅgāni śāntāni iti upaparīkṣate na a śāntāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the factors of awakening are wished for or not wished for.🔽He does not investigate whether the factors of awakening are calm or not calm.

original: na bodhyaṅgāni viviktānīty upaparīkṣate nāviviktānīti /
analyzed: na bodhyaṅgāni viviktāni iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the factors of awakening are isolated or not isolated.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ nitya ity upaparīkṣate nānitya iti /
analyzed: na āryā aṣṭāṅga mārgam nityaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anityaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble eightfold path is permanent or impermanent.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ sukha ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkha iti /
analyzed: nāryā aṣṭāṅga mārgam sukhe iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhe iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble eightfold path is happiness or suffering.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgam ātmety upaparīkṣate nānātmeti /
analyzed: ātmā iti upaparīkṣate na an ātmā iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble eightfold path is a self or not a self.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ śubha ity upaparīkṣate nāśubha iti /
analyzed: na āryā aṣṭāṅga mārgam śubhe iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhe iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble eightfold path is beautiful or ugly.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ śūnya ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnya iti /
analyzed: na āryā aṣṭāṅga mārgam śūnyaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble eightfold path is empty or not empty.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ nimitta ity upaparīkṣate nānimitta iti /
analyzed: na āryā aṣṭāṅga mārgam nimitte iti upaparīkṣate na animitte iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble eightfold path is a sign or signless.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ praṇihita ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihita iti /
analyzed: na āryā aṣṭāṅga mārgam praṇihitaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a praṇihitaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble eightfold path is intentional or not intentional.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ śānta ity upaparīkṣate nāśānta iti /
analyzed: nāryā aṣṭāṅga mārgam śāntaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble eightfold path is peaceful or not peaceful.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ vivikta ity upaparīkṣate nāvivikta iti /
analyzed: na āryā aṣṭāṅga mārgam vivikte iti upaparīkṣate na a vivikte iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble eightfold path is secluded or not secluded.

original: nāryasatyāni nityānīty upaparīkṣate nānityānīti /
analyzed: na ari asatyāni nityāni iti upaparīkṣate na anityāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble truths are permanent or impermanent.

original: nāryasatyāni sukhānīty upaparīkṣate na duḥkhānīti /
analyzed: na ari asatyāni sukhāni iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble truths are happiness or suffering.

original: nāryasatyāny ātmānīty upaparīkṣate nānātmānīti /
analyzed: na ari asatyāni ātmāni iti upaparīkṣate na anātmāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble truths have a self or are self-less.

original: nāryasatyāni śubhānīty upaparīkṣate nāśubhānīti /
analyzed: na ari asatyāni śubhāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble truths are good or bad.

original: nāryasatyāni śūnyānīty upaparīkṣate nāśūnyānīti /🔽nāryasatyāni nimittānīty upaparīkṣate nānimittānīti /
analyzed: na ari asatyāni śūnyāni iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāni iti  na ari asatyāni nimittāni iti upaparīkṣate na animittāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble truths are empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether the noble truths are a sign or signless.

original: nāryasatyāni praṇihitānīty upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitānīti /🔽nāryasatyāni śāntānīty upaparīkṣate nāśāntānīti /
analyzed: na ari asatyāni praṇihitāni iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāni iti  na ari asatyāni śāntāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble truths are intentional or not intentional.🔽He does not investigate whether the noble truths are peaceful or not peaceful.

original: nāryasatyāni viviktānīty upaparīkṣate nāviviktānīti /
analyzed: na ari asatyāni viviktāni iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the noble truths are secluded or not secluded.

original: na dhyānāni nityānīty upaparīkṣate nānityānīti /
analyzed: na dhyānāni nityāni iti upaparīkṣate na anityāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the concentrations are permanent or impermanent.

original: na dhyānāni sukhānīty upaparīkṣate na duḥkhānīti /
analyzed: na dhyānāni sukhāni iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the concentrations are happiness or suffering.

original: na dhyānāny ātmānīty upaparīkṣate nānātmānīti /
analyzed: na dhyānāni ātmāni iti upaparīkṣate na anātmāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the concentrations have a self or are without a self.

original: na dhyānāni śubhānīty upaparīkṣate nāśubhānīti /
analyzed: na dhyānāni śubhāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the concentrations are good or bad.

original: na dhyānāni śūnyānīty upaparīkṣate nāśūnyānīti /🔽na dhyānāni nimittānīty upaparīkṣate nānimittānīti /
analyzed: na dhyānāni śūnyāni iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāni iti  na dhyānāni nimittāni iti upaparīkṣate na animittāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the concentrations are empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether the concentrations have signs or are signless.

original: na dhyānāni praṇihitānīty upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitānīti /🔽na dhyānāni śāntānīty upaparīkṣate nāśāntānīti /
analyzed: na dhyānāni praṇihitāni iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāni iti  na dhyānāni śāntāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the concentrations have wishes or are wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether the concentrations are calm or not calm.

original: na dhyānāni viviktānīty upaparīkṣate nāviviktānīti /
analyzed: na dhyānāni viviktāni iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the concentrations are isolated or not isolated.

original: nāpramāṇāni nityānīty upaparīkṣate nānityānīti /
analyzed: na apramāṇāni nityāni iti upaparīkṣate na anityāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the immeasurables are permanent or impermanent.

original: nāpramāṇāni sukhānīty upaparīkṣate na duḥkhānīti /🔽nāpramāṇāny ātmānīty upaparīkṣate ŚsP II
analyzed: na apramāṇāni sukhāni iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāni iti  na apramāṇāni ātmāni iti upaparīkṣate
translated: He does not investigate whether the immeasurables are happiness or suffering.

original: nānātmānīti /
analyzed: nānā ātmāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the immeasurables have a self or are without a self.

original: nāpramāṇāni śubhānīty upaparīkṣate nāśubhānīti /
analyzed: na apramāṇāni śubhāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the immeasurables are good or bad.

original: nāpramāṇāni śūnyānīty upaparīkṣate nāśūnyānīti /
analyzed: na apramāṇāni śūnyāni iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the immeasurables are empty or not empty.

original: nāpramāṇāni nimittānīty upaparīkṣate nānimittānīti /
analyzed: na apramāṇāni nimittāni iti upaparīkṣate na animittāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] have signs or are signless.

original: nāpramāṇāni praṇihitānīty upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitānīti /🔽nāpramāṇāni śāntānīty upaparīkṣate nāśāntānīti /
analyzed: na apramāṇāni praṇihitāni iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāni iti  na apramāṇāni śāntāni iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without wishes.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are calm or not calm.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are void or not void.

original: nāpramāṇāni viviktānīty upaparīkṣate nāviviktānīti /🔽nārūpyasamāpattīr nityā ity upaparīkṣate nānityā iti /
analyzed: na apramāṇāni viviktāni iti upaparīkṣate na aviviktāni iti  na ārūpya samāpattīḥ nityāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anityāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are worldly or supramundane.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are conditioned or unconditioned.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.

original: nārūpyasamāpattīḥ sukhā ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti /🔽nārūpyasamāpattī ātmāna ity upaparīkṣate nānātmāna iti /🔽nārūpyasamāpattīḥ śubhā ity upaparīkṣate nāśubhā iti /
analyzed: na ārūpya samāpattīḥ sukhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāḥ iti  na ārūpya samāpattī ātmānaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anātmānaḥ iti  na ārūpya samāpattīḥ śubhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.

original: nārūpyasamāpattīḥ śūnyā ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyā iti /🔽nārūpyasamāpattīr nimittā ity upaparīkṣate nānimittā iti /🔽nārūpyasamāpattīḥ praṇihitā ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitā iti /
analyzed: na ārūpya samāpattīḥ śūnyāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāḥ iti  na ārūpya samāpattīḥ nimittāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na animittāḥ iti  na ārūpya samāpattīḥ praṇihitāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.

original: nārūpyasamāpattīḥ śāntā ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntā iti /
analyzed: na ārūpya samāpattīḥ śāntāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or without outflows.🔽He does not investigate whether the formless [absorptions] are with or

original: nārūpyasamāpattīr viviktā ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktā iti /
analyzed: na ārūpya samāpattīḥ viviktāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the formless attainments are secluded or not secluded.

original: nāṣṭau vimokṣān nityā ity upaparīkṣate nānityā iti /
analyzed: na aṣṭau vimokṣān nityāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anityāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the eight liberations are permanent or impermanent.

original: nāṣṭau vimokṣān sukhā ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti /
analyzed: na aṣṭau vimokṣān sukhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the eight liberations are happiness or suffering.

original: nāṣṭau vimokṣān ātmāna ity upaparīkṣate nānātmāna iti /
analyzed: na aṣṭau vimokṣān ātmānaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anātmānaḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the eight liberations are a self or not a self.

original: nāṣṭau vimokṣān śubhā ity upaparīkṣate nāśubhā iti /
analyzed: na aṣṭau vimokṣān śubhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the eight liberations are beautiful or ugly.

original: nāṣṭau vimokṣān śūnyā ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyā iti /🔽nāṣṭau vimokṣān nimittā ity upaparīkṣate nānimittā iti /
analyzed: na aṣṭau vimokṣān śūnyāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāḥ iti  na aṣṭau vimokṣān nimittāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na animittāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the eight liberations are empty or not empty.🔽He does not investigate whether the eight liberations have signs or are signless.

original: nāṣṭau vimokṣān praṇihitā ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitā iti /🔽nāṣṭau vimokṣān śāntā ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntā iti /
analyzed: na aṣṭau vimokṣān praṇihitāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāḥ iti  na aṣṭau vimokṣān śāntāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the eight liberations have wishes or are wishless.🔽He does not investigate whether the eight liberations are calm or not calm.

original: nāṣṭau vimokṣān viviktā ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktā iti /
analyzed: na aṣṭau vimokṣān viviktāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the eight liberations are void or not void.

original: na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīr nityā ity upaparīkṣate nānityā iti na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīḥ sukhā ity upaparīkṣate na duḥkhā iti /
analyzed: na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ nityāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anityāḥ iti na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ sukhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the nine successive abodes are permanent or impermanent, or whether they are happiness or suffering.

original: na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīr ātmāna ity upaparīkṣate nānātmāna iti na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīḥ śubhā ity upaparīkṣate nāśubhā iti /🔽na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīḥ śūnyā ity upaparīkṣate nāśūnyā iti /
analyzed: na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ ātmānaḥ iti upaparīkṣate na anātmānaḥ iti na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ śubhāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśubhāḥ iti  na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ śūnyāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a śūnyāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the nine successive abodes of meditative absorption are a self or not a self, or whether they are pure or impure.

original: na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīr nimittā ity upaparīkṣate nānimittā iti /🔽na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīḥ praṇihitā ity upaparīkṣate nāpraṇihitā iti /
analyzed: na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ nimittāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na animittāḥ iti  na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ praṇihitāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na apraṇihitāḥ iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the nine successive abodes of meditative absorption are empty or not empty,🔽whether they are with signs or signless,🔽whether they are with wishes or wishless,🔽whether they are calm or not calm,

original: na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīḥ śāntā ity upaparīkṣate nāśāntā iti /🔽na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīr viviktā ity upaparīkṣate nāviviktā iti /
analyzed: na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ śāntāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na aśāntāḥ iti  na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ viviktāḥ iti upaparīkṣate na a viviktāḥ iti
translated: whether they are void or not void.

original: na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni nityānīty upaparīkṣate nānityānīti /🔽na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni sukhānīty upaparīkṣate na duḥkhānīti /
analyzed: na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni nityāni iti upaparīkṣate na anityāni iti 🔽na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni sukhāni iti upaparīkṣate na duḥkhāni iti
translated: He does not investigate whether the three doors of liberation - emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness - are permanent or impermanent,🔽whether they are easeful or troublesome,
