translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the feeling born from tongue-contact is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā kāyasaṃsparśajāvedanānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyā kāya saṃsparśa jā vedanā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the feeling born from body-contact is not one thing and the non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva kāyasaṃsparśajāvedanā kāyasaṃsparśajāvedanaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva kāya saṃsparśa jā vedanā kāya saṃsparśa jā vedanā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: The sensation born from the contact of the body is itself non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate kāyasaṃsparśajāvedanety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate kāya saṃsparśa jā āvedanā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of what is called the sensation born from the contact of the body is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā manaḥsaṃsparśajāvedanānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyā manaḥ saṃsparśa jā vedanā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the sensation born from the contact of the mind is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva manaḥsaṃsparśajāvedanā manaḥsaṃsparśajāvedanaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva manaḥ saṃsparśa jā vedanā manaḥ saṃsparśa jā vedanā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the sensation born from the contact of the mind. The sensation born from the contact of the mind is itself non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate manaḥsaṃsparśajāvedanety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate manaḥ saṃsparśa jā āvedanā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of what is called the sensation born from the contact of the mind is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyaḥ pṛthivīdhātur anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ pṛthivī dhātuḥ anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the earth element is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva pṛthivīdhātuḥ pṛthivīdhātur evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva pṛthivī dhātuḥ pṛthivī dhātuḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the earth element. The earth element is itself non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyate pṛthivīdhātur ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate pṛthivī dhātuḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of what is called the earth element is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyo 'bdhātur anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ b dhātuḥ anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Because the water element is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evābdhātur abdhātur evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva ap dhātuḥ ap dhātuḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the water element. The water element is itself non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyate 'bdhātur ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the water element is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyas tejodhātur anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ tejaḥ dhātuḥ anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the fire element is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva tejodhātuḥ tejodhātur evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva tejaḥ dhātuḥ tejaḥ dhātuḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the fire element; the fire element itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyate tejodhātur ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā / tathā hi ŚsP II
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate tejaḥ dhātuḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā tathā hi
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the fire element is reckoned as non-dual.

original: nānyo vāyudhātur anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: na anyaḥ vāyu dhātuḥ anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Because the wind element is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva vāyudhātur vāyudhātur evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva vāyu dhātuḥ vāyu dhātuḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the wind element; the wind element itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyate vāyudhātur ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate vāyu dhātuḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the wind element is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānya ākāśadhātur anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ ākāśa dhātuḥ anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the space element is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evākāśadhātur ākāśadhātur evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva ākāśa dhātuḥ ākāśa dhātuḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the space element; the space element itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyate ākāśadhātur ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate ākāśa dhātuḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the space element is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyo vijñānadhātur anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ vijñāna dhātuḥ anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Because the element of consciousness is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva vijñānadhātur vijñānadhātur evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva vijñāna dhātuḥ vijñāna dhātuḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the element of consciousness; the element of consciousness itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyate vijñānadhātur ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate vijñāna dhātuḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the element of consciousness is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāvidyānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anya avidyā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because ignorance is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evāvidyāvidyaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva avidyā avidyā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is ignorance; ignorance itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate 'vidyety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate vidyā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called ignorance is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānye saṃskārā anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anye saṃskārāḥ anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because formations are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva saṃskārāḥ saṃskārā evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva saṃskārāḥ saṃskārāḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is formations; formations themselves are non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ya ima ucyate saṃskārā ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ye ime ucyate saṃskārāḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called formations is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyad vijñānam anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyat vijñānam anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because consciousness is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva vijñānaṃ vijñānam evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva vijñānam vijñānam eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is consciousness; consciousness itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad etad ucyate vijñānam ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat etat ucyate vijñānam iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of what is called consciousness is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyan nāmarūpam anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyat nāma rūpam anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Because name-and-form is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva nāmarūpaṃ nāmarūpam evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva nāma rūpam nāma rūpam eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is name-and-form, name-and-form itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad etad ucyate nāmarūpam ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat etat ucyate nāma rūpam iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of what is called name-and-form is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyaḥ ṣaḍāyatanam anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ ṣaṣ āyatanam anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Because the six sense sources are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva ṣaḍāyatanaṃ ṣaḍāyatanam evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva ṣaṣ āyatanam ṣaṣ āyatanam eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the six sense sources, the six sense sources themselves are non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad etad ucyate ṣaḍāyatanam ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat etat ucyate ṣaṣ āyatanam iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of what is called the six sense sources is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyaḥ sparśo 'nyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ sparśaḥ nyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because contact is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva sparśaḥ sparśa evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva sparśaḥ sparśaḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is contact, contact itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyate sparśa ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā / tathā hi nānyā vedanānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate sparśaḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā tathā hi na anyā vedanā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of what is called contact is made for the non-dual. Because feeling is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva vedanā vedanaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva vedanā vedanā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Feeling itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate vedanety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate vedanā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called feeling is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā tṛṣṇānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyā tṛṣṇā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because craving is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva tṛṣṇā tṛṣṇaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva tṛṣṇā tṛṣṇā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Craving itself is non-arising, non-arising itself is craving.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate tṛṣṇety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate tṛṣṇā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called craving is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyad upādānam anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyat upādānam anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because clinging is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evopādānam upādānam evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva upādānam upādānam eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is clinging, clinging itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad etad ucyate upādānam ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat etat ucyate upādānam iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called clinging is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyo bhavo 'nyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ bhavaḥ nyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because existence is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva bhavo bhava evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva bhavaḥ bhavaḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Existence itself is non-arising, non-arising itself is existence.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyate bhava ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā ŚsP II
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate bhavaḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called existence is reckoned as non-dual.

original: kṛtā / tathā hi nānyā jātir anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtā tathā hi na anyā jātiḥ anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because birth is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva jātir jātir evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva jātiḥ jātiḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is birth; birth itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate jātir ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate jātiḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called birth is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyaj jarāmaraṇaṃ 'nyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyat jarā maraṇam
translated: Because old age and death are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva jarāmaraṇaṃ jarāmaraṇam evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva jarā maraṇam jarā maraṇam eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is old age and death; old age and death itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad etad ucyate jarāmaraṇam ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat etat ucyate jarā maraṇam iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called old age and death is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā dānapāramitānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā dāna pāramitā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the perfection of giving is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva dānapāramitā dānapāramitaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva dāna pāramitā dāna pāramitā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the perfection of giving; the perfection of giving itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate dānapāramitety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate dāna pāramitā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the perfection of giving is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā śīlapāramitānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā śīla pāramitā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the perfection of morality is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva śīlapāramitā śīlapāramitaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva śīla pāramitā śīla pāramitā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the perfection of morality; the perfection of morality itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate śīlapāramitety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate śīla pāramitā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the perfection of morality is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā kṣāntipāramitānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā kṣānti pāramitā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For it is not that the perfection of patience is one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva kṣāntipāramitā kṣāntipāramitaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva kṣānti pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the perfection of patience; the perfection of patience itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate kṣāntipāramitety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate kṣānti pāramitā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the perfection of patience is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā vīryapāramitānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyā vīrya pāramitā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For it is not that the perfection of effort is one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva vīryapāramitā vīryapāramitaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva vīrya pāramitā vīrya pāramitā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the perfection of effort; the perfection of effort itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate vīryapāramitety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate vīrya pāramitā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the perfection of effort is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā dhyānapāramitānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā dhyāna pāramitā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For it is not that the perfection of concentration is one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva dhyānapāramitā dhyānapāramitaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva dhyāna pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the perfection of concentration; the perfection of concentration itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate dhyānapāramitety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate dhyāna pāramitā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the perfection of concentration is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā prajñāpāramitānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyā prajñāpāramitā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For it is not that the perfection of wisdom is one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva prajñāpāramitā prajñāpāramitaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva prajñāpāramitā prajñāpāramitā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the perfection of wisdom; the perfection of wisdom itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate prajñāpāramitety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate prajñāpāramitā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: “In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the enumeration of the non-dual is made with respect to what is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: tathā hi nānyādhyātmaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anya adhyātma śūnyatā anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: It is because emptiness of internal phenomena is not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda evādhyātmaśūnyatādhyātmaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva adhyātma śūnyatā adhyātma śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production is itself the emptiness of internal phenomena, and the emptiness of internal phenomena is itself non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate 'dhyātmaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate dhyā ātma śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the enumeration of the non-dual is made with respect to what is called the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: tathā hi nānyā bahirdhāśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā bahirdhā śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: It is because emptiness of external phenomena is not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda eva bahirdhāśūnyatā bahirdhāśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva bahirdhā śūnyatā bahirdhā śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production is itself the emptiness of external phenomena, and the emptiness of external phenomena is itself non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate bahirdhāśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /🔽tathā hi nānyādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate bahirdhā śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā  tathā hi na anya adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the enumeration of the non-dual is made with respect to what is called the emptiness of external phenomena.🔽It is because emptiness of external and internal phenomena is not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda evādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production is itself the emptiness of external and internal phenomena, and the emptiness of external and internal phenomena is itself non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this which is said to be external emptiness is a calculation of non-duality.

original: tathā hi nānyā śūnyatāśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā śūnyatā aśūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because emptiness of emptiness is not different from non-production.

original: anutpāda eva śūnyatāśūnyatā śūnyatāśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva śūnyatā aśūnyatā śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the emptiness of emptiness, and the emptiness of emptiness is itself non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra ŚsP II
analyzed: anena āyuṣman chāradvatīputra
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate śūnyatāśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate śūnyatā aśūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: this which is said to be the emptiness of emptiness is a calculation of non-duality.

original: tathā hi nānyā mahāśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā mahāśūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because great emptiness is not different from non-production.

original: anutpāda eva mahāśūnyatā mahāśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva mahāśūnyatā mahāśūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is great emptiness, and great emptiness is itself non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate mahāśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate mahā śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this which is said to be great emptiness is a calculation of non-duality.

original: tathā hi nānyā paramārthaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā paramārtha śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because emptiness of the ultimate is not different from non-production.

original: anutpāda eva paramārthaśūnyatā paramārthaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva paramārtha śūnyatā paramārtha śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the emptiness of the ultimate, and the emptiness of the ultimate is itself non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate paramārthaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate paramārtha śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this which is said to be the emptiness of the ultimate is a calculation of non-duality.

original: tathā hi nānyā saṃskṛtaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā saṃskṛta śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For example, emptiness of the conditioned is not one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva saṃskṛtaśūnyatā saṃskṛtaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva saṃskṛta śūnyatā saṃskṛta śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the emptiness of the conditioned, and the emptiness of the conditioned itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate saṃskṛtaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate saṃskṛta śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called the emptiness of the conditioned is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anya asaṃskṛta śūnyatā anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: For example, emptiness of the unconditioned is not one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāsaṃskṛtaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ evā asaṃskṛta śūnyatā asaṃskṛta śūnyatā evā anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the emptiness of the unconditioned, and the emptiness of the unconditioned itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate 'saṃskṛtaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate saṃskṛta śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called the emptiness of the unconditioned is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyātyantaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anya atyanta śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For example, the emptiness of the ultimate is not one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evātyantaśūnyatātyantaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva atyanta śūnyatā atyanta śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the emptiness of the ultimate, and the emptiness of the ultimate itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate 'tyantaśūnyatā advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate tyanta śūnyatā advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called the emptiness of the ultimate is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyānavarāgraśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyān avara agra śūnyatā anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: For example, the emptiness of the endless and beginningless is not one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evānavarāgraśūnyatā navarāgraśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ evā an avara agra śūnyatā na vara agra śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the emptiness of the endless and beginningless, and the emptiness of the endless and beginningless itself is non-arising.🔽For example, the emptiness of the endless and beginningless is not one thing, and non-arising another.🔽Non-arising itself is the emptiness of the endless and beginningless, and the emptiness of the endless and beginningless itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate anavarāgraśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate an avara agra śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the emptiness of no beginning or end is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā anavakāraśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā anavakāra śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For thus, the emptiness of no beginning or end is not one thing, and non-production another.

original: anutpāda eva anavakāraśūnyatā anavakāraśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva anavakāra śūnyatā anavakāra śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the emptiness of no beginning or end, and the emptiness of no beginning or end itself is non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate 'navakāraśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate nava kāra śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the emptiness of no beginning or end is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā prakṛtiśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā prakṛti śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For thus, the natural emptiness is not one thing, and non-production another.

original: anutpāda eva prakṛtiśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva prakṛti śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is natural emptiness, and natural emptiness itself is non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate prakṛtiśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate prakṛti śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called natural emptiness is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā sarvadharmaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā sarva dharma śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For thus, the emptiness of all phenomena is not one thing, and non-production another.

original: anutpāda eva sarvadharmaśūnyatā sarvadharmaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva sarva dharma śūnyatā sarva dharma śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the emptiness of all phenomena, and the emptiness of all phenomena itself is non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate sarvadharmaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate sarva dharma śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: “In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the calculation of non-duality is made with regard to what is called the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: tathā hi nānyā svalakṣaṇaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the emptiness of intrinsic nature is not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda eva svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā svalakṣaṇaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the emptiness of intrinsic nature, and the emptiness of intrinsic nature itself is non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate svalakṣaṇaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the calculation of non-duality is made with regard to what is called the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: tathā hi nānyānupalambhaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anya anupalambha śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the emptiness of non-apprehension is not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda evānupalambhaśūnyatānupalambhaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva anupalambha śūnyatā anupalambha śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the emptiness of non-apprehension, and the emptiness of non-apprehension itself is non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate 'nupalambhaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the calculation of non-duality is made with regard to what is called the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: tathā hi nānyābhāvaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ / anutpāda ŚsP II
analyzed: tathā hi na anya abhāva śūnyatā anyaḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: Because the emptiness of non-existence is not one thing and non-production another.

original: evābhāvaśūnyatābhāvaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: eva abhāva śūnyatā abhāva śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the emptiness of non-existence, and the emptiness of non-existence itself is non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate 'bhāvaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate bhāva śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the calculation of non-duality is made with regard to what is called the emptiness of non-existence.

original: tathā hi nānyā svabhāvaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā svabhāva śūnyatā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because emptiness of inherent nature is not one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva svabhāvaśūnyatā svabhāvaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva svabhāva śūnyatā svabhāva śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising is itself emptiness of inherent nature, and emptiness of inherent nature is itself non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate svabhāvaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate svabhāva śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called emptiness of inherent nature is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anya abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Because the emptiness of inherent nature of non-existence is not one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising is itself the emptiness of inherent nature of non-existence, and the emptiness of inherent nature of non-existence is itself non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate 'bhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate bhāva svabhāva śūnyatā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called the emptiness of inherent nature of non-existence is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāni smṛtyupasthānāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni smṛti upasthānāni anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the establishments of mindfulness are not one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva smṛtyupasthānāni smṛtyupasthānāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva smṛti upasthānāni smṛti upasthānāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising is itself the establishments of mindfulness, and the establishments of mindfulness are themselves non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad imāny ucyante smṛtyupasthānānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat imāni ucyante smṛti upasthānāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what are called the establishments of mindfulness are reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāni samyakprahāṇāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni samyakprahāṇāni anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the right efforts are not one thing, and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva samyakprahāṇāni samyakprahāṇāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva samyakprahāṇāni samyakprahāṇāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: The right efforts are themselves non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad imāny ucyante samyakprahāṇānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat imāni ucyante samyak prahāṇāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what are called the right efforts are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānya ṛddhipādā anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anye ṛddhipādāḥ anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the bases of spiritual power are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpādā eva ṛddhipādā ṛddhipādā evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādāḥ eva ṛddhipādāḥ ṛddhipādāḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the bases of spiritual power, and the bases of spiritual power are non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ya ima ucyante ṛddhipādā ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ye ime ucyante ṛddhipādāḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what are called the bases of spiritual power are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyānīndriyāṇy anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni indriyāṇi anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the spiritual faculties are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evendriyāṇīndriyāṇy evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva indriyāṇi indriyāṇi eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the spiritual faculties, and the spiritual faculties are non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad imāny ucyante indriyāṇīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat imāni ucyante indriyāṇi iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what are called the spiritual faculties are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāni balāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni balāni anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the powers are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva balāni balāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva balāni balāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the powers, and the powers are non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad imāny ucyante balānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat imāni ucyante balāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what are called the powers are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāni bodhyaṅgāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni bodhyaṅgāni anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For the factors of awakening are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva bodhyaṅgāni bodhyaṅgāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva bodhyaṅgāni bodhyaṅgāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the factors of awakening, and the factors of awakening are non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad imāny ucyante bodhyaṅgānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat imāni ucyante bodhyaṅgāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what are called the factors of awakening are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānya āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgo 'nyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ ārya aṣṭa aṅgaḥ mārgaḥ nyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For the noble eightfold path is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaḥ āryāṣṭāṅgamārga evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgaḥ ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgaḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the noble eightfold path, and the noble eightfold path is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyata āryāṣṭāṅgamārga ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgaḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called the noble eightfold path is counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāny āryasatyāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni ārya satyāni anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For the noble truths are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evāryasatyāny āryasatyāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva ārya satyāni ārya satyāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the noble truths, and the noble truths are non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad imāny ucyanta āryasatyānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat imāni ucyante ārya satyāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what are called the noble truths are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāni dhyānāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni dhyānāni anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For the concentrations are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva dhyānāni dhyānāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva dhyānāni dhyānāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the concentrations, and the concentrations are non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad imāny ucyante dhyānānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā / ŚsP II
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat imāni ucyante dhyānāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of these called meditative concentrations is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāny apramāṇāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni apramāṇāni anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the immeasurables are not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda evāpramāṇāny apramāṇāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva apramāṇāni apramāṇāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the immeasurables, and the immeasurables are themselves non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad imāny ucyante pramāṇānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat imāni ucyante pramāṇāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of these called immeasurables is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā ārūpyasamāpattayo 'nyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ nyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the formless concentrations are not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda evārūpyasamāpattaya ārūpyasamāpattaya evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva ārūpya samāpattayaḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the formless concentrations, and the formless concentrations are themselves non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad ima ucyante ārūpyasamāpattaya ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat ime ucyante ārūpya samāpattayaḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of these called formless concentrations is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānye vimokṣā anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anye vimokṣāḥ anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the liberations are not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda eva vimokṣā vimokṣā evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva vimokṣāḥ vimokṣāḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the liberations, and the liberations are themselves non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ya ima ucyante vimokṣā ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ye ime ucyante vimokṣāḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the calculation of these called liberations is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyānupūrvavihārasamāpattayo 'nyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anya anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ nyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the successive stages of meditative absorption are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evānupūrvavihārasamāpattayo 'nupūrvavihārasamāpattaya evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ nupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the successive stages of meditative absorption, and the successive stages of meditative absorption are themselves non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ya imā ucyante 'nupūrvavihārasamāpattaya ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ye imāḥ ucyante nupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the successive stages of meditative absorption, which are said to be these, are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāny śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni anyaḥ
translated: Because the doors to liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the doors to liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the doors to liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are themselves non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad imāny ucyante śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat imāni ucyante śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the doors to liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, which are said to be these, are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā abhijñānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāḥ abhijñānyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the higher knowledges are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evābhijñā abhijñā evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva abhijñā abhijñā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the higher knowledges, and the higher knowledges are themselves non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā imā ucyante abhijñā ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yāḥ imāḥ ucyante abhijñāḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the designation of these so-called higher knowledges is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānye samādhayo 'nyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anye samādhayaḥ nyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the concentrations are not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda eva samādhayaḥ samādhaya evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva samādhayaḥ samādhayaḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the concentrations, and the concentrations themselves are non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ya imā ucyante samādhaya ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ye imāḥ ucyante samādhayaḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the designation of these so-called concentrations is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāni dhāraṇīmukhāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni dhāraṇīmukhāni anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Because the dhāraṇī gateways are not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda eva dhāraṇīmukhāni dhāraṇīmukhāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva dhāraṇīmukhāni dhāraṇīmukhāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the dhāraṇī gateways, and the dhāraṇī gateways themselves are non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yānīmāny ucyante dhāraṇīmukhānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yāni imāni ucyante dhāraṇīmukhāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the designation of these so-called dhāraṇī gateways is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāni tathāgatabalāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni tathāgata balāni anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the powers of the Tathāgata are not one thing and non-production another.

original: anutpāda eva tathāgatabalāni tathāgatabalāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva tathāgata balāni tathāgata balāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-production itself is the powers of the Tathāgata, and the powers of the Tathāgata themselves are non-production.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yānīmāny ucyante tathāgatabalānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yāni imāni ucyante tathāgata balāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the designation of these so-called powers of the Tathāgata is made for the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyāni vaiśāradyāny anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyāni vaiśāradyāni anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the fearlessnesses are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva vaiśāradyāni vaiśāradyāny evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva vaiśāradyāni vaiśāradyāni eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the fearlessnesses, and the fearlessnesses are just non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yānīmāny ucyante vaiśāradyānīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yāni imāni ucyante vaiśāradyāni iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what are called the fearlessnesses are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyo pratisaṃvido 'nyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ nyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Because the analytical knowledges are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva pratisaṃvidaḥ pratisaṃvida evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva pratisaṃvidaḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the analytical knowledges, and the analytical knowledges are just non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ya imā ucyante pratisaṃvida ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ye imāḥ ucyante pratisaṃvidaḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what are called the analytical knowledges are counted as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā mahāmaitry anyo 'nutpādaḥ /🔽anutpāda eva mahāmaitrī mahāmaitry ŚsP II
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā mahāmaitrī anyaḥ nutpādaḥ  anutpādaḥ eva mahāmaitrī mahāmaitrī
translated: Because great love is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is great love, and great love is just non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate mahāmaitrīty advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /🔽tathā hi nānyā mahākaruṇā nyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate mahāmaitrī iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā  tathā hi na anyā mahā karuṇā nyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called great love is counted as non-dual.🔽Because great compassion is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva mahākaruṇā mahākaruṇaivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva mahā karuṇā mahā karuṇā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is great compassion, and great compassion is just non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate mahākaruṇety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate mahākaruṇā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: “In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the calculation of what is called great compassion is made for the sake of the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānya āveṇikabuddhadharmā anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyaḥ āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the unique qualities of a Buddha are not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda evāveṇikabuddhadharmā āveṇikabuddhadharmā evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the unique qualities of a Buddha, and the unique qualities of a Buddha are themselves non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ya imā ucyante āveṇikabuddhadharmā ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa ye imāḥ ucyante āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the calculation of what is called the unique qualities of a Buddha is made for the sake of the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyat srotaāpattiphalam anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyat srotaāpatti phalam anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the fruit of entering the stream is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva srotaāpattiphalaṃ srotaāpattiphalam evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva srotaāpatti phalam srotaāpatti phalam eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the fruit of entering the stream, and the fruit of entering the stream is itself non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad etad ucyate śrotraāpattiphalam ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat etat ucyate śrotra āpatti phalam iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the calculation of what is called the fruit of entering the stream is made for the sake of the non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyat sakṛdāgāmiphalam anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyat sakṛdāgāmi phalam anyaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Because the fruit of being tied to one more birth is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalam evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva sakṛdāgāmi phalam sakṛdāgāmi phalam eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the fruit of being tied to one more birth, and the fruit of being tied to one more birth is itself non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad etad ucyate sakṛdāgāmiphalam ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat etat ucyate sakṛdāgāmi phalam iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: “In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called the fruit of being a once-returner is reckoned as nondual.🔽Because the fruit of being a once-returner is not one thing and nonarising another.🔽Nonarising itself is the fruit of being a once-returner, and the fruit of being a once-returner itself is nonarising.🔽“In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called the fruit of being a non-returner is reckoned as nondual.

original: tathā hi nānyad anāgāmiphalam anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyat anāgāmi phalam anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because the fruit of being a non-returner is not one thing and nonarising another.

original: anutpāda evānāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalam evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva anāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Nonarising itself is the fruit of being a non-returner, and the fruit of being a non-returner itself is nonarising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad etad ucyate 'nāgāmiphalam ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat etat ucyate na āgāmi phalam iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: “In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called the fruit of being an arhat is reckoned as nondual.

original: tathā hi nānyad arhattvam anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyat arhat tvam anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because arhatship is not one thing and nonarising another.

original: anutpāda evārhattvam arhattvam evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva arhat tvam arhat tvam eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Nonarising itself is arhatship, and arhatship itself is nonarising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yad etad ucyate 'rhattvam ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yat etat ucyate rhat tvam iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: “In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called individual enlightenment is reckoned as nondual.

original: tathā hi nānyā pratyekabodhir anyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi nā anyā pratyeka bodhiḥ anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Because individual enlightenment is not one thing and nonarising another.

original: anutpāda eva pratyekabodhiḥ pratyekabodhir evānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva pratyeka bodhiḥ pratyeka bodhiḥ eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Nonarising itself is individual enlightenment, and individual enlightenment itself is nonarising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yo 'yam ucyate pratyekabodhir ity advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yaḥ yam ucyate pratyeka bodhiḥ iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: “In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is called individual enlightenment is reckoned as nondual.

original: tathā hi nānyā sarvajñatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyā sarvajña tā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For thus, the knowledge of all aspects is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva sarvajñatā sarvajñataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva sarvajña tā sarvajña tā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the knowledge of all aspects; the knowledge of all aspects itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate sarvajñatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate sarvajña tā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the knowledge of all aspects is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā mārgākārajñatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyā mārga ākāra jña tā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For thus, the knowledge of the aspects of the path is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva mārgākārajñatā mārgākārajñataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva mārga ākāra jña tā mārga ākāra jña tā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the knowledge of the aspects of the path; the knowledge of the aspects of the path itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate mārgākārajñatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate mārga ākāra jña tā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the knowledge of the aspects of the path is reckoned as non-dual.

original: tathā hi nānyā sarvākārajñatānyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyā sarva ākāra jña tā anyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: For thus, the knowledge of all aspects is not one thing and non-arising another.

original: anutpāda eva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataivānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ eva sarva ākārajña tā sarva ākārajña tā eva anutpādaḥ
translated: Non-arising itself is the knowledge of all aspects; the knowledge of all aspects itself is non-arising.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yeyam ucyate sarvākārajñatety advayasyaiṣā gaṇanā kṛtā /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa yā iyam ucyate sarva ākāra jña tā iti advayasya eṣā gaṇanā kṛtā
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, that which is called the knowledge of all aspects is reckoned as non-dual.

original: ŚsP II
analyzed: śsp ii

original: athāyuṣman subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣman subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: yasmin samaye bhagavan bodhisattvo mahasattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann imān dharmān evam upaparīkṣate /
analyzed: yasmin samaye bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahasattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran imān dharmān evam upaparīkṣate
translated: Blessed One, at the time when a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom investigates these dharmas in this way,

original: tasmin samaye bhagavan rūpasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽vedanāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: tasmin samaye bhagavan rūpasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  vedanāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: at that time, Blessed One, he sees the non-arising of form, on account of its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of feeling, on account of its utter purity.

original: saṃjñāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: saṃjñāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of perception, on account of its utter purity.

original: saṃskārāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: saṃskārāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of volitional formations, on account of their utter purity.

original: vijñānasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽cakṣuṣo 'nutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: vijñānasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  cakṣuṣaḥ n utpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of consciousness, on account of its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the eye, on account of its utter purity.

original: śrotrasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽ghrāṇasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: śrotrasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  ghrāṇasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the ear, on account of its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the nose, on account of its utter purity.

original: jihvāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: jihvāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the tongue, on account of its utter purity.

original: kāyasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: kāyasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the body, on account of its utter purity.

original: manaso 'nutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: manasaḥ n utpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of mind, on account of its absolute purity.

original: rūpasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽śabdasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: rūpasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  śabdasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of form, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of sound, on account of its absolute purity.

original: gandhasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽rasasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: gandhasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  rasasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of smell, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of taste, on account of its absolute purity.

original: sparśasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽dharmāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sparśasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  dharmāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of touch, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of mental phenomena, on account of their absolute purity.

original: cakṣurvijñānasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽śrotravijñānasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽ghrāṇavijñānasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  śrotra vijñānasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  ghrāṇa vijñānasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of eye consciousness, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of ear consciousness, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of nose consciousness, on account of its absolute purity.

original: jihvāvijñānasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of tongue consciousness, on account of its absolute purity.

original: kāyavijñānasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: kāya vijñānasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of body consciousness, on account of its absolute purity.

original: manovijñānasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  cakṣuḥ saṃsparśasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of mind consciousness, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of eye contact, on account of its absolute purity.

original: śrotrasaṃsparśasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: śrotra saṃsparśasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  ghrāṇa saṃsparśasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of ear contact, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of nose contact, on account of its absolute purity.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of tongue contact, on account of its absolute purity.

original: kāyasaṃsparśasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of body contact, on account of its absolute purity.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of mind contact, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the feeling that arises from eye contact, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the feeling that arises from ear contact, on account of its absolute purity.

original: ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the feeling that arises from nose contact, on account of its absolute purity.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā ŚsP II 🔽anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ  anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of tongue contact as a condition for feeling, due to absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of body contact as a condition for feeling, due to absolute purity.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽pṛthivīdhātor anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽abdhātor anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  pṛthivī dhātoḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  ap dhātoḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of mind contact as a condition for feeling, due to absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the earth element, due to absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the water element, due to absolute purity.

original: tejodhātor anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽vāyudhātor anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātoḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  vāyu dhātoḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the fire element, due to absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the wind element, due to absolute purity.

original: ākāśadhātor anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽vijñānadhātor anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: ākāśa dhātoḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  vijñāna dhātoḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the space element, due to absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the consciousness element, due to absolute purity.

original: avidyāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: avidyāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of ignorance, due to absolute purity.

original: saṃskārāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: saṃskārāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of volitional formations, due to absolute purity.

original: vijñānasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: vijñānasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of consciousness, based on absolute purity.

original: nāmarūpasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽ṣaḍāyatanasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: nāma rūpasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  ṣaṣ āyatanasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of name-and-form, based on absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the six sense bases, based on absolute purity.

original: sparśasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sparśasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of contact, based on absolute purity.

original: vedanāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: vedanāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of feeling, based on absolute purity.

original: tṛṣṇāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽upādānasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  upādānasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of craving, based on absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of grasping, based on absolute purity.

original: bhavasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽jāter anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: bhavasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  jāteḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of becoming, based on absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of birth, based on absolute purity.

original: jarāmaraṇasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: jarā maraṇasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of old age and death, based on absolute purity.

original: dānapāramitāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the perfection of giving, based on absolute purity.

original: śīlapāramitāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: śīla pāramitāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the perfection of morality, based on absolute purity.

original: kṣāntipāramitāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽vīryapāramitāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  vīrya pāramitāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the perfection of patience, based on its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the perfection of effort, based on its utter purity.

original: dhyānapāramitāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the perfection of meditation, based on its utter purity.

original: prajñāpāramitāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the perfection of wisdom, based on its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of internal emptiness, based on its utter purity.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of external emptiness, based on its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of internal and external emptiness, based on its utter purity.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽mahāśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  mahāśūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the emptiness of emptiness, based on its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of great emptiness, based on its utter purity.

original: paramārthaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of ultimate emptiness, based on its utter purity.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽atyantaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-production of the emptiness of the conditioned, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-production of the emptiness of the unconditioned, on account of its absolute purity.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽anavakāraśūnyatāyā ŚsP II 🔽anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ  anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-production of the emptiness of the absolute, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-production of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, on account of its absolute purity.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽sarvadharmaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-production of the emptiness of non-repudiation,🔽on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-production of the emptiness of nature, on account of its absolute purity.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-production of the emptiness of all things, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-production of the emptiness of specific characteristics, on account of its absolute purity.🔽He sees the non-production of the emptiness of non-apprehension, on account of its absolute purity.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-production of the emptiness of non-existence, on account of its absolute purity.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the emptiness of inherent nature, based on its utter purity.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽smṛtyupasthānānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  smṛti upasthānānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence, based on its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the applications of mindfulness, based on their utter purity.

original: samyakprahāṇānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽ṛddhipādānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: samyakprahāṇānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  ṛddhipādānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the right efforts, based on their utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the bases of supernatural power, based on their utter purity.

original: indriyāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽balānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: indriyāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  balānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the faculties, based on their utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the powers, based on their utter purity.

original: bodhyaṅgānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: bodhyaṅgānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the limbs of awakening, based on their utter purity.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽āryasatyānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  ārya satyānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
