translated: He sees the non-arising of the noble eightfold path, based on its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the noble truths, based on their utter purity.

original: dhyānānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: dhyānānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the concentrations, based on their utter purity.

original: apramāṇānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: apramāṇānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the immeasurables, based on their utter purity.

original: ārūpyasamāpattīnām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽vimokṣāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpattīnām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  vimokṣāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the formless attainments, based on their utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the liberations, based on their utter purity.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattīnām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the successive attainments, based on their utter purity.

original: śūnyatānimittepraṇihitavimokṣamukhānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta ipraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the liberations of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, based on their utter purity.

original: abhijñānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽samādhīnām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: abhijñānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  samādhīnām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the higher knowledges, based on their utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the concentrations, based on their utter purity.

original: dhāraṇīmukhānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukhānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the doors of retention, based on their utter purity.

original: tathāgatabalānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽vaiśāradyānām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: tathāgata balānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  vaiśāradyānām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the powers of the Tathāgata, based on their utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the grounds of self-confidence, based on their utter purity.

original: pratisaṃvidām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the detailed and thorough knowledges, based on their utter purity.

original: mahāmaitryā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: mahāmaitryāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of great loving-kindness, based on its utter purity.

original: mahākaruṇāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: mahākaruṇāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of great compassion, based on its utter purity.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the unique qualities of the Buddha, based on their utter purity.

original: sarvajñatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sarvajña tāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of omniscience, based on its utter purity.

original: mārgākārajñatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, based on its utter purity.

original: sarvākārajñatāyā anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽ŚsP II 🔽pṛthagjanasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  śsp ii  pṛthagjanasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the knowledge of all aspects, based on its utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the ordinary person, based on its utter purity.

original: pṛthagjanadharmāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽srotaāpannasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pṛthagjana dharmāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  srotaāpannasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the qualities of the ordinary person, based on their utter purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the stream-enterer, based on its utter purity.

original: sakṛdāgāmino 'nutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāminaḥ n utpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the once-returner, based on its utter purity.

original: anāgāmino 'nutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: anāgāminaḥ n utpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the non-returner, based on its utter purity.

original: arhato 'nutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: arhataḥ n utpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the arhat due to complete purity.

original: pratyekabuddhasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽srotaāpannadharmāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  srotaāpanna dharmāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the pratyekabuddha due to complete purity.🔽He sees the non-arising of the dharmas of the stream-enterer due to complete purity.

original: sakṛdāgāmidharmāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi dharmāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the dharmas of the once-returner due to complete purity.

original: anāgāmidharmāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: anāgāmi dharmāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the dharmas of the non-returner due to complete purity.

original: pratyekabuddhadharmāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha dharmāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the pratyekabuddha dharmas due to complete purity.

original: bodhisattvasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: bodhisattvasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the bodhisattva due to complete purity.

original: bodhisattvadharmāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: bodhisattva dharmāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the bodhisattva dharmas due to complete purity.

original: buddhasyānutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: buddhasya anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the Buddha due to complete purity.

original: buddhadharmāṇām anutpādaṃ paśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: buddha dharmāṇām anutpādam paśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He sees the non-arising of the Buddha dharmas due to complete purity.

original: athāyuṣmāñ chāradvatīputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān chāradvatī putraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: yathāham āyuṣmataḥ subhūter bhāṣitasyārtham ājānāmi /
analyzed: yathā aham āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ bhāṣitasya artham ājānāmi
translated: As I understand the meaning of what the Venerable Subhūti has said,

original: rūpam anutpādaḥ /🔽vedanām anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: rūpam anutpādaḥ  vedanām anutpādaḥ
translated: form is non-arising,🔽feeling is non-arising,

original: saṃjñām anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: saṃjñām anutpādaḥ
translated: perception is non-arising,

original: saṃskārā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: volitional factors are non-arising,

original: vijñānam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: vijñānam anutpādaḥ
translated: consciousness is non-arising,

original: cakṣur anutpādaḥ /🔽śrotram anutpādaḥ /🔽ghrāṇam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ anutpādaḥ  śrotram anutpādaḥ  ghrāṇam anutpādaḥ
translated: the eye is non-arising,🔽the ear is non-arising,🔽the nose is non-arising,

original: jihvānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: jihvā anutpādaḥ
translated: the tongue is non-arising,

original: kāyo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: kāyaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: the body is non-arising,

original: mano 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: the mind is non-arising,

original: rūpam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: rūpam anutpādaḥ
translated: form is non-arising,

original: śabdo 'nutpādaḥ /🔽gandho 'nutpādaḥ /🔽raso 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: śabdaḥ n utpādaḥ  gandhaḥ n utpādaḥ  rasaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: sound is non-arising,🔽smell is non-arising,🔽taste is non-arising,

original: sparśo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: sparśaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: touch is non-arising,

original: dharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: mental phenomena are non-arising,

original: cakṣurvijñānam anutpādaḥ /🔽śrotravijñānam anutpādaḥ /🔽ghrāṇavijñānam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam anutpādaḥ  śrotra vijñānam anutpādaḥ  ghrāṇa vijñānam anutpādaḥ
translated: eye consciousness is non-arising,🔽ear consciousness is non-arising,🔽nose consciousness is non-arising,

original: jihvāvijñānam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam anutpādaḥ
translated: tongue consciousness is non-arising,

original: kāyavijñānam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam anutpādaḥ
translated: body consciousness is non-arising,

original: manovijñānam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam anutpādaḥ
translated: mind consciousness is non-arising,

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśo 'nutpādaḥ /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśo 'nutpādaḥ /🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ nutpādaḥ  śrotra saṃsparśaḥ nutpādaḥ  ghrāṇa saṃsparśaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: eye contact is non-arising,🔽ear contact is non-arising,🔽nose contact is non-arising,

original: jihvāsaṃsparśo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: tongue contact is non-arising,

original: kāyasaṃsparśo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: body contact is non-arising,

original: manaḥsaṃsparśo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: mind contact is non-arising,

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādaḥ /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ  śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ
translated: The non-arising of eye contact and the consciousness that arises based on the two is the non-arising of suffering.

original: ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādaḥ /🔽jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādaḥ ŚsP II 🔽kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ  jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ  kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ
translated: The non-arising of ear contact and the consciousness that arises based on the two is the non-arising of suffering.🔽The non-arising of nose contact and the consciousness that arises based on the two is the non-arising of suffering.🔽The non-arising of tongue contact and the consciousness that arises based on the two is the non-arising of suffering.🔽The non-arising of body contact and the consciousness that arises based on the two is the non-arising of suffering.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātur anutpādaḥ /🔽abdhātur anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ  ap dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The non-arising of mind contact and the consciousness that arises based on the two is the non-arising of suffering.🔽The earth element is non-arising.🔽The water element is non-arising.

original: tejodhātur anutpādaḥ /🔽vāyudhātur anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ  vāyu dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The fire element is non-arising.🔽The wind element is non-arising.

original: ākāśadhātur anutpādaḥ /🔽vijñānadhātur anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: ākāśa dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ  vijñāna dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The space element is non-arising.🔽The consciousness element is non-arising.

original: avidyānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: avidyā anutpādaḥ
translated: Ignorance is non-arising.

original: saṃskārā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: Formations are non-arising.

original: vijñānam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: vijñānam anutpādaḥ
translated: Consciousness is non-arising.

original: nāmarūpam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: nāma rūpam anutpādaḥ
translated: Name and form are non-arising.

original: ṣaḍāyatanam anutpādaḥ /🔽sparśo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatanam anutpādaḥ  sparśaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: The six sense bases are non-arising.🔽Contact is non-arising.

original: vedanānutpādaḥ /🔽tṛṣṇānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: vedanā anutpādaḥ  tṛṣṇā anutpādaḥ
translated: Feeling is non-arising.🔽Craving is non-arising.

original: upādānam anutpādaḥ /🔽bhavo 'nutpādaḥ /🔽jātir anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: upādānam anutpādaḥ  bhavaḥ n utpādaḥ  jātiḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: Clinging is non-arising.🔽Becoming is non-arising.🔽Birth is non-arising.

original: jarāmaraṇam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam anutpādaḥ
translated: Old age and death are non-arising.

original: dānapāramitānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā anutpādaḥ
translated: The perfection of giving is non-arising.

original: śīlapāramitānutpādaḥ /🔽kṣāntipāramitānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā anutpādaḥ  kṣānti pāramitā anutpādaḥ
translated: The perfection of morality is non-arising.🔽The perfection of patience is non-arising.

original: vīryapāramitānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitā anutpādaḥ
translated: The perfection of effort is non-arising.

original: dhyānapāramitānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā anutpādaḥ
translated: The perfection of concentration is non-arising.

original: prajñāpāramitānutpādaḥ /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā anutpādaḥ  adhyātma śūnyatā anutpādaḥ  bahirdhā śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom is non-arising.🔽Internal emptiness is non-arising.🔽External emptiness is non-arising.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Internal and external emptiness is non-arising.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Emptiness of emptiness is non-arising.

original: mahāśūnyatānutpādaḥ /🔽paramārthaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Great emptiness is non-arising.🔽Ultimate emptiness is non-arising.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /🔽asaṃskṛtaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /🔽atyantaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā anutpādaḥ  asaṃskṛta śūnyatā anutpādaḥ  atyanta śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Emptiness of the conditioned is non-arising.🔽Emptiness of the unconditioned is non-arising.🔽Absolute emptiness is non-arising.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatānutpādaḥ /🔽anavakāraśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anavara agra śūnyatā anutpādaḥ  anavakāra śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Emptiness without beginning or end is non-arising.🔽Emptiness of non-discontinuity is non-arising.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Natural emptiness is non-arising.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Emptiness of all phenomena is non-arising.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā anutpādaḥ  anupalambha śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Emptiness of specific characteristics is non-arising.🔽Emptiness of non-apprehension is non-arising.

original: abhāvaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Emptiness of non-existence is non-arising.🔽Emptiness of own-nature is non-arising.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: Emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence is non-arising.

original: smṛtyupasthānāny anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: smṛti upasthānāni anutpādaḥ
translated: The applications of mindfulness are non-arising.

original: samyakprahāṇāny anutpādaḥ /🔽ṛddhipādā anutpādaḥ /🔽indriyāṇy anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: samyakprahāṇāni anutpādaḥ  ṛddhipādāḥ anutpādaḥ  indriyāṇi anutpādaḥ
translated: The right efforts are non-arising.🔽The bases of supernatural power are non-arising.🔽The faculties are non-arising.

original: balāny anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: balāni anutpādaḥ
translated: The powers are non-arising.

original: bodhyaṅgāny anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: bodhyaṅgāni anutpādaḥ
translated: The factors of awakening are non-arising.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅgaḥ mārgaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: The noble eightfold path is non-arising.

original: āryasatyāny anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: ārya satyāni anutpādaḥ
translated: The noble truths are non-arising.

original: catvāri dhyānāny anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: catvāri dhyānāni anutpādaḥ
translated: The four meditations are non-arising.

original: catvāry apramāṇāny anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: catvāri apramāṇāni anutpādaḥ
translated: The four immeasurables are non-arising.

original: catasra ārūpyasamāpattayo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: The four formless concentrations are non-arising.

original: aṣṭau vimokṣā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The eight liberations are non-arising.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: The nine successive concentrations are non-arising.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāny anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni anutpādaḥ
translated: The liberations through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are non-arising.

original: abhijñā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: abhijñā anutpādaḥ
translated: The superknowledges are non-arising.

original: samādhayo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: samādhayaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: The concentrations are non-arising.

original: dhāraṇīmukhāny anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukhāni anutpādaḥ
translated: The dhāraṇī gateways are non-arising.

original: daśatathāgatabalāny anutpādaḥ /🔽catvāri vaiśāradyāny anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: daśa tathāgata balāni anutpādaḥ  catvāri vaiśāradyāni anutpādaḥ
translated: The ten powers of the Tathāgata are non-arising.🔽The four fearlessnesses are non-arising.

original: catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'nutpādaḥ /🔽mahāmaitry anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: The four detailed and thorough knowledges are non-arising.🔽Great love is non-arising.

original: mahākaruṇānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā anutpādaḥ
translated: Great compassion is non-arising.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmā anutpādaḥ / sarvajñatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ sarvajña tā anutpādaḥ
translated: The eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-arising. Omniscience is non-arising.

original: mārgākārajñatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā anutpādaḥ
translated: The knowledge of path aspects is non-arising.

original: sarvākārajñatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā anutpādaḥ
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is non-arising.

original: pṛthagjano 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthagjanaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: An ordinary person is non-arising.

original: pṛthagjanadharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthagjana dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharmas of an ordinary person are non-arising.

original: srotaāpanno 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: srotaāpannaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: A stream enterer is non-arising.

original: srotaāpannadharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: srotaāpanna dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharmas of a stream enterer are non-arising.

original: sakṛdāgāmino 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāminaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: A once-returner is non-arising.

original: sakṛdāgāmidharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharmas of a once-returner are non-arising.

original: anāgāmino 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anāgāminaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: The non-arising of the non-returner.

original: anāgāmidharmā anutpādaḥ / ŚsP II 🔽arhattvam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anāgāmi dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ  arhat tvam anutpādaḥ
translated: The non-arising of the dharma of the non-returner.🔽Arhatship is non-arising.

original: arhaddharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: arhat dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharma of the arhat is non-arising.

original: pratyekabuddho 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: A pratyekabuddha is non-arising.

original: pratyekabuddhadharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharma of a pratyekabuddha is non-arising.

original: bodhisattvo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: A bodhisattva is non-arising.

original: bodhisattvadharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattva dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharma of a bodhisattva is non-arising.

original: buddho 'py anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: buddhaḥ u pi anutpādaḥ
translated: A buddha is non-arising.

original: buddhadharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: buddha dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The dharma of a buddha is non-arising.

original: yadi vāyuṣman subhūte rūpam anutpādaḥ /🔽vedanām anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: yadi vā āyuṣman subhūte rūpam anutpādaḥ  vedanām anutpādaḥ
translated: If, Venerable Subhūti, form is non-arising,🔽feeling is non-arising,

original: saṃjñām anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: saṃjñām anutpādaḥ
translated: perception is non-arising,

original: saṃskārā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: volitional factors are non-arising,

original: vijñānam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: vijñānam anutpādaḥ
translated: and consciousness is non-arising,

original: cakṣur anutpādaḥ śrotram anutpādo ghrāṇam anutpādo jihvānutpādaḥ kāyo 'nutpādo mano 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ anutpādaḥ śrotram anutpādaḥ ghrāṇam anutpādaḥ jihvā anutpādaḥ kāyaḥ nu utpādaḥ manaḥ nu utpādaḥ
translated: the eye is non-arising, the ear is non-arising, the nose is non-arising, the tongue is non-arising, the body is non-arising, and the mind is non-arising.

original: rūpam anutpādaḥ śabdo 'nutpādo gandho 'nutpādo raso 'nutpādaḥ sparśo 'nutpādo dharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: rūpam anutpādaḥ śabdaḥ nutpādaḥ gandhaḥ nutpādaḥ rasaḥ nutpādaḥ sparśaḥ nutpādaḥ dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: Form is non-arising, sound is non-arising, smell is non-arising, taste is non-arising, touch is non-arising, and dharmas are non-arising.

original: cakṣurvijñānam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam anutpādaḥ
translated: Eye consciousness is non-arising.

original: śrotravijñānam anutpādo ghrāṇavijñānam anutpādo jihvāvijñānam anutpādaḥ kāyavijñānam anutpādo manovijñānam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: śrotra vijñānam anutpādaḥ ghrāṇa vijñānam anutpādaḥ jihvā vijñānam anutpādaḥ kāya vijñānam anutpādaḥ manaḥ vijñānam anutpādaḥ
translated: Ear-consciousness is non-arising, nose-consciousness is non-arising, tongue-consciousness is non-arising, body-consciousness is non-arising, mind-consciousness is non-arising.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśo 'nutpādaḥ śrotrasaṃsparśo 'nutpādo ghrāṇasaṃsparśo 'nutpādo jihvāsaṃsparśo 'nutpādaḥ kāyasaṃsparśo 'nutpādo manaḥsaṃsparśo
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ n utpādaḥ śrotra saṃsparśaḥ n utpādaḥ ghrāṇa saṃsparśaḥ n utpādaḥ jihvā saṃsparśaḥ n utpādaḥ kāya saṃsparśaḥ n utpādaḥ manaḥ saṃsparśaḥ
translated: Eye-contact is non-arising, ear-contact is non-arising, nose-contact is non-arising, tongue-contact is non-arising, body-contact is non-arising, mind-contact is non-arising.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādaḥ śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādo ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādo
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ
translated: Eye-contact-conditioned feeling is non-arising, ear-contact-conditioned feeling is non-arising, nose-contact-conditioned feeling is non-arising,

original: jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādaḥ kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādo manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anutpādaḥ
translated: tongue-contact-conditioned feeling is non-arising, body-contact-conditioned feeling is non-arising, mind-contact-conditioned feeling is non-arising.

original: pṛthivīdhātur anutpādo 'bdhātur anutpādaḥ tejodhātur anutpādo vāyudhātur anutpāda ākāśadhātur anutpādo vijñānadhātur anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ bdhātuḥ anutpādaḥ tejaḥ dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ vāyu dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ ākāśa dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ vijñāna dhātuḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The earth element is non-arising, the water element is non-arising, the fire element is non-arising, the wind element is non-arising, the space element is non-arising, the consciousness element is non-arising.

original: avidyānutpādaḥ saṃskārā anutpādo vijñānam anutpādo nāmarūpam anutpādaḥ ṣaḍāyatanam
analyzed: avidyā anutpādaḥ saṃskārāḥ anutpādaḥ vijñānam anutpādaḥ nāma rūpam anutpādaḥ ṣaṣ āyatanam
translated: Ignorance is non-arising, formations are non-arising, consciousness is non-arising, name-and-form is non-arising, the six sense bases are non-arising,

original: anutpādaḥ sparśo 'nutpādo vedanānutpādaḥ tṛṣṇānutpāda upādānam anutpādo bhavo 'nutpādo
analyzed: anutpādaḥ sparśaḥ nutpādaḥ vedanā anutpādaḥ tṛṣṇā anutpādaḥ upādānam anutpādaḥ bhavaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: The non-arising of contact is the non-arising of feeling, the non-arising of craving is the non-arising of grasping, the non-arising of becoming is the non-arising of

original: jātir anutpādo jarāmaraṇam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: jātiḥ anutpādaḥ jarā maraṇam anutpādaḥ
translated: birth, the non-arising of old age and death is the non-arising of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: dānapāramitānutpādaḥ śīlapāramitānutpādaḥ kṣāntipāramitānutpādo vīryapāramitānutpādo dhyānapāramitānutpādaḥ prajñāpāramitānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā anutpādaḥ śīla pāramitā anutpādaḥ kṣānti pāramitā anutpādaḥ vīrya pāramitā anutpādaḥ dhyāna pāramitā anutpādaḥ prajñāpāramitā anutpādaḥ
translated: The non-arising of the perfection of giving, the non-arising of the perfection of morality, the non-arising of the perfection of patience, the non-arising of the perfection of effort, the non-arising of the perfection of concentration, the non-arising of the perfection of wisdom.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatānutpādo bahirdhāśūnyatānutpādo 'dhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatānutpādaḥ śūnyatāśūnyatānutpādo
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā anutpādaḥ bahirdhā śūnyatā anutpādaḥ dhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā anutpādaḥ śūnyatā śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: The non-arising of internal emptiness, the non-arising of external emptiness, the non-arising of internal and external emptiness, the non-arising of the emptiness of emptiness,

original: mahāśūnyatānutpādaḥ paramārthaśūnyatānutpādaḥ saṃskṛtaśūnyatānutpādo 'saṃskṛtaśūnyatānutpādo
analyzed: mahāśūnyatā anutpādaḥ paramārtha śūnyatā anutpādaḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatā anutpādaḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: the non-arising of great emptiness, the non-arising of ultimate emptiness, the non-arising of conditioned emptiness, the non-arising of unconditioned emptiness,

original: 'tyantaśūnyatānutpādo 'navarāgraśūnyatānutpādo 'navakāraśūnyatānutpādaḥ prakṛtiśūnyatānutpādaḥ
analyzed: tyanta śūnyatā anutpādaḥ navara agra śūnyatā anutpādaḥ navakāra śūnyatā anutpādaḥ prakṛti śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: the non-arising of absolute emptiness, the non-arising of emptiness without beginning or end, the non-arising of emptiness without rejection, the non-arising of natural emptiness,

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatānutpādaḥ svalakṣaṇaśūnyatānutpādo 'nupalambhaśūnyatānutpādo ŚsP II
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā anutpādaḥ sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā anutpādaḥ nupalambha śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: the non-arising of the emptiness of all phenomena, the non-arising of the emptiness of specific characteristics, the non-arising of the emptiness of non-apprehension, the non-arising of the emptiness of essential nature,🔽the non-arising of the emptiness of non-existence, the non-arising of the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence, the non-arising of the emptiness of inherent nature, the non-arising of the emptiness of other inherent nature, the non-arising of the emptiness of inherent nature of other.

original: 'bhāvaśūnyatānutpādaḥ svabhāvaśūnyatānutpādo 'bhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: bhāva śūnyatā anutpādaḥ svabhāva śūnyatā anutpādaḥ bhāva svabhāva śūnyatā anutpādaḥ
translated: The non-arising of the emptiness of non-existence, the non-arising of the emptiness of inherent nature, and the non-arising of the emptiness of the inherent nature of non-existence.

original: smṛtyupasthānāny anutpādaḥ samyakprahāṇāny anutpāda ṛddhipādā anutpādaḥ indriyāṇy
analyzed: smṛti upasthānāni anutpādaḥ samyakprahāṇāni anutpādaḥ ṛddhipādāḥ anutpādaḥ indriyāṇi
translated: The mindfulness foundations are non-arising, the right efforts are non-arising, the bases of spiritual success are non-arising, the faculties

original: anutpādo balāny anutpādo bodhyaṅgāny anutpāda āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgo 'nutpāda āryasatyāny
analyzed: anutpādaḥ balāni anutpādaḥ bodhyaṅgāni anutpādaḥ ārya aṣṭāṅgaḥ mārgaḥ nutpādaḥ ārya satyāni
translated: are non-arising, the powers are non-arising, the factors of awakening are non-arising, the noble eightfold path is non-arising, the noble truths

original: anutpādaś catvāri dhyānāny anutpādaś catvāry apramāṇāny anutpāda catasra ārūpyasamāpattayo
analyzed: anutpādaḥ catvāri dhyānāni anutpādaḥ catvāri apramāṇāni anutpāda catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: are non-arising, the four concentrations are non-arising, the four immeasurables are non-arising, the four formless attainments

original: 'nutpādo aṣṭau vimokṣānutpādo navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: nutpādaḥ aṣṭau vimokṣa anutpādaḥ nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: are non-arising, the eight liberations are non-arising, the nine successive abodes of absorption are non-arising.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāny anutpādo 'bhijñānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni anutpādaḥ bhijñā anutpādaḥ
translated: The doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are non-arising, the superknowledges are non-arising.

original: samādhayo 'nutpādo dhāraṇīmukhāny anutpādaḥ daśatathāgatabalāny anutpādaś catvāri
analyzed: samādhayaḥ n utpādaḥ dhāraṇī mukhāni anutpādaḥ daśa tathāgata balāni anutpādaḥ catvāri
translated: The concentrations are non-arising, the doors of retention are non-arising, the ten powers of the Tathāgata are non-arising, the four

original: vaiśāradyāny anutpādaś catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'nutpādo mahāmaitry anutpādo mahākaruṇānutpādo
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni anutpādaḥ catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ nutpādaḥ mahāmaitrī anutpādaḥ mahā karuṇā anutpādaḥ
translated: fearlessnesses are non-arising, the four detailed and thorough knowledges are non-arising, great loving kindness is non-arising, great compassion is non-arising,

original: 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmā anutpādaḥ / sarvajñatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: ṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ sarvajña tā anutpādaḥ
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are non-arising. Omniscience is non-arising.

original: mārgākārajñatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā anutpādaḥ
translated: The knowledge of the aspects of the path is non-arising.

original: sarvākārajñatānutpādaḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā anutpādaḥ
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is non-arising.

original: pṛthagjano 'nutpādaḥ /🔽pṛthagjanadharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthagjanaḥ nutpādaḥ  pṛthagjana dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: An ordinary person is non-arising.🔽The qualities of an ordinary person are non-arising.

original: srotaāpanno 'nutpādaḥ /🔽srotaāpannadharmā anutpādaḥ /🔽sakṛdāgāmino 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: srotaāpannaḥ n utpādaḥ  srotaāpanna dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ  sakṛdāgāminaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: A stream-enterer is non-arising.🔽The qualities of a stream-enterer are non-arising.🔽A once-returner is non-arising.

original: sakṛdāgāmidharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The qualities of a once-returner are non-arising.

original: anāgāmino 'nutpādaḥ /🔽anāgāmidharmā anutpādaḥ /🔽arhattvam anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: anāgāminaḥ n utpādaḥ  anāgāmi dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ  arhat tvam anutpādaḥ
translated: A non-returner is non-arising.🔽The qualities of a non-returner are non-arising.🔽Arhatship is non-arising.

original: arhaddharmā anutpādaḥ /🔽pratyekabuddho 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: arhat dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ  pratyekabuddhaḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: The qualities of an arhat are non-arising.🔽A pratyekabuddha is non-arising.

original: pratyekabuddhadharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The qualities of a pratyekabuddha are non-arising.

original: bodhisattvo 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: A bodhisattva is non-arising.

original: bodhisattvadharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattva dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: The qualities of a bodhisattva are non-arising.

original: buddho 'py anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: buddhaḥ u pi anutpādaḥ
translated: A buddha is non-arising.

original: buddhadharmā apy anutpādaḥ / tat prāptam eva bhavati śrāvakayāṇikaiḥ srotaāpattiphalaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalam arhattvaṃ prāptaiva bhavati /
analyzed: buddha dharmāḥ api anutpādaḥ tat prāptam eva bhavati śrāvaka yāṇikaiḥ srotaāpatti phalam sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam arhat tvam prāptā eva bhavati
translated: The qualities of a buddha are non-arising. Therefore, the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and arhatship are already attained by those of the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: pratyekabuddhayānikaiḥ pratyekabodhiḥ prāptaiva bhavati /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha yānikaiḥ pratyeka bodhiḥ prāptā eva bhavati
translated: Pratyekabuddha enlightenment is already attained by those of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvākārajñatā pañcānāṃ gatīnāṃ bhede na bhaviṣyati prāptaiva bhavati bodhisattvena mahasattvena pañcavidhā bodhiḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarva ākārajña tā pañcānām gatīnām bhede na bhaviṣyati prāptā eva bhavati bodhisattvena mahasattvena pañcavidhā bodhiḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva has attained the five kinds of enlightenment, and will not attain the omniscience by distinguishing the five destinies.

original: yady āyuṣman subhūte sarvadharmā anutpādaḥ /
analyzed: yadi āyuṣman subhūte sarva dharmāḥ anutpādaḥ
translated: If, Venerable Subhūti, all dharmas are non-arising,

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ srotaāpannena trayāṇāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇāya mārgo bhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam srotaāpannena trayāṇām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāya mārgaḥ bhāvitaḥ
translated: why did the stream-enterer cultivate the path for the abandonment of the three fetters?

original: sakṛdāgāminā rāgadveṣamohānāṃ tanutvāya mārgo bhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāminā rāga dveṣa mohānām tanu tvāya mārgaḥ bhāvitaḥ
translated: Why did the once-returner cultivate the path for the weakening of passion, hatred, and delusion?

original: anāgāminā pañcānām avarabhāgīyāṇāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇāya mārgo bhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: anāgāminā pañcānām avarabhāgīyāṇām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāya mārgaḥ bhāvitaḥ
translated: Why did the non-returner cultivate the path for the abandonment of the five lower fetters?

original: arhatā pañcānāṃ mūrdhabhāgīyānāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇāya mārgo bhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: arhatā pañcānām mūrdhabhāgīyānām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāya mārgaḥ bhāvitaḥ
translated: Why did the arhat cultivate the path for the abandonment of the five higher fetters?

original: pratyekabuddhayānikaiḥ pratyekabodhaye mārgo bhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha yānikaiḥ pratyeka bodhaye mārgaḥ bhāvitaḥ
translated: Why did those in the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas cultivate the path for the sake of pratyekabodhi?

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo duṣkaracaryāñ carati yad duḥkhāni sattvānāṃ kṛtane pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ duṣkara caryām carati yat duḥkhāni sattvānām kṛtane pratyanubhavati
translated: Why does the bodhisattva mahāsattva practice the difficult practice, enduring the sufferings of sentient beings?

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ tathāgatenānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir abhisaṃbuddhā /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam tathāgatena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: Why did the Tathāgata attain supreme perfect enlightenment?

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ tathāgatena dharmacakraṃ pravartitam /🔽ŚsP II
analyzed: kim kāraṇam tathāgatena dharmacakram pravartitam  śsp ii
translated: What is the reason that the Tathāgata set the wheel of Dharma in motion?

original: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtir āyuṣmantaṃ śāradvatīputram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āyuṣmantam śāradvatī putram etat avocat
translated: Thus addressed, the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: nāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpādasya dharmasya prāptim icchāmi na samayaṃ cānutpādasya srotaāpattitvam icchāmi /
analyzed: na aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpādasya dharmasya prāptim icchāmi na samayam ca anutpādasya srotaāpatti tvam icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the attainment of the non-arisen, nor do I wish for the non-arisen to be a stream-enterer.

original: srotaāpattiphalaṃ nānutpādasya sakṛdāgāmitvam icchāmi /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam na anutpādasya sakṛdāgāmi tvam icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the non-arisen to be a once-returner, nor for the once-returner fruit.

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ nānutpādasyānāgāmitvam icchāmi nānāgāmiphalaṃ nānutpādasyārhattvam icchāmi nārhattvasākṣātkriyāṃ /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam na anutpādasya anāgāmi tvam icchāmi na anāgāmi phalam na anutpādasya arhat tvam icchāmi na arhat tva sākṣātkriyām
translated: I do not wish for the non-arisen to be a non-returner, nor for the non-returner fruit. I do not wish for the non-arisen to be an arhat, nor for the realization of arhatship.

original: nānutpādasya pratyekabuddhatvam icchāmi na pratyekabodhir nāpy aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrecchāmi
analyzed: na anutpādasya pratyekabuddha tvam icchāmi na pratyeka bodhiḥ na api aham āyuṣmam śāradvatīputra icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the non-arisen to be a pratyekabuddha, nor for pratyekabodhi. Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish

original: yo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo duṣkaracaryāṃ caran nāpi bodhisattvo mahāsattvo duṣkarasaṃjñayā
analyzed: yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ duṣkara caryām caran na api bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ duṣkara saṃjñayā
translated: for the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the difficult practice, nor for the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices with the notion of difficulty.

original: carati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: carati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hy āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra duḥkhasaṃjñāṃ janayitvāśakyam aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānāṃ
analyzed: na hi āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra duḥkha saṃjñām janayitvā aśakyam aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām
translated: For, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, having generated the perception of suffering, it is not possible to accomplish the welfare of immeasurable, incalculable

original: sattvānām arthaṃ kartum api tv āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra sarvattveyumātṛsaṃjñā janayitvā
analyzed: sattvānām artham kartum api tu āyuṣman śāradvatī putra sarvattveyu mātṛ saṃjñāḥ janayitvā
translated: beings. However, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, having generated the perception of all beings as one's mother,

original: pitṛsaṃjñāṃ janayitvā putrasaṃjñā janayitvāsakyam aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvānām
analyzed: pitṛ saṃjñām janayitvā putra saṃjñāḥ janayitvā asakyam aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām
translated: having generated the perception of them as one's father, having generated the perception of them as one's son, it is possible to accomplish the welfare of immeasurable, incalculable beings,

original: arthakartun tac cānupalambhayogena evaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena cittam utpādayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: artha kartun tat ca anupalambha yogena evam bodhisattvena mahāsattvena cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: and that by way of the yoga of non-apprehension. Thus should the bodhisattva mahāsattva generate the mind.

original: yathātmātmeti cocyate sa ca sarveṇa sarvathā sarvaṃ na saṃvidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: yathā ātmā ātmā iti ca ucyate sa ca sarveṇa sarvathā sarvam na saṃvidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Just as what is called 'self' is in every way, in all aspects, non-existent and not apprehended,

original: evam adhyātmikabāhyeṣu dharmeṣu saṃjñotpādayitavyā /
analyzed: evam adhyātmika bāhyeṣu dharmeṣu saṃjñā utpādayitavyā
translated: so should the perception be generated towards internal and external phenomena.

original: saced evaṃ saṃjñām utpādayitavyeti duṣkarasaṃjñām utpadayiṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saced evam saṃjñām utpādayitavyā iti duṣkara saṃjñām utpadayiṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: If one should generate the perception that 'thus should the perception be generated,' one would generate the perception of difficulty. What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi na sa kaccit tad dharmam utpādayati nopalabhyate nāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpāde
analyzed: tathā hi na sa kaccit tat dharmam utpādayati nā upalabhyate na aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpāde
translated: Because one would not generate that dharma in any way, would not apprehend it, I, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not

original: tathāgatam icchāmi nānuttarā saṃyaksaṃbodhir yathā tathāgatena dharmacakraṃ pravartitaṃ
analyzed: tathāgatam icchāmi na anuttarā saṃyaksaṃbodhiḥ yathā tathāgatena dharmacakram pravartitam
translated: I wish for the Tathāgata, not for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, as the Tathāgata has set rolling the wheel of Dharma.

original: na hy anutpannena dharmeṇa prāptiḥ prāpyate /
analyzed: na hi anutpannena dharmeṇa prāptiḥ prāpyate
translated: For attainment is not attained by an unarisen dharma.

original: āha / kim punas tvam āyuṣman subhūte utpannena dharmeṇa prāptim icchasi /
analyzed: āha kim punar tvam āyuṣman subhūte utpannena dharmeṇa prāptim icchasi
translated: He said: But do you, venerable Subhūti, wish for attainment by an arisen dharma?

original: athānutpannena dharmeṇa prāpyamāṇam /
analyzed: atha anutpannena dharmeṇa prāpyamāṇam
translated: Or is it to be attained by an unarisen dharma?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: nāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrotpānnena dharmeṇa prāptim icchāmi nāpy anutpannena dharmeṇa prāpyamāṇām /
analyzed: na aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra utpānnena dharmeṇa prāptim icchāmi na api anutpannena dharmeṇa prāpyamāṇām
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for attainment by an arisen dharma, nor is it to be attained by an unarisen dharma.

original: āha / kiṃ punar āyuṣman subhūte nāsti prāptir nāsty abhisamayaḥ /
analyzed: āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte na asti prāptiḥ na asti abhisamayaḥ
translated: He said: But do you, venerable Subhūti, not have attainment, not have realization?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: asty āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra prāptir asty abhisamayo na punaḥ paramārthena dharmeṇa /
analyzed: asti āyuṣmam śāradvatīputra prāptiḥ asti abhisamayaḥ na punar parama arthena dharmeṇa
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, there is attainment, there is realization, but not by a dharma of ultimate truth.

original: api tu khalu punar āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra lokavyavahāreṇa prāptir abhisamayo vā
analyzed: api tu khalu punar āyuṣmam śāradvatī putra lokavyavahāreṇa prāptiḥ abhisamayaḥ vā
translated: Moreover, venerable Śāradvatīputra, attainment or realization is indicated by worldly convention.

original: prajñāpyate lokavyavahāreṇa srotaāpanno vā sakṛdāgāmī vā nāgāmī vārhattvaṃ vā pratyekabuddho
analyzed: prajñāpyate lokavyavahāreṇa srotaāpannaḥ vā sakṛdāgāmī vā nāgāmī vā arhat tvam vā pratyekabuddhaḥ
translated: By worldly convention, a stream-enterer, once-returner, non-returner, or arhat,

original: vā bodhisattvo vā prajñayate / na punaḥ paramārthena prāptir vābhisamayo vā srotaāpanno vā ŚsP II
analyzed: vā bodhisattvaḥ vā prajñayate na punar paramārthena prāptiḥ vā abhisamayaḥ vā srotaāpannaḥ vā
translated: nor a bodhisattva is designated. But in ultimate truth, neither attainment nor clear realization, nor a stream-enterer,

original: sakṛdāgāmī vānāgāmī vārhattvaṃ vā pratyekabuddho vā bodhisattvo vā buddho vā prajñapyate /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmī vā anāgāmī vā arhat tvam vā pratyekabuddhaḥ vā bodhisattvaḥ vā buddhaḥ vā prajñapyate
translated: nor a once-returner, nor a non-returner, nor arhatship, nor a pratyekabuddha, nor a bodhisattva, nor a buddha is designated.

original: āha / kiṃ punar āyuṣman subhūte yathaiva lokavyavahāreṇa prāptiś cābhisamayaś ca tathaiva pañcānāṃ gatīnāṃ lokavyavahāreṇa bhedo na punaḥ paramārthena /
analyzed: āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte yathā eva lokavyavahāreṇa prāptiḥ ca abhisamayaḥ ca tathā eva pañcānām gatīnām lokavyavahāreṇa bhedaḥ na punar paramārthena
translated: He said: But, Venerable Subhūti, just as attainment and clear realization are in worldly convention, in the same way, the distinction of the five destinies is in worldly convention, not in ultimate truth.

original: āha / evam etad āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra yathaiva lokavyavahāreṇa prāptiś cābhisamayaś ca tathaiva pañcānāṃ gatīnāṃ lokavyavahāreṇa bhedo na
analyzed: āha evam etat āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra yathā eva lokavyavahāreṇa prāptiḥ ca abhisamayaḥ ca tathā eva pañcānām gatīnām lokavyavahāreṇa bhedaḥ na
translated: He said: Just so, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, just as attainment and clear realization are in worldly convention, in the same way, the distinction of the five destinies is in worldly convention, not in ultimate truth.

original: punaḥ paramārthena / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar paramārthena tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hy āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paramārtheṇa karmaṇaḥ karamavipākaḥ /
analyzed: na hi āyuṣmam śāradvatī putra parama artheṇa karmaṇaḥ karama vipākaḥ
translated: For, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, in ultimate truth, there is no ripening of karma for an action.

original: notpādo na nirodho na saṃkleśo na vyavadānaḥ /
analyzed: na utpādaḥ na nirodhaḥ na saṃkleśaḥ na vyavadānaḥ
translated: There is no origination, no cessation, no defilement, no purification.

original: āha / kiṃ punar āyuṣman subhūte 'nutpanno dharma utpadyate /
analyzed: āha kim punar āyuṣman subhūte n utpannaḥ dharmaḥ utpadyate
translated: He said: But, Venerable Subhūti, does an unarisen dharma arise?

original: atha votpanno dharma utpadyate /
analyzed: atha vā utpannaḥ dharmaḥ utpadyate
translated: Or, if a dharma that has arisen arises,

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: nāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya dharmasyotpādam icchāmi /
analyzed: na aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya dharmasya utpādam icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of an unarisen dharma.

original: āha / katamasyāyuṣman subhūte anutpannasya dharmasyotpādaṃ necchasi /
analyzed: āha katamasya āyuṣman subhūte anutpannasya dharmasya utpādam na icchasi
translated: He said: Venerable Subhūti, which unarisen dharma's arising do you not wish for?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: rūpasyāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽vedanāyā āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽saṃjñāyā āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: rūpasya āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  vedanāyāḥ āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  saṃjñāyāḥ āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of unarisen form, which is empty of inherent nature.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of unarisen feeling, which is empty of inherent nature.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of unarisen perception, which is empty of inherent nature.

original: saṃskārāṇām āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: saṃskārāṇām āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of unarisen volitional formations, which are empty of inherent nature.

original: vijñānasyāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: vijñānasya āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of unarisen consciousness, which is empty of inherent nature.

original: cakṣuṣo 'ham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: cakṣuṣaḥ ham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of unarisen eye, which is empty of inherent nature.

original: śrotrasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽ghrāṇasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: śrotrasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  ghrāṇasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the unoriginated, intrinsically empty ear.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the unoriginated, intrinsically empty nose.

original: jihvāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: jihvāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the unoriginated, intrinsically empty tongue.

original: kāyasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: kāyasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the unoriginated, intrinsically empty body.

original: manaso 'ham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽rūpasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽śabdasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: manasaḥ ham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  rūpasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  śabdasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the unoriginated, intrinsically empty mind.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the unoriginated, intrinsically empty form.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the unoriginated, intrinsically empty sound.

original: gandhasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya ŚsP II
analyzed: gandhasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the unoriginated, intrinsically empty smell.

original: svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the unoriginated, intrinsically empty taste.

original: rasasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽sparśasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: rasasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  sparśasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the arising of the non-arisen taste, venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is empty of its own nature.🔽I do not wish for the arising of the non-arisen contact, venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is empty of its own nature.

original: dharmānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: dharmānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the arising of the non-arisen mental phenomena, venerable Śāradvatīputra, which are empty of their own nature.

original: cakṣurvijñānasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽śrotravijñānasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽ghrāṇavijñānasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  śrotra vijñānasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  ghrāṇa vijñānasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the arising of the non-arisen eye consciousness, venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is empty of its own nature.🔽I do not wish for the arising of the non-arisen ear consciousness, venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is empty of its own nature.🔽I do not wish for the arising of the non-arisen nose consciousness, venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is empty of its own nature.

original: jihvāvijñānasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the arising of the non-arisen tongue consciousness, venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is empty of its own nature.

original: kāyavijñānasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: kāya vijñānasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the arising of the non-arisen body consciousness, venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is empty of its own nature.

original: manovijñānasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for the non-arisen mind consciousness, which is empty of inherent nature, to arise.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  śrotra saṃsparśasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  ghrāṇa saṃsparśasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for the non-arisen eye contact, which is empty of inherent nature, to arise.🔽I do not wish, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for the non-arisen ear contact, which is empty of inherent nature, to arise.🔽I do not wish, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for the non-arisen nose contact, which is empty of inherent nature, to arise.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽kāyasaṃsparśasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  kāya saṃsparśasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for the non-arisen tongue contact, which is empty of inherent nature, to arise.🔽I do not wish, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for the non-arisen body contact, which is empty of inherent nature, to arise.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for the non-arisen mind contact, which is empty of inherent nature, to arise.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the production of eye-contact-conditioned feeling, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is unproduced and empty of inherent nature.🔽I do not wish for the production of ear-contact-conditioned feeling, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is unproduced and empty of inherent nature.🔽I do not wish for the production of nose-contact-conditioned feeling, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is unproduced and empty of inherent nature.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the production of tongue-contact-conditioned feeling, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is unproduced and empty of inherent nature.🔽I do not wish for the production of body-contact-conditioned feeling, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is unproduced and empty of inherent nature.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I do not wish for the production of mind-contact-conditioned feeling, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, which is unproduced and empty of inherent nature.

original: pṛthivīdhātor aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽abdhātor aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya ŚsP II 🔽svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽tejodhātor aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽vāyudhātor aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātoḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  ap dhātoḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra an utpannasya  svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  tejaḥ dhātoḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  vāyu dhātoḥ aham āyuṣmam śāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the earth element, which is unoriginated and empty of its own nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the water element, which is unoriginated and empty of its own nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the fire element, which is unoriginated and empty of its own nature.

original: ākāśadhātor aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽vijñānadhātor aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: ākāśa dhātoḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  vijñāna dhātoḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the wind element, which is unoriginated and empty of its own nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the space element, which is unoriginated and empty of its own nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of the consciousness element, which is unoriginated and empty of its own nature.

original: avidyāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽saṃskārāṇām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: avidyāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi 🔽saṃskārāṇām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of ignorance, which is unoriginated and empty of its own nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the origination of volitional actions, which are unoriginated and empty of their own nature.

original: vijñānasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: vijñānasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not assert the origination of consciousness, which is unborn and empty of its own nature.

original: nāmarūpasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽ṣaḍāyatanasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽sparśasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: nāma rūpasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  ṣaṣ āyatanasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi  sparśasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not assert the origination of name-and-form, which is unborn and empty of its own nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not assert the origination of the six sense sources, which is unborn and empty of its own nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not assert the origination of contact, which is unborn and empty of its own nature.

original: vedanāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽tṛṣṇāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽upādānasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: vedanāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  tṛṣṇāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  upādānasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not assert the origination of feeling, which is unborn and empty of its own nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not assert the origination of craving, which is unborn and empty of its own nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not assert the origination of grasping, which is unborn and empty of its own nature.

original: bhavasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: bhavasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not assert the origination of becoming, which is unborn and empty of its own nature.

original: jāter aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: jāteḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of the non-arisen intrinsic emptiness of caste.

original: jarāmaraṇasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: jarā maraṇasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of the non-arisen intrinsic emptiness of old age and death.

original: dānapāramitāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of the non-arisen intrinsic emptiness of the perfection of giving.

original: śīlapāramitāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽kṣāntipāramitāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽vīryapāramitāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: śīla pāramitāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  vīrya pāramitāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of the non-arisen intrinsic emptiness of the perfection of morality.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of the non-arisen intrinsic emptiness of the perfection of patience.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of the non-arisen intrinsic emptiness of the perfection of effort.

original: dhyānapāramitāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of the non-arisen intrinsic emptiness of the perfection of concentration.

original: prajñāpāramitāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of the perfection of wisdom, which is non-arisen and empty of inherent nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of internal emptiness, which is non-arisen and empty of inherent nature.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyā ŚsP II
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of external emptiness, which is non-arisen and empty of inherent nature.

original: aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽śūnyatāśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽mahāśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  mahā śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of internal and external emptiness, which is non-arisen and empty of inherent nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of emptiness of emptiness, which is non-arisen and empty of inherent nature.🔽I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of great emptiness, which is non-arisen and empty of inherent nature.

original: paramārthaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: I, venerable Śāradvatīputra, do not wish for the production of ultimate emptiness, which is non-arisen and empty of inherent nature.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, which is unoriginated and naturally empty.

original: atyantaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽anavarāgraśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽anavakāraśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, which is unoriginated and naturally empty.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the emptiness of the ultimate, which is unoriginated and naturally empty.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, which is unoriginated and naturally empty.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the emptiness of inherent nature, which is unoriginated and naturally empty.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the emptiness of all phenomena, which is unoriginated and naturally empty.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of the emptiness of specific characteristics, which is unarisen and essentially empty.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of the emptiness of non-apprehension, which is unarisen and essentially empty.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of the emptiness of non-existence, which is unarisen and essentially empty.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of the emptiness of inherent nature, which is unarisen and essentially empty.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannāyāḥ svabhāvaśūnyāyā utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽smṛtyupasthānānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannāyāḥ svabhāva śūnyāyāḥ utpādam na icchāmi  smṛti upasthānānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of the emptiness of the inherent nature of non-existence, which is unarisen and essentially empty.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of the applications of mindfulness, which are unarisen and essentially empty.

original: samyakprahāṇānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: samyakprahāṇānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the arising of the right efforts, which are unarisen and essentially empty.

original: ṛddhipādānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽indriyāṇām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: ṛddhipādānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi  indriyāṇām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the bases of spiritual power that have not yet arisen, which are empty of their own intrinsic nature.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the faculties that have not yet arisen, which are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: balānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: balānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the powers that have not yet arisen, which are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: bodhyaṅgānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: bodhyaṅgānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the branches of enlightenment that have not yet arisen, which are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgasyāham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannasya svabhāvaśūnyasyotpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgasya aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannasya svabhāva śūnyasya utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the noble eightfold path that has not yet arisen, which is empty of its own intrinsic nature.

original: āryasatyānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām ŚsP II 🔽utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: ārya satyānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām  utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the noble truths that have not yet arisen, which are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: dhyānānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: dhyānānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the meditative absorptions that have not yet arisen, which are empty of their own intrinsic nature.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the formless concentrations that have not yet arisen, which are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: apramāṇānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: apramāṇānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the immeasurables that are unoriginated and naturally empty.

original: ārūpyasamāpattīnām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽vimokṣāṇām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /🔽anupūrvavihārasamāpattlnām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpattīnām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi  vimokṣāṇām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi  anupūrva vihāra samāpattlnām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the formless attainments that are unoriginated and naturally empty.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the liberations that are unoriginated and naturally empty.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the successive absorptions that are unoriginated and naturally empty.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the doors of liberation—emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness—that are unoriginated and naturally empty.

original: abhijñānām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: abhijñānām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the higher knowledges that are unoriginated and naturally empty.

original: samādhīnām aham āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputrānutpannānāṃ svabhāvaśūnyānām utpādaṃ necchāmi /
analyzed: samādhīnām aham āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra anutpannānām svabhāva śūnyānām utpādam na icchāmi
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish for the origination of the concentrations that are unoriginated and naturally empty.
