analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā  saṃskṛta śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The nature of mental attention should be known as the nature of emptiness of the conditioned.🔽The emptiness of mental attention should be known as the emptiness of the emptiness of the conditioned.

analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of mental attention should be known as the isolation of the emptiness of the conditioned.

translated: The non-realization of mental attention should be known as the non-realization of the emptiness of the conditioned.

translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, mental non-existence should be known as the existence of the emptiness of the unconditioned.

analyzed: atyanta śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā  atyanta śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, the non-existence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-existence of the emptiness of all things.🔽The non-existence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-existence of the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: atyantaśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-existence of the emptiness of all things.

analyzed: atyanta śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  atyanta śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the emptiness of the emptiness of all things.🔽The isolation of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the isolation of the emptiness of all things.

original: atyantaśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /

translated: The non-realization of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-realization of the emptiness of all things.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, the non-existence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-existence of the emptiness of what is beyond limit.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /🔽anavarāgraśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā  an avara agra śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-existence of the emptiness of what is beyond limit.🔽The non-existence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-existence of the emptiness of what is beyond limit.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽anavarāgraśūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anavara agra śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā 🔽an avara agra śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the emptiness of what is beyond limit.🔽The isolation of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the isolation of what is beyond limit.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of the emptiness of no beginning or end should be known as the non-realization of mental activity.

original: anavakāraśūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental activity should be known as the existence of the emptiness of no composition.

original: anavakāraśūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of mental activity should be known as the non-existence of the emptiness of no composition.

original: anavakāraśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-intrinsic nature of mental activity should be known as the non-intrinsic nature of the emptiness of no composition.

original: anavakāraśūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽anavakāraśūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  anavakāra śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be known as the emptiness of the emptiness of no composition.🔽The isolation of mental activity should be known as the isolation of the emptiness of no composition.

original: anavakāraśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental activity should be known as the non-realization of the emptiness of no composition.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /🔽prakṛtiśūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /🔽prakṛtiśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā  prakṛti śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā  prakṛti śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental activity should be known as the existence of the emptiness of nature.🔽The non-existence of mental activity should be known as the non-existence of the emptiness of nature.🔽The non-intrinsic nature of mental activity should be known as the non-intrinsic nature of the emptiness of nature.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be known as the emptiness of the emptiness of nature.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of mental activity should be known through the isolation of the emptiness of essential nature.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental activity should be known through the non-realization of the emptiness of essential nature.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental activity should be known through the existence of the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /🔽sarvadharmaśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā  sarva dharma śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of mental activity should be known through the non-existence of all phenomena.🔽The naturelessness of mental activity should be known through the naturelessness of all phenomena.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽sarvadharmaśūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  sarva dharma śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be known through the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽The isolation of mental activity should be known through the isolation of all phenomena.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental activity should be known through the non-realization of all phenomena.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental activity should be known through the existence of the emptiness of specific characteristics.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā / ŚsP II
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of mental activity should be known through the non-existence of the emptiness of specific characteristics.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /🔽svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā  sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā aśūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The nature of mental attention should be known as the emptiness of its own mark.🔽The emptiness of mental attention should be known as the emptiness of the emptiness of its own mark.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of mental attention should be known as the isolation of the emptiness of its own mark.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental attention should be known as the non-realization of the emptiness of its own mark.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental attention should be known as the existence of the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of mental attention should be known as the non-existence of the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of mental attention should be known as the nature of the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental attention should be known as the emptiness of the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of mental attention should be known as the isolation of the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā anabhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra anabhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental attention should be known as the non-realization of the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, the non-existence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-existence of the emptiness of non-existence.

original: abhāvaśūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the existence of the emptiness of non-existence.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of intrinsic nature in mental activity should be understood in the same way as the intrinsic nature of the emptiness of non-existence.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽abhāvaśūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  abhāva śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the emptiness of the emptiness of non-existence.🔽The isolation of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the isolation of the emptiness of non-existence.

original: abhāvaśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-realization of the emptiness of non-existence.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, the non-existence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the non-existence of the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā  svabhāva śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā  svabhāva śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The absence of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the existence of the emptiness of intrinsic nature.🔽The absence of intrinsic nature in mental activity should be understood in the same way as the intrinsic nature of the emptiness of intrinsic nature.🔽The emptiness of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the emptiness of the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of mental activity should be understood in the same way as the isolation of the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental attention should be known as the non-realization of the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental attention should be known as the existence of the emptiness of the non-existence of intrinsic nature.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /🔽abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā  abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of mental attention should be known as the non-existence of the emptiness of the non-existence of intrinsic nature.🔽The intrinsic nature of mental attention should be known as the intrinsic nature of the emptiness of the non-existence of intrinsic nature.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental attention should be known as the emptiness of the emptiness of the non-existence of intrinsic nature.🔽The isolation of mental attention should be known as the isolation of the emptiness of the non-existence of intrinsic nature.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental attention should be known as the non-realization of the emptiness of the non-existence of intrinsic nature.

original: smṛtyupasthānāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /🔽smṛtyupasthānābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā  smṛti upasthāna abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental attention should be known as the non-existence of the applications of mindfulness.🔽The non-existence of mental attention should be known as the non-existence of the applications of mindfulness.

original: smṛtyupasthānāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The intrinsic nature of mental attention should be known as the intrinsic nature of the applications of mindfulness.

original: smṛtyupasthānaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽smṛtyupasthānaviviktatayā ŚsP II
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  smṛti upasthāna vivikta tayā
translated: The emptiness of the applications of mindfulness should be known as the emptiness of mental activity.

original: manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of the applications of mindfulness should be known as the isolation of mental activity.

original: smṛtyupasthānānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-comprehension of the applications of mindfulness should be known as the non-comprehension of mental activity.

original: samyakprahāṇāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇa asat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the right efforts should be known as the non-existence of mental activity.

original: samyakprahāṇābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇa abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of the right efforts should be known as the absence of mental activity.

original: samyakprahāṇāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇa asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The intrinsic nature of the right efforts should be known as the intrinsic nature of mental activity.

original: samyakprahāṇaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽samyakprahāṇaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇa śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  samyak prahāṇa vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of the right efforts should be known as the emptiness of mental activity.🔽The isolation of the right efforts should be known as the isolation of mental activity.

original: samyakprahāṇānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇa an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-comprehension of the right efforts should be known as the non-comprehension of mental activity.

original: ṛddhipādāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda āsattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra āsattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the bases of supernatural power should be known as the non-existence of mental activity.

original: ṛddhipādābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of the bases of supernatural power should be known as the absence of mental activity.

original: ṛddhipādāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of the bases of spiritual power should be known as the nature of mental attention.

original: ṛddhipādaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽ṛddhipādaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  ṛddhipāda vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of the bases of spiritual power should be known as the emptiness of mental attention.🔽The isolation of the bases of spiritual power should be known as the isolation of mental attention.

original: ṛddhipādānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of the bases of spiritual power should be known as the non-realization of mental attention.

original: indriyāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: indriya asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the faculties should be known as the non-existence of mental attention.

original: indriyābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: indriya abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of the faculties should be known as the non-existence of mental attention.

original: indriyāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: indriya asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of the faculties should be known as the nature of mental attention.

original: indriyaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: indriya śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of the faculties should be known as the emptiness of mental attention.

original: indriyaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: indriya vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of the faculties should be known as the isolation of mental attention.

original: indriyānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: indriya an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of the faculties should be known as the non-realization of mental attention.

original: balāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: bala asat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the powers should be known as the non-existence of mental attention.

original: balābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bala abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of the powers should be known as the non-existence of mental attention.

original: balāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bala asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: You should know that the nature of attention is the same as the nature of strength.

original: balaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bala śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: You should know that the emptiness of attention is the same as the emptiness of strength.

original: balaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bala vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: You should know that the isolation of attention is the same as the isolation of strength.

original: balānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bala an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: You should know that the non-realization of attention is the same as the non-realization of strength.

original: bodhyaṅgāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, you should know that the non-existence of the factors of awakening is the same as the non-existence of attention.

original: bodhyaṅgābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: You should know that the absence of the factors of awakening is the same as the absence of attention.

original: bodhyaṅgāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: You should know that the nature of the factors of awakening is the same as the nature of attention.

original: bodhyaṅgaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽bodhyaṅgaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  bodhyaṅga vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: You should know that the emptiness of the factors of awakening is the same as the emptiness of attention.🔽You should know that the isolation of the factors of awakening is the same as the isolation of attention.

original: bodhyaṅgānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: You should know that the non-realization of the factors of awakening is the same as the non-realization of attention.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga āsattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra āsattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, you should know that the non-existence of the noble eightfold path is the same as the non-existence of attention.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: You should know that the absence of the noble eightfold path is the same as the absence of attention.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of attention should be known as the nature of the noble eightfold path.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of attention should be known as the emptiness of the noble eightfold path.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of attention should be known as the isolation of the noble eightfold path.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /🔽ŚsP II
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā  śsp ii
translated: The non-realization of attention should be known as the non-realization of the noble eightfold path.

original: āryasatyāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /🔽āryasatyābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya satya asattayā āyuṣman chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā  ārya satya abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of attention should be known as the non-existence of the noble truths.🔽The non-existence of attention should be known as the non-existence of the noble truths.

original: āryasatyāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya satya asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of attention should be known as the nature of the noble truths.

original: āryasatyaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya satya śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of attention should be known as the emptiness of the noble truths.

original: āryasatyaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya satya vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of attention should be known as the isolation of the noble truths.

original: āryasatyānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārya satya an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of attention should be known as the non-realization of the noble truths.

original: dhyānāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhyāna asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of attention should be known as the non-existence of the concentrations.

original: dhyānābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhyāna abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of attention should be known as the non-existence of the concentrations.

original: dhyānāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhyāna asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of mental attention should be known to be the same as the nature of the absorptions.

original: dhyānaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhyāna śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of the absorptions should be known to be the emptiness of mental attention.

original: dhyānaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhyāna vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of the absorptions should be known to be the isolation of mental attention.

original: dhyānānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhyāna an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-awakening of the absorptions should be known to be the non-awakening of mental attention.

original: apramāṇāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: apramāṇa asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the formless [absorptions] should be known to be the non-existence of mental attention.

original: apramāṇābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: a pramāṇa abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-being of the formless [absorptions] should be known to be the non-being of mental attention.

original: apramāṇāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: apramāṇa asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of the formless [absorptions] should be known to be the nature of mental attention.

original: apramāṇaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: apramāṇa śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of the formless [absorptions] should be known to be the emptiness of mental attention.

original: apramāṇaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: a pramāṇa vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of the formless [absorptions] should be known to be the isolation of mental attention.

original: apramāṇānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: a pramāṇa an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-awakening of the formless [absorptions] should be known to be the non-awakening of mental attention.

original: ārūpyasamāpattyasattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpatti asat tayā āyuṣman chāradvatī putra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the formless [absorptions] should be known to be the non-existence of mental attention.

original: ārūpyasamāpattyabhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpatti abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-being of the formless [absorptions] should be known to be the non-being of mental attention.

original: ārūpyasamāpattyasvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpatti asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of mental attention should be known as the nature of the formless attainments.

original: ārūpyasamāpattiśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽ārūpyasamāpattiviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpatti śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  ārūpya samāpatti vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of the formless attainments should be known as the emptiness of mental attention.🔽The isolation of the formless attainments should be known as the isolation of mental attention.

original: ārūpyasamāpattyanabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpatti an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of the formless attainments should be known as the non-realization of mental attention.

original: vimokṣāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: vimokṣa asat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the liberations should be known as the non-existence of mental attention.

original: vimokṣābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: vimokṣa abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of the liberations should be known as the absence of mental attention.

original: vimokṣāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: vimokṣa asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of the liberations should be known as the nature of mental attention.

original: vimokṣaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽vimokṣaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: vimokṣa śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  vimokṣa vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of the liberations should be known as the emptiness of mental attention.🔽The isolation of the liberations should be known as the isolation of mental attention.

original: vimokṣānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: vimokṣa an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of the liberations should be known as the non-realization of mental attention.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattyasattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpatti asat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the successive absorptions should be known as the non-existence of mental attention.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattyabhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpatti abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of mental activity should be known as the absence of the attainments of successive stations.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattyasvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpatti asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of the nature of mental activity should be known as the absence of the nature of the attainments of successive stations.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattiśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽anupūrvavihārasamāpattiviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpatti śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  anupūrva vihāra samāpatti vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be known as the emptiness of the attainments of successive stations.🔽The isolation of mental activity should be known as the isolation of the attainments of successive stations.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattyanabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpatti an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-awakening of mental activity should be known as the non-awakening of the attainments of successive stations.

original: śūnyatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā / ŚsP II
analyzed: śūnyatā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the absence of mental activity should be known as the existence of emptiness.

original: śūnyatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: śūnyatā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of mental activity should be known as the non-existence of emptiness.

original: śūnyatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /🔽śūnyatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: śūnyatā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā  śūnyatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The absence of the nature of mental activity should be known as the nature of emptiness.🔽The emptiness of mental activity should be known as the emptiness of emptiness.

original: śūnyatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: śūnyatā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of mental activity should be known as the isolation of emptiness.

original: śūnyatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: śūnyatā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-awakening of mental activity should be known as the non-awakening of emptiness.

original: ānimittāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: ā animitta asat tayā āyuṣman chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the nonexistence of mental activity should be understood as the nonexistence of signs.

original: ānimittābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ā nimitta abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nonexistence of mental activity should be understood as the absence of signs.

original: ānimittāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ā nimitta asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The intrinsic nature of mental activity should be understood as the intrinsic nature of the absence of signs.

original: ānimittaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ānimitta śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be understood as the emptiness of signs.

original: ānimittaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ā nimitta vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of mental activity should be understood as the isolation of signs.

original: ānimittānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: ā nimitta an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The nonawakening of mental activity should be understood as the nonawakening of signs.

original: apraṇihitāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: apraṇihita asat tayā āyuṣman chāradvatīputra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the nonexistence of mental activity should be understood as the nonexistence of aspirations.

original: apraṇihitābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: apraṇihita abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nonexistence of mental activity should be understood as the absence of aspirations.

original: apraṇihitāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: apraṇihita asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The intrinsic nature of mental activity should be understood as the intrinsic nature of the absence of aspirations.

original: apraṇihitaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽apraṇihitaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: apraṇihita śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  apraṇihita vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be understood as the emptiness of aspirations.🔽The isolation of mental activity should be understood as the isolation of aspirations.

original: apraṇihitānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: apraṇihita an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The nonawakening of mental activity should be understood as the nonawakening of aspirations.”

original: abhijñāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhijñā sattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the nonexistence of the higher knowledges should be known as the nonexistence of mental activity.

original: abhijñābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhijñā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nonexistence of the higher knowledges should be known as the nonexistence of mental activity.

original: abhijñāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhijñā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of the higher knowledges should be known as the nature of mental activity.

original: abhijñāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhijñā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of the higher knowledges should be known as the emptiness of mental activity.

original: abhijñāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhijñā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of the higher knowledges should be known as the isolation of mental activity.

original: abhijñānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: abhijñā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The nonawakening of the higher knowledges should be known as the nonawakening of mental activity.

original: samādhyasattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /🔽samādhyabhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: samādhi asat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā  samādhi abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the nonexistence of meditative absorption should be known as the nonexistence of mental activity.🔽The nonexistence of meditative absorption should be known as the nonexistence of mental activity.

original: samādhyasvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: samādhi asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of meditative absorption should be known as the nature of mental activity.

original: samādhiśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽samādhiviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: samādhi śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  samādhi vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of meditative absorption should be known as the emptiness of mental activity.🔽The isolation of meditative absorption should be known as the isolation of mental activity.

original: samādhyanabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: samādhi an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The nonawakening of meditative absorption should be known as the nonawakening of mental activity.”

original: dhāraṇīmukhāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukha asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the dhāraṇī gateways should be known as the non-existence of mental activity.

original: dhāraṇīmukhābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukha abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of the dhāraṇī gateways should be known as the non-existence of mental activity.

original: dhāraṇīmukhāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukha asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The intrinsic nature of the dhāraṇī gateways should be known as the intrinsic nature of mental activity.

original: dhāraṇīmukhaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽dhāraṇīmukhaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukha śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  dhāraṇī mukha vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of the dhāraṇī gateways should be known as the emptiness of mental activity.🔽The isolation of the dhāraṇī gateways should be known as the isolation of mental activity.

original: dhāraṇīmukhānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukha an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-awakening of the dhāraṇī gateways should be known as the non-awakening of mental activity.

original: tathāgatabalāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: tathāgata bala asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of the powers of the tathāgatas should be known as the non-existence of mental activity.

original: tathāgatabalābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: tathāgata bala abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of the powers of the tathāgatas should be known as the non-existence of mental activity.

original: tathāgatabalāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: tathāgata bala asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The intrinsic nature of the powers of the tathāgatas should be known as the intrinsic nature of mental activity.

original: tathāgatabalaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽tathāgatabalaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā ŚsP II
analyzed: tathāgata bala śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā 🔽tathāgata bala vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā
translated: The emptiness of the powers of the tathāgatas should be known as the emptiness of mental activity.🔽The isolation of the powers of the tathāgatas should be known as the isolation of mental activity.

original: veditavyā / tathāgatabalānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: veditavyā tathāgata bala an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: It should be known that the non-realization of the mental attentions is due to the non-realization of the powers of the Tathāgata.

original: vaiśāradyāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: vaiśāradya asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental attentions should be known as the non-existence of the fearlessnesses.

original: vaiśāradyābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: vaiśāradya abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of mental attentions should be known as the absence of fearlessness.

original: vaiśāradyāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: vaiśāradya asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The naturelessness of mental attentions should be known as the naturelessness of fearlessness.

original: vaiśāradyaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽vaiśāradyaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: vaiśāradya śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  vaiśāradya vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental attentions should be known as the emptiness of fearlessness.🔽The isolation of mental attentions should be known as the isolation of fearlessness.

original: vaiśāradyānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: vaiśāradya an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental attentions should be known as the non-realization of fearlessness.

original: pratisaṃvidasattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: pratisaṃvid asat tayā āyuṣman chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental attentions should be known as the non-existence of the analytical knowledges.

original: pratisaṃvidabhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: pratisaṃvid abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of mental attentions should be known as the absence of the analytical knowledges.

original: pratisaṃvidasvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: pratisaṃvid asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The naturelessness of mental attentions should be known as the naturelessness of the analytical knowledges.

original: pratisaṃvidśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: prati saṃvid śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental attentions should be known as the emptiness of the analytical knowledges.

original: pratisaṃvidviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: pratisaṃvid vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of mental activity should be known through the isolation of the analytical knowledges.

original: pratisaṃvidanabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: pratisaṃvid an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental activity should be known through the non-realization of the analytical knowledges.

original: mahāmaitryasattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā maitrī asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental activity should be known through the non-existence of great loving-kindness.

original: mahāmaitryabhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā maitrī abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of mental activity should be known through the absence of great loving-kindness.

original: mahāmaitryasvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā maitrī asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The intrinsic nature of mental activity should be known through the intrinsic nature of great loving-kindness.

original: mahāmaitrīśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽mahāmaitrīviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā maitrī śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  mahā maitrī vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be known through the emptiness of great loving-kindness.🔽The isolation of mental activity should be known through the isolation of great loving-kindness.

original: mahāmaitryanabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahāmaitrī anabhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra anabhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental activity should be known through the non-realization of great loving-kindness.

original: mahākaruṇāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā sattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra āsattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental activity should be known through the non-existence of great compassion.

original: mahākaruṇābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of mental activity should be known through the absence of great compassion.

original: mahākaruṇā'svabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The intrinsic nature of mental activity should be known through the intrinsic nature of great compassion.

original: mahākaruṇāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental activity should be known through the emptiness of great compassion.

original: mahākaruṇāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of attention should be known through the isolation of great compassion.

original: mahākaruṇānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of attention should be known through the non-realization of great compassion.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /🔽āveṇikabuddhadharmābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharma āsattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra āsattā veditavyā  āveṇika buddha dharma abhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of attention should be known through the non-existence of the unique qualities of the Buddha.🔽The absence of attention should be known through the absence of the unique qualities of the Buddha.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharma asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The naturelessness of attention should be known through the naturelessness of the unique qualities of the Buddha.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽āveṇikabuddhadharmaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharma śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  āveṇika buddha dharma vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of attention should be known through the emptiness of the unique qualities of the Buddha.🔽The isolation of attention should be known through the isolation of the unique qualities of the Buddha.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharma an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of attention should be known through the non-realization of the unique qualities of the Buddha.

original: sarvajñatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /🔽sarvajñatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarvajña tā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā  sarvajña tā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of attention should be known through the existence of omniscience.🔽The absence of attention should be known through the absence of omniscience.

original: sarvajñatāsvabhāvatayā ŚsP II
analyzed: sarvajña tā svabhāva tayā
translated: The naturelessness of attention should be known through the naturelessness of omniscience.🔽The emptiness of attention should be known through the emptiness of omniscience.

original: manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of attention should be known through the isolation of omniscience.🔽The non-realization of attention should be known through the non-realization of omniscience.

original: sarvajñatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽sarvajñatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarvajña tā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  sarvajña tā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of attention should be known through the emptiness of omniscience.🔽The isolation of attention should be known through the isolation of omniscience.

original: sarvajñatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarvajña tā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of attention should be known through the non-realization of omniscience.

original: mārgākārajñatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asat tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of attention should be known through the existence of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, Venerable Śāradvatīputra.

original: mārgākārajñatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of attention should be known through the non-existence of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: mārgākārajñatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The intrinsic nature of attention should be known through the intrinsic nature of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: mārgākārajñatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽mārgākārajñatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  mārga ākāra jña tā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of attention should be known through the emptiness of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽The isolation of attention should be known through the isolation of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: mārgākārajñatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of attention should be known through the non-realization of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: sarvākārajñatāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā sat tayā āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of attention should be known through the existence of the knowledge of all aspects, Venerable Śāradvatīputra.

original: sarvākārajñatābhāvatayā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā bhāva tayā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The non-existence of attention should be known through the non-existence of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sarvākārajñatāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā svabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of mental attention should be known as the nature of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sarvākārajñatāśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jñatā śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental attention should be known as the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sarvākārajñatāviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The isolation of mental attention should be known as the isolation of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sarvākārajñatānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental attention should be known as the non-realization of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bodhyaṅgāsattayāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra manasikārāsattā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga asattayā āyuṣmam chāradvatīputra manasikāra asattā veditavyā
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the non-existence of mental attention should be known as the non-existence of the factors of awakening.

original: bodhyaṅgābhāvatyā manasikārābhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga abhāvatyā manasikāra abhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The absence of mental attention should be known as the absence of the factors of awakening.

original: bodhyaṅgāsvabhāvatayā manasikārāsvabhāvatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga asvabhāva tayā manasikāra asvabhāva tā veditavyā
translated: The nature of mental attention should be known as the nature of the factors of awakening.

original: bodhyaṅgaśūnyatayā manasikāraśūnyatā veditavyā /🔽bodhyaṅgaviviktatayā manasikāraviviktatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga śūnyatayā manasikāra śūnyatā veditavyā  bodhyaṅga vivikta tayā manasikāra vivikta tā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of mental attention should be known as the emptiness of the factors of awakening.🔽The isolation of mental attention should be known as the isolation of the factors of awakening.

original: bodhyaṅgānabhisaṃbodhanatayā manasikārānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga an abhisaṃbodhana tayā manasikāra an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā
translated: The non-realization of mental attention should be known as the non-realization of the factors of awakening.

original: anenāyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'virahita eva tena manasikāreṇa veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: anena āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ virahitaḥ eva tena manasikāreṇa veditavyaḥ
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as never separated from that mental attention.

original: yad uta mahākaruṇāmanasikārena /
analyzed: yat uta mahā karuṇā manasikārena
translated: Namely, by attending to great compassion.

original: atha bhagavān āyuṣmate subhūtaye sādhukāram adāt /
analyzed: atha bhagavān āyuṣmate subhūtaye sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to the Venerable Subhuti:

original: sādhu sādhu subhūte /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu subhūte
translated: Good, good, Subhuti!

original: evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvebhyo mahāsattvebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitopadeṣṭavyā /
analyzed: evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvebhyaḥ mahāsattvebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitā upadeṣṭavyā
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom should be taught to the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas.

original: yathā tvam upadiśasi yathāpi taṃ tathāgatasyānubhāvena evaṃ ca punar bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: yathā tvam upadiśasi yathā api tam tathāgatasya anubhāvena evam ca punar bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: As you teach, it is by the power of the Tathagata. Thus, the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: yathā tvam upadiśasi / asmin khalu punaḥ prajñāpāramitā parivartā /
analyzed: yathā tvam upadiśasi asmin khalu punar prajñāpāramitā parivartā
translated: As you teach. In this chapter on the perfection of wisdom,

original: āyuṣmatā subhūtinā bhāṣyamāne ayam trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ ṣaḍ vikāram akaṃpat prākaṃpat saṃprākaṃpat /🔽avedhat prāvedhat saṃprāvedhat /
analyzed: āyuṣmatā subhūtinā bhāṣyamāne ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāram akaṃpat prākaṃpat saṃprākaṃpat  avedhat prāvedhat saṃprāvedhat
translated: when the Venerable Subhuti was speaking, this great trichiliocosm shook in six ways, trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely.

original: acarat prācarat saṃprācarat /🔽akṣubhyat ŚsP II 🔽prākṣubhyat saṃprākṣubhyat /🔽agarjat prāgarjat saṃprāgarjat /
analyzed: acarat prācarat saṃprācarat  akṣubhyat śsp ii  prākṣubhyat saṃprākṣubhyat  agarjat prāgarjat saṃprāgarjat
translated: It quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely.🔽It quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely.🔽It shuddered, shuddered strongly, and shuddered intensely.🔽It roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely.

original: araṇat prāraṇat saṃprāraṇat /
analyzed: araṇat prāraṇat saṃprāraṇat
translated: It groaned, groaned strongly, and groaned intensely.

original: pūrvā dig avanamati sma /
analyzed: pūrvā diś avanamati sma
translated: The eastern direction inclined,

original: paścimā dig unnamati sma /🔽pūrvā dig unnamati sma /
analyzed: paścimā diś unnamati sma  pūrvā diś unnamati sma
translated: the western direction rose up,🔽the eastern direction rose up,

original: paścimā dig avanamati sma /🔽uttarā dig avanamati sma /
analyzed: paścimā diś avanamati sma  uttarā diś avanamati sma
translated: the western direction subsided,🔽the northern direction subsided,

original: dakṣiṇā dig unnamati sma /🔽uttarā dig unnamati sma /
analyzed: dakṣiṇā diś unnamati sma  uttarā diś unnamati sma
translated: the southern direction rose up,🔽the northern direction rose up,

original: dakṣiṇā dig avanamati sma /
analyzed: dakṣiṇā diś avanamati sma
translated: the southern direction subsided,

original: madhyeṣv avanamati sma /🔽anteṣv unnamati sma /
analyzed: madhyeṣu avanamati sma  anteṣu unnamati sma
translated: in the middle it subsided,🔽at the edges it rose up,

original: anteṣv avanamati sma /
analyzed: anteṣu avanamati sma
translated: at the edges it subsided,

original: madhyeṣu unnamati sma /
analyzed: madhyeṣu unnamati sma
translated: in the middle it rose up.

original: atha bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyāṃ smitaṃ prādur akārṣīt /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tasyām velāyām smitam prādur akārṣīt
translated: Then the Blessed One smiled at that time.

original: athāyuṣmāṃ subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /

translated: in countless, innumerable world systems, Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones are teaching just this perfection of wisdom to bodhisattva great beings.

original: yathaivāhaṃ subhūte iha sahāyāṃ lokadhātau prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣe tathaiva paścimottarasyāṃ
analyzed: yathā eva aham subhūte iha sahāyām lokadhātau prajñāpāramitām bhāṣe tathā eva paścima uttarasyām
translated: Just as I, Subhuti, am teaching the perfection of wisdom in this Saha world system, in the same way, in the western and northern directions, in the eastern and southern directions, in the northeast, in the southeast, in the southwest, in the northwest, below and above, in all the ten directions, in infinite, countless world systems, Bodhisattvas, the great beings, are teaching the perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.🔽

original: diśy asaṃkhyeyeṣv aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā imām🔽eva prajñāpāramitāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ bhāṣante /🔽yathaivāhaṃ subhūte iha sahāyāṃ lokadhātau prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣe tathaivādhastād
analyzed: diśi asaṃkhyeyeṣu aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ imām  eva prajñāpāramitām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām bhāṣante  yathā eva aham subhūte iha sahāyām lokadhātau prajñāpāramitām bhāṣe tathā eva adhastāt
translated: Just as I am teaching the perfection of wisdom in this Sahā world system, in the same way, Subhūti, in the western direction in innumerable, immeasurable world systems, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas are teaching just this perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: diśy asaṃkhyeyeṣv aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā imām🔽eva prajñāpāramitāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ bhāṣante /
analyzed: diśi asaṃkhyeyeṣu aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ imām  eva prajñāpāramitām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām bhāṣante
translated: Just as I am teaching the perfection of wisdom in this Sahā world system, in the same way, Subhūti, in the southern direction in innumerable, immeasurable world systems, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas are teaching just this perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: yathaivāhaṃ subhūte iha sahāyāṃ lokadhātau prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣe tathaivopariṣṭād🔽diśy asaṃkhyeyeṣv aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā imām
