translated: Just as I am teaching the perfection of wisdom in this Sahā world system, in the same way, Subhūti, in the northern direction in innumerable, immeasurable world systems, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas are teaching just this perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.🔽Just as I am teaching the perfection of wisdom in this Sahā world system, in the same way, Subhūti, in the downward direction in innumerable, immeasurable world systems, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas are teaching just this perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: eva prajñāpāramitāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ bhāṣante /
analyzed: eva prajñāpāramitām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām bhāṣante
translated: Just as I am teaching the perfection of wisdom in this Sahā world system, in the same way, Subhūti, in the upward direction in innumerable, immeasurable world systems, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas are teaching just this perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: yasmin khalu punaḥ subhūte prajñāpāramitānirdeśe bhāṣyamāṇe dvādaśānām ayutānāṃ devamāṇuṣyakānāṃ prajñāpāramitāyā anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntir
analyzed: yasmin khalu punar subhūte prajñāpāramitā nirdeśe bhāṣyamāṇe dvādaśānām ayutānām deva māṇuṣyakānām prajñāpāramitāyāḥ anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ
translated: Subhūti, when this explanation of the perfection of wisdom was being given, twelve myriads of gods and men attained the acceptance that phenomena are not produced with regard to the perfection of wisdom.

original: teṣām api samantād daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣamāṇānām asaṃkhyeyānām aprameyānāṃ sattvānām anuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: teṣām api samantāt daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhānām bhagavatām prajñāpāramitām bhāṣamāṇānām asaṃkhyeyānām aprameyānām sattvānām anuttarāyām
translated: And also of those, in all the world systems in the ten directions, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, were teaching the perfection of wisdom, and innumerable, immeasurable beings generated the resolve for complete

original: samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpannāni /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpannāni
translated: perfect enlightenment.

original: śatasāhasryāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ subhūtiparivartas trayodaśamaḥ
analyzed: śatasāhasryāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ subhūti parivartaḥ trayodaśamaḥ
translated: The thirteenth chapter of the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, of Subhuti.

original: ŚsP II
analyzed: śsp ii
translated: ShSs_2

original: atha khalu yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau mahārājānas te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasāhasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi
analyzed: atha khalu yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau mahā rājānaḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sāhasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi
translated: Then, as many great kings as there are in the great trichiliocosm, all of them together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devaputras, assembled right there in that assembly.

original: saṃnipatitā abhūvan /
analyzed: saṃnipatitāḥ abhūvan
translated: They were all present.

original: yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau śakrā devendrās te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi saṃnipatitā
analyzed: yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau śakrāḥ deva indrāḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi saṃnipatitā
translated: As many Śakras, lords of the gods, as there are in the great trichiliocosm, all of them together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devaputras, assembled right there in that assembly.

original: yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau suyāmā devaputrās te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi saṃnipatitā🔽yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau saṃtuṣitā devaputrās te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi saṃnipatitā🔽yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau nirmitā devaputrās te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi saṃnipatitā
analyzed: yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau suyāmāḥ devaputrāḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi saṃnipatitā  yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau saṃtuṣitāḥ devaputrāḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi saṃnipatitā  yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau nirmitāḥ devaputrāḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi saṃnipatitā
translated: As many as there are devas in the Heaven of Yāma in the great trichiliocosm, all of them assembled together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas in that very assembly.🔽As many as there are devas in the Heaven of Joy in the great trichiliocosm, all of them assembled together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas in that very assembly.🔽As many as there are devas in the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations in the great trichiliocosm, all of them assembled together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas in that very assembly.

original: yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau vaśavartinā devaputrās te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi 🔽saṃnipatitā abhūvan /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau vaśavartinā devaputrāḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi 🔽saṃnipatitāḥ abhūvan
translated: As many as there are devas in the Heaven of Free Enjoyment of Manifestations by Others in the great trichiliocosm, all of them assembled together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas in that very assembly.

original: yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau mahābrahmāṇas te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi saṃnipatitā🔽yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau ābhāsvarā devaputrās te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi saṃnipatitā
analyzed: yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau mahābrahmāṇaḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi saṃnipatitā  yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau ābhāsvarāḥ devaputrāḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi saṃnipatitā
translated: All the Mahā-Brahmā gods in the trichiliocosm, together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devaputras, assembled right there in that assembly.🔽All the Ābhāsvara gods in the trichiliocosm, together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devaputras, assembled right there in that assembly.

original: yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau śubhakṛtsnā devaputrās te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi
analyzed: yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau śubhakṛtsnāḥ devaputrāḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi
translated: All the Śubhakṛtsna gods in the trichiliocosm, together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devaputras, assembled right there in that assembly.

original: saṃnipatitā abhūvan /
analyzed: saṃnipatitāḥ abhūvan
translated: They all assembled right there in that assembly.

original: yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau bṛhatphalā devaputrās te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi
analyzed: yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau bṛhatphalāḥ devaputrāḥ te sarve nekaiḥ devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi
translated: All the Bṛhatphala gods in the trichiliocosm, together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devaputras, assembled right there in that assembly.

original: yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrās te sarve 'nekair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva parṣadi
analyzed: yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ te sarve nekaiḥ deva putra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva parṣadi
translated: As many as there are gods of the Pure Abodes in the great trichiliocosm, all of them assembled together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas in that very assembly,

original: saṃnipatitā abhūvan /🔽yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau yaś ca teṣāṃ cāturmahārājakāyikānāṃ devāṇāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: saṃnipatitāḥ abhūvan  yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau yaḥ ca teṣām cāturmahārājakāyikānām devāṇām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: and they became present there.🔽As much as is the bodily radiance born of the ripening of karma of those Caturmaharajakayika devas in the great trichiliocosm,

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ trayastriṃśānāṃ devāṇāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /🔽yaś ca teṣāṃ yāmānāṃ devāṇāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām trayastriṃśānām devāṇām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ  yaḥ ca teṣām yāmānām devāṇām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: as much as is the bodily radiance born of the ripening of karma of those Trāyastriṃśa devas,🔽as much as is the bodily radiance born of the ripening of karma of those Yāma devas,

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ tuṣitānāṃ devāṇāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /🔽yaś ca teṣāṃ nirmāṇaratīnāṃ devānāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām tuṣitānām devāṇām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ  yaḥ ca teṣām nirmāṇaratīnām devānām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: as much as is the bodily radiance born of the ripening of karma of those Tuṣita devas,🔽as much as is the bodily radiance born of the ripening of karma of those Nirmāṇarati devas,

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ paranirmitavaśavartināṃ devāṇāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām paranirmitavaśavartinām devāṇām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: as much as is the bodily radiance born of the ripening of karma of those Paranirmitavaśavartin devas,

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ brahmakāyikānāṃ devāṇāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /🔽yaś ca teṣām ŚsP II
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām brahmakāyikānām devāṇām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ 🔽yaḥ ca teṣām śsp ii
translated: as much as is the bodily radiance born of the ripening of karma of those Brahmakāyika devas,🔽as much as is the bodily radiance born of the ripening of karma of those Ābhāsvara devas,🔽as much as is the bodily radiance born of the ripening of karma of those Śubhakṛtsna devas,

original: ābhāsvarāṇām devānāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: ābhāsvarāṇām devānām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: The radiance of the bodies of the gods of the Abhasvara realm is born from the ripening of karma.

original: yaś ca teṣām śubhakṛtsnānām devānāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām śubhakṛtsnānām devānām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: The radiance of the bodies of the gods of the Śubhakṛtsna realm is born from the ripening of karma.

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ bṛhatphalānāṃ devānāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām bṛhatphalānām devānām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: The radiance of the bodies of the gods of the Bṛhatphala realm is born from the ripening of karma.

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ śuddhāvāsakāyikānāṃ devānāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām śuddhāvāsa kāyikānām devānām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: The radiance of the bodies of the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm is born from the ripening of karma.

original: sa tathāgatasya prakṛtyavabhāsasya śatatamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti /🔽sahasratamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: sa tathāgatasya prakṛti avabhāsasya śatatamīm api kalām na upaiti  sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: That does not approach even a hundredth part of the natural radiance of the Tathāgata.🔽It does not approach even a thousandth part.

original: śatasahasratamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: It does not approach even a hundred-thousandth part.

original: koṭīniyutaśatasahasratamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: It does not approach even a koṭi-niyuta-śata-thousandth part.

original: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām apy upamām apy upaniśām api na kṣamate /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api upaniśām api na kṣamate
translated: It cannot bear comparison, cannot bear counting, cannot bear reckoning, cannot bear measuring, cannot bear being exemplified.

original: tathāgatasya prakṛtyā ābhāyāḥ purataḥ sarvās tā devānāṃ karmavipākajā ābhā na bhāsante na tapanti na virocante /
analyzed: tathāgatasya prakṛtyāḥ ābhāyāḥ puratas sarvāḥ tāḥ devānām karma vipāka jāḥ ābhāḥ na bhāsante na tapanti na virocante
translated: In front of the natural radiance of the Tathāgata, all those radiances born from the ripening of karma of the gods do not shine, do not glow, do not illuminate.

original: tathāgatasyaiṣābhā sāgrākhyāyate jyeṣṭhākhyāyate viśiṣṭākhyāyate varākhyāyate pravarākhyāte praṇītākhyāyate anuttarākhyāyate niruttarākhyāyate /
analyzed: tathāgatasya eṣā ābhā sāgrā ākhyāyate jyeṣṭhā ākhyāyate viśiṣṭā ākhyāyate varā ākhyāyate pravarā ākhyāte praṇītā ākhyāyate anuttarā ākhyāyate niruttarā ākhyāyate
translated: This is the foremost of the Tathāgata's qualities, it is called the best, it is called the most excellent, it is called the supreme, it is called the highest, it is called the unsurpassed, it is called the matchless.

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, said this to the venerable Subhūti:

original: ete bhadanta subhūte yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau cāturmahārājakāyikā
analyzed: ete bhadanta subhūte yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau cāturmahārājakāyikā
translated: Reverend Subhūti, all those gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings,

original: devāḥ trayastriṃśā devā yāmā devā tuṣitā devā nirmāṇaratayo devāḥ paranirmitavaśavartino
analyzed: devāḥ trayastriṃśāḥ devāḥ yāmāḥ devā tuṣitāḥ devāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ devāḥ
translated: the gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods,

original: devā brahmakāyikā devā ābhāsvarā devāḥ śubhakṛtsnā devā bṛhatphalā devāḥ śuddhāvāsakāyikā
analyzed: devāḥ brahmakāyikāḥ devāḥ ābhāsvarāḥ devāḥ śubhakṛtsnāḥ devāḥ bṛhatphalāḥ devāḥ śuddhāvāsakāyikā
translated: the Brahmākāyika gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Śuddhāvāsa gods,

original: devās te sarve saṃnipatitā bhadanta subhūte dharmaśravaṇāya prajñāpāramitopadeśaṃ śrotukāmāḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ te sarve saṃnipatitāḥ bhadanta subhūte dharma śravaṇāya prajñāpāramitā upadeśam śrotu kāmāḥ
translated: all of them have assembled, reverend Subhūti, to listen to the Dharma, desiring to hear the instruction on the perfection of wisdom.

original: kathaṃ bhadanta subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: katham bhadanta subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: How, reverend Subhūti, should a bodhisattva mahāsattva stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: katamā ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: katamā ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā
translated: What is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva?

original: kathaṃ ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāraitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: katham ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāraitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: And how should a bodhisattva-mahāsattva train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakram devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: tena hi kauśika śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikurūpadeśyāmi buddhānubhāvena buddhādhiṣṭhānena
analyzed: tena hi kauśika śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca buddha anubhāvena buddha adhiṣṭhānena
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, listen well and accurately, and pay attention as I teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattvas, the great beings,🔽by the power of the Buddha, by the authorization of the Buddha,

original: ca bodhisattvebhyo mahāsattvebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yathā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena🔽prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyaṃ yathā ca śikṣitavyam / yaiś ca devaputrair anuttarāyai🔽samyaksaṃbodhaye cittaṃ notpāditam /
analyzed: ca bodhisattvebhyaḥ mahāsattvebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām yathā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena  prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam yathā ca śikṣitavyam yaiḥ ca deva putraiḥ anuttarāyai  samyaksaṃbodhaye cittam na utpāditam
translated: how a bodhisattva-mahāsattva should stand in the perfection of wisdom, and how he should train,🔽and those gods who have not yet given rise to the mind of unsurpassed,

original: tair apy anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye cittam utpādayitavyam / ye punar avakrāntasamyaktvanyāmāt /
analyzed: taiḥ api anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye cittam utpādayitavyam ye punar avakrānta samyaktva nyāmāt
translated: perfect enlightenment should also give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. But those who have already entered into the certainty of perfection

original: te pratibalā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye cittam utpādayitum / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: te pratibalāḥ anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye cittam utpādayitum tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: are able to give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Why is that?

original: ŚsP II
analyzed: śsp ii

original: baddhasimā hi te saṃsārasrotasaḥ /
analyzed: baddha simāḥ hi te saṃsāra srotasaḥ
translated: For they are bound to the stream of cyclic existence.

original: api tu khalu punas teṣām apy anumode saced anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhyaye cittam utpādayati /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar teṣām api anumode saced anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhyaye cittam utpādayati
translated: But I rejoice in them too, if they have aroused the mind set on complete knowing.

original: nāhaṃ teṣāṃ kuśalapakṣasyāntarāyaṃ karomi viśiṣṭebhyo hi dharmebhyo viśiṣṭatamā dharmā adhyālambitavyaḥ /
analyzed: na aham teṣām kuśala pakṣasya antarāyam karomi viśiṣṭebhyaḥ hi dharmebhyaḥ viśiṣṭatamāḥ dharmāḥ adhyālambitavyaḥ
translated: I do not create an obstacle for their wholesome side, for one should take hold of the most distinguished teachings from among the distinguished teachings.

original: tatra katamā kauśika bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: tatra katamā kauśika bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā
translated: Here, Kauśika, what is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva?

original: iha kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: iha kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: Here, Kauśika, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, with a thought connected with complete knowing,

original: rūpam anityato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam anityataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: should pay attention to form as impermanent.

original: rūpaṃ duḥkhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Form should be paid attention to as suffering.

original: rūpam anātmato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽rūpaṃ śāntato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam anātmataḥ manasi kartavyam  rūpam śāntataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Form should be paid attention to as non-self.🔽Form should be paid attention to as peaceful.

original: rūpaṃ viviktato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽rūpaṃ rogato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽rūpaṃ gaṇḍato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam viviktataḥ manasi kartavyam  rūpam rogataḥ manasi kartavyam  rūpam gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Form should be paid attention to as secluded.🔽Form should be paid attention to as a disease.🔽Form should be paid attention to as a boil.

original: rūpaṃ śalyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽rūpam aghato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam śalyataḥ manasi kartavyam  rūpam aghataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Form should be paid attention to as a thorn.🔽Form should be paid attention to as a calamity.

original: rūpam ābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Form should be paid attention to as an affliction.

original: rūpaṃ parato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam paratas manasi kartavyam
translated: Form should be given attention as being other.

original: rūpaṃ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽rūpaṃ calato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyam  rūpam calataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Form should be given attention as subject to destruction.🔽Form should be given attention as unsteady.

original: rūpaṃ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽rūpaṃ bhayato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam prabhaṅgulataḥ manasi kartavyam  rūpam bhayataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Form should be given attention as fragile.🔽Form should be given attention as fearful.

original: rūpam upasargato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽rūpaṃ śūnyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽rūpam anātmīyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽rūpam anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam upasargataḥ manasi kartavyam  rūpam śūnyatas manasi kartavyam  rūpam anātmīyataḥ manasikartavyam  rūpam manasikartavyam
translated: Form should be given attention as a disease.🔽Form should be given attention as a boil.🔽Form should be given attention as a dart.🔽Form should be given attention as misery.

original: rūpaṃ vyābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Form should be given attention as a plague.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of enlightenment that is connected with the knowledge of all modes.

original: vedanānityato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā duḥkhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā nityataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as impermanent.🔽Feeling should be given attention as painful.

original: vedanānātmato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā śāntato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā viviktato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā rogato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā gaṇḍato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā an ātmataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā śāntataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā viviktataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā rogataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as a disease.🔽Feeling should be given attention as a boil.🔽Feeling should be given attention as a dart.

original: vedanā śalyato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā śalyataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as misery.

original: vedanāghato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanāghataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as a plague.

original: vedanābādhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā bādhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as a disease.

original: vedanā parato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā pralopadharmato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā calato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā paratas manasi kartavyā  vedanā pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā calataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as a boil.🔽Feeling should be given attention as a dart.🔽Feeling should be given attention as a calamity.

original: vedanā prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā bhayato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā manasi kartavyā  vedanā bhayataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as a misfortune.🔽Feeling should be given attention as an affliction.

original: vedanopasargato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā śūnyato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanānātmīyato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā nāśvāsikato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā upasargataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā śūnyatas manasi kartavyā  vedanā an ātmīyataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā na āśvāsikataḥ manasikartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as an entanglement.🔽Feeling should be given attention as a plague.🔽Feeling should be given attention as a disaster.

original: vedanā vyābādhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as a plague.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of perfect enlightenment that is connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: saṃjñānityato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā nityataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be given attention as impermanent.

original: saṃjñā duḥkhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be given attention as suffering.

original: saṃjñā nātmato manasikartavyā /🔽saṃjñā śāntato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā na ātmataḥ manasi kartavyā  saṃjñā śāntataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be given attention as non-self.🔽Perception should be given attention as peaceful.

original: saṃjñā viviktato manasikartavyā /🔽saṃjñā rogato manasikartavyā /🔽saṃjñā gaṇḍato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā viviktataḥ manasi kartavyā  saṃjñā rogataḥ manasi kartavyā  saṃjñā gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be given attention as empty.🔽Perception should be given attention as without self.🔽Perception should be given attention as a disease.🔽Perception should be given attention as a boil.

original: saṃjñā śalyato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā śalyataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be given attention as a dart.🔽Perception should be given attention as a calamity.

original: saṃjñāghato manasikartavyā /🔽saṃjñābādhato ŚsP II 🔽manasikartavyā /🔽saṃjñā parato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā ghataḥ manasi kartavyā  saṃjñā bādhataḥ śsp ii  manasi kartavyā  saṃjñā paratas manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be regarded as a blow.🔽Perception should be regarded as a disaster.🔽Perception should be regarded as coming from elsewhere.

original: saṃjñā pralopadharmato manasikartavyā /🔽saṃjñā calato manasikartavyā /🔽saṃjñā prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyā  saṃjñā calataḥ manasi kartavyā  saṃjñā pra bhaṅgulataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be regarded as subject to destruction.🔽Perception should be regarded as unsteady.🔽Perception should be regarded as fragile.

original: saṃjñā bhayato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā bhayataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be regarded as fearful.

original: saṃjñopasargato manasikartavyā /🔽saṃjñā śūnyato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā upasargataḥ manasi kartavyā  saṃjñā śūnyatas manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be regarded as an onslaught.🔽Perception should be regarded as empty.

original: saṃjñānātmlyato manasikartavyā /🔽saṃjñā nāśvāsikato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: manasi kartavyā  saṃjñā na āśvāsikataḥ manasikartavyā
translated: Perception should be regarded as selfless.🔽Perception should be regarded as not a shelter.

original: saṃjñā vyābādhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: saṃjñā vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Perception should be regarded as a calamity.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of enlightenment that is connected with the knowledge of all modes.

original: saṃskārā anityato manasikartavyāḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ anityataḥ manasi kartavyāḥ
translated: Formations should be regarded as impermanent.

original: saṃskārā duḥkhato manasikartavyāḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyāḥ
translated: Formations should be regarded as painful.

original: saṃskārā anātmato manasikartavyāḥ /🔽saṃskārāḥ śāntato manasikartavyāḥ /🔽saṃskārā viviktato manasikartavyāḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ anātmataḥ manasi kartavyāḥ  saṃskārāḥ śāntataḥ manasi kartavyāḥ  saṃskārāḥ viviktataḥ manasi kartavyāḥ
translated: Formations should be regarded as not-self.🔽Formations should be regarded as calm.🔽Formations should be regarded as secluded.

original: saṃskārā rogato manasikartavyāḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ rogataḥ manasi kartavyāḥ
translated: Formations should be regarded as a disease.

original: saṃskārā gaṇḍato manasikartavyāḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyāḥ
translated: Formations should be given attention as a boil.

original: saṃskārāḥ śalyato manasikartavyāḥ /🔽saṃskārā aghato manasikartavyāḥ /🔽saṃskārā ābādhato manasikartavyāḥ /

original: saṃskārā anāśvāsikato manasikartavyāḥ /

original: saṃskārā vyābādhato manasikartavyāḥ /

original: kāyaḥ śūnyato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽kāyo 'nātmīyato manasikartavyaḥ /

translated: The body should be attended to as empty.🔽The body should be attended to as not self.

original: kāyo 'nāśvāsikato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: kāyaḥ na āśvāsikataḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: The body should be attended to as not a shelter.

original: kāyo vyābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: kāyaḥ vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The body should be attended to as a disease.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of enlightenment that is connected with the knowledge of all modes.

original: mano 'nityato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ nityatas manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be attended to as impermanent.

original: mano duḥkhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be attended to as ill.

original: mano 'nātmato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manaḥ śāntato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ na ātmataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ śāntataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be attended to as non-self.🔽The mind should be attended to as calm.

original: mano viviktato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽mano rogato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽mano gaṇḍato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ viviktataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ rogataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be attended to as isolated.🔽The mind should be attended to as a disease.🔽The mind should be attended to as a boil.

original: manaḥ śalyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽mano 'ghato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ śalyataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be attended to as a dart.🔽The mind should be attended to as a calamity.

original: mana ābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manaḥ parato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ ābādhataḥ manasikartavyam  manaḥ paratas manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be attended to as an affliction.🔽The mind should be attended to as alien.

original: manaḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manaś calato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ calataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be attended to as subject to change.🔽The mind should be attended to as fickle.

original: manaḥ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ prabhaṅgulataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be attended to as unstable.

original: mano bhayato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ bhayataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be paid attention to as fearful.

original: mana upasargato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ upasargataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The mind should be paid attention to as a misfortune.

original: manaḥ śūnyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽mano 'nātmīyato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ śūnyatas manasi kartavyam  manaḥ na ātmīyataḥ manasikartavyam
translated: The mind should be paid attention to as empty.🔽The mind should be paid attention to as not self.

original: mano 'nāśvāsikato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ manasikartavyam
translated: The mind should be paid attention to as not a shelter.

original: mano vyābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena

translated: Form should be paid attention to as empty.🔽Form should be paid attention to as not self.

original: kāyavijñānaṃ śūnyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽kāyavijñānam anātmīyato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam śūnyatas manasi kartavyam  kāya vijñānam manasi kartavyam
translated: One should pay attention to the consciousness of the body as empty.🔽One should pay attention to the consciousness of the body as not self.

original: kāyavijñānam anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam manasikartavyam
translated: One should pay attention to the consciousness of the body as not a basis for trust.

original: kāyavijñānaṃ vyābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: One should pay attention to the consciousness of the body as a disaster.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that by way of the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With the thought of enlightenment connected with the knowledge of all modes.

original: manovijñānam anityato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam anityataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as impermanent.

original: manovijñānaṃ duḥkhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as suffering.

original: manovijñānam anātmato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manovijñānaṃ śāntato manasikartavyaṃ / ŚsP II
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam anātmataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ vijñānam śāntataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as non-self.🔽The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as calm.

original: manovijñānaṃ viviktato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manovijñānaṃ rogato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manovijñānaṃ gaṇḍato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam viviktataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ vijñānam rogataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ vijñānam gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as secluded.🔽The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as a disease.🔽The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as a boil.

original: manovijñānaṃ śalyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manovijñānam aghato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manovijñānam ābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam śalyataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ vijñānam aghataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ vijñānam ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as a thorn.🔽The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as a calamity.🔽The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as an affliction.

original: manovijñānaṃ parato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam paratas manasi kartavyam
translated: The consciousness of the mind should be paid attention to as alien.

original: manovijñānaṃ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Mind-consciousness should be paid attention to as subject to destruction.

original: manovijñānaṃ calato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manovijñānaṃ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manovijñānaṃ bhayato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam calataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ vijñānam prabhaṅgulataḥ manasi kartavyam  manaḥ vijñānam bhayataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Mind-consciousness should be paid attention to as unsteady.🔽Mind-consciousness should be paid attention to as breaking up.🔽Mind-consciousness should be paid attention to as fearful.

original: manovijñānam upasargato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam upasargataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Mind-consciousness should be paid attention to as a disaster.

original: manovijñānaṃ śūnyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽manovijñānam anātmīyato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam śūnyatas manasi kartavyam  manaḥ vijñānam an ātmīyataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Mind-consciousness should be paid attention to as empty.🔽Mind-consciousness should be paid attention to as not self.

original: manovijñānam anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam manasikartavyam
translated: Mind-consciousness should be paid attention to as not satisfying.

original: manovijñānaṃ vyābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Mind-consciousness should be paid attention to as a disease.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done by way of non-apprehension.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With the thought of enlightenment connected with the knowledge of all modes.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśo 'nityato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ nityatas manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Eye-contact should be paid attention to as impermanent.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśo duḥkhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Eye-contact should be paid attention to as painful.

translated: Eye-contact should be paid attention to as selfless.🔽Eye-contact should be paid attention to as calm.🔽Eye-contact should be paid attention to as secluded.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ rogataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Eye-contact should be paid attention to as a disease.

translated: Eye-contact should be given attention as a boil.🔽Eye-contact should be given attention as a thorn.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśa ābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaḥ parato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaś calato manasikartavyaḥ /

translated: Eye-contact should be given attention as an affliction.🔽Eye-contact should be given attention as subject to change.🔽Eye-contact should be given attention as having no core.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ bhayataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Eye-contact should be given attention as a disease.🔽Eye-contact should be given attention as a disaster.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśa upasargato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ upasargataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Eye-contact should be given attention as a plague.

translated: Ear-contact should be given attention as an affliction.🔽Ear-contact should be given attention as other than what is delightful.🔽Ear-contact should be given attention as subject to change.

translated: Ear-contact should be given attention as having no core.🔽Ear-contact should be given attention as a plague.🔽Ear-contact should be given attention as a disaster.

translated: Ear-contact should be given attention as a calamity.🔽Ear-contact should be given attention as a terror.

original: śrotrasaṃsparśa ābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśaḥ parato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśaḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaḥ /

analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā na ātmīyataḥ manasi kartavyā  manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā anāśvāsikataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: The feeling that arises from the condition of mental contact should be regarded as not self.🔽The feeling that arises from the condition of mental contact should be regarded as not a shelter.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā vyābādhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: The feeling that arises from the condition of mental contact should be regarded as not a refuge.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: with a thought of awakening that is connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: pṛthivīdhātur anityato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ anityataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be paid attention to as impermanent.

original: pṛthivīdhātur duḥkhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be paid attention to as suffering.

original: pṛthivīdhātur anātmato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātuḥ śāntato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātur ŚsP II
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ anātmataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ śsp ii
translated: The earth element should be paid attention to as non-self.🔽The earth element should be paid attention to as peaceful.🔽The earth element should be paid attention to as empty.

original: viviktato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātū rogato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātur gaṇḍato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: viviktataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ rogataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be paid attention to as isolated.🔽The earth element should be paid attention to as a disease.🔽The earth element should be paid attention to as a boil.🔽The earth element should be paid attention to as a thorn.

original: pṛthivīdhātuḥ śalyato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātur aghato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ śalyataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ aghataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be paid attention to as a dart.🔽The earth element should be paid attention to as a calamity.

original: pṛthivīdhātur ābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātuḥ parato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātuḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātuś calato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ paratas manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ calataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be paid attention to as a misfortune.🔽The earth element should be paid attention to as a corruption.🔽The earth element should be paid attention to as a change.

original: pṛthivīdhātuḥ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātur bhayato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ bhayataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be paid attention to as a disaster.🔽The earth element should be paid attention to as a terror.

original: pṛthivīdhātur upasargato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ upasargataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be paid attention to as a menace.

original: pṛthivīdhātuḥ śūnyato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽pṛthivīdhātur anātmīyato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ śūnyatas manasi kartavyaḥ  pṛthivī dhātuḥ an ātmīyataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be given attention as void.🔽The earth element should be given attention as not self.

original: pṛthivīdhātur anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be given attention as affording no basis for sensual pleasure.

original: pṛthivīdhātur vyābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātuḥ vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The earth element should be given attention as a danger.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done by way of not apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With the production of the thought: “I will fully know all forms of knowledge.”

original: abdhātur anityato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātur duḥkhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ap dhātuḥ anityataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The water element should be given attention as impermanent.🔽The water element should be given attention as painful.

original: abdhātur anātmato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātuḥ śāntato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātur viviktato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātū rogato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ap dhātuḥ an ātmataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ śāntataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ viviktataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ rogataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The water element should be given attention as a disease.🔽The water element should be given attention as a tumor.

original: abdhātur gaṇḍato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātuḥ śalyato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātur aghato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ap dhātuḥ gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ śalyataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ aghatas manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The water element should be given attention as a barb.🔽The water element should be given attention as a calamity.

original: abdhātur ābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātuḥ parato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātuḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ap dhātuḥ ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ paratas manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The water element should be given attention as an affliction.🔽The water element should be given attention as alien.🔽The water element should be given attention as disintegrating.

original: abdhātuś calato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ap dhātuḥ calataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The water element should be given attention as a plague.

original: abdhātuḥ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātur bhayato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ap dhātuḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ bhayataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The water element should be paid attention to as destructible.🔽The water element should be paid attention to as fearful.

original: abdhātur upasargato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātuḥ śūnyato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ap dhātuḥ upasargataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ śūnyatas manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The water element should be paid attention to as an affliction.🔽The water element should be paid attention to as empty.

original: abdhātur anātmīyato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽abdhātur anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ap dhātuḥ an ātmīyataḥ manasikartavyaḥ  ap dhātuḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: The water element should be paid attention to as not self.🔽The water element should be paid attention to as not a shelter.

original: abdhātur vyābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: ap dhātuḥ vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The water element should be paid attention to as a plague.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of enlightenment that is connected with the knowledge of all modes.

original: tejodhātur anityato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ anityataḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be paid attention to as impermanent.

original: tejodhātur duḥkhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be paid attention to as painful.

original: tejodhātur anātmato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽tejodhātuḥ śāntato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ anātmataḥ manasikartavyaḥ  tejaḥ dhātuḥ śāntataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be paid attention to as a selflessness.🔽The fire element should be paid attention to as calm.

original: tejodhātur viviktato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽tejodhātū rogato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽tejodhātur gaṇḍato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ viviktataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  tejaḥ dhātuḥ rogataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  tejaḥ dhātuḥ gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be paid attention to as secluded.🔽The fire element should be paid attention to as a disease.🔽The fire element should be paid attention to as a boil.

original: tejodhātuḥ śalyato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽tejodhātur aghato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ śalyataḥ manasikartavyaḥ  tejaḥ dhātuḥ aghataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be paid attention to as a dart.🔽The fire element should be paid attention to as misery.

original: tejodhātur ābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be paid attention to as an affliction.

original: tejodhātuḥ parato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽tejodhātuḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ paratas manasi kartavyaḥ  tejaḥ dhātuḥ pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be given attention as impermanent.🔽The fire element should be given attention as bound to be crushed.

original: tejodhātuś calato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽tejodhātuḥ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽tejodhātur bhayato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ calataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  tejaḥ dhātuḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  tejaḥ dhātuḥ bhayataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be given attention as bound to vanish.🔽The fire element should be given attention as bound to flare up.🔽The fire element should be given attention as bound to flare up again and again.

original: tejodhātur upasargato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽tejodhātuḥ śūnyato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ upasargataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  tejaḥ dhātuḥ śūnyatas manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be given attention as bound to be dispersed.🔽The fire element should be given attention as bound to be extinguished.

original: tejodhātur anātmīyato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽tejodhātur anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ manasikartavyaḥ  tejaḥ dhātuḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be given attention as bound to be destroyed.🔽The fire element should be given attention as bound to be dispersed.

original: tejodhātur vyābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuḥ vyābādhataḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: The fire element should be given attention as bound to be extinguished.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without taking anything as a basis.

analyzed: śsp ii

translated: The element of consciousness should be given attention as a dart.🔽The element of consciousness should be given attention as a calamity.

original: vijñānadhātur ābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽vijñānadhātuḥ parato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽vijñānadhātuḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna dhātuḥ ābādhataḥ manasikartavyaḥ  vijñāna dhātuḥ paratas manasi kartavyaḥ  vijñāna dhātuḥ pralopa dharmataḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: The element of consciousness should be given attention as an affliction.🔽The element of consciousness should be given attention as alien.🔽The element of consciousness should be given attention as subject to change.

original: vijñānadhātuś calato manasikartavyaḥ / ŚsP II 🔽vijñānadhātuḥ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna dhātuḥ calataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  vijñāna dhātuḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: The element of consciousness should be given attention as having no core.🔽The element of consciousness should be given attention as a plague.

original: vijñānadhātur bhayato manasikartavyaḥ /

original: vijñānadhātur upasargato manasikartavyaḥ /

translated: The consciousness element should be attended to as adventitious.

analyzed: vijñāna dhātuḥ śūnyatas manasi kartavyaḥ  vijñāna dhātuḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: The consciousness element should be attended to as empty.🔽The consciousness element should be attended to as not self.

original: vijñānadhātur anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna dhātuḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: The consciousness element should be attended to as not a shelter.

original: vijñānadhātur vyābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /

analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena  ṣaṣ āyatanam anityataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: With the production of the thought connected with the knowledge of all modes.🔽The six sense bases should be paid attention to as impermanent.

original: sadāyatanam duhkhato manasikartavyam /
analyzed: sat āyatanam duhkhataḥ manasi kartavyam

translated: The six sense fields should be given attention as not-self.🔽The six sense fields should be given attention as peaceful.

analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatanam viviktataḥ manasi kartavyam  ṣaṣ āyatanam rogataḥ manasi kartavyam

analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatanam ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam  ṣaṣ āyatanam paratas manasi kartavyam
translated: The six sense fields should be given attention as an affliction.🔽The six sense fields should be given attention as alien.

analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatanam pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyam  ṣaṣ āyatanam calataḥ manasi kartavyam  ṣaṣ āyatanam manasi kartavyam

original: ṣaḍāyatanaṃ bhayato manasikartavyaṃ /

translated: The six sense fields should be given attention as a calamity.🔽The six sense fields should be given attention as an affliction.

analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatanam upasargataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: The six sense fields should be given attention as an onslaught.

original: ṣaḍāyatanaṃ śūnyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽ṣaḍāyatanam anātmīyato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatanam śūnyatas manasi kartavyam  ṣaṣ āyatanam manasikartavyam
translated: The six sense fields should be given attention as empty.🔽The six sense fields should be given attention as not self.

original: ṣaḍāyatanam anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatanam anāśvāsikataḥ manasikartavyam

analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena

translated: Contact should be given attention as a self.🔽Contact should be given attention as peaceful.

analyzed: saṃsparśaḥ śalyataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  saṃsparśaḥ gha taḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Contact should be given attention as a thorn.🔽Contact should be given attention as a plague.

original: saṃsparśa ābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽saṃsparśaḥ parato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽saṃsparśaḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsparśaḥ ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  saṃsparśaḥ paratas manasi kartavyaḥ  saṃsparśaḥ pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Contact should be given attention as an arrow.🔽Contact should be given attention as alien.🔽Contact should be given attention as subject to change.

original: saṃsparśaś calato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽saṃsparśaḥ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽saṃsparśo bhayato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsparśaḥ calataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  saṃsparśaḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  saṃsparśaḥ bhayataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Contact should be given attention as fickle.🔽Contact should be given attention as breaking up.🔽Contact should be given attention as fear.

original: saṃsparśa upasargato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsparśaḥ upasargataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Contact should be given attention as a calamity.

original: saṃsparśaḥ śūnyato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsparśaḥ śūnyatas manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Contact should be given attention as void.

original: saṃsparśo 'nātmīyato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsparśaḥ na ātmīyataḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: Contact should be given attention as not-self.

original: saṃsparśo 'nāśvāsikato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsparśaḥ na āśvāsikataḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: Contact should be given attention as not a shelter.

original: saṃsparśo vyābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsparśaḥ vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Contact should be given attention as a disease,

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena

analyzed: vedanā duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyā

translated: feeling should be given attention as not-self,🔽feeling should be given attention as calm,

translated: feeling should be given attention as void,🔽feeling should be given attention as a disease,🔽feeling should be given attention as a tumour,

original: vedanā śalyato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanāghato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā śalyataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanāghataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: feeling should be given attention as a dart,🔽feeling should be given attention as a calamity,

original: vedanābādhato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā parato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā bādhataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā paratas manasi kartavyā
translated: feeling should be given attention as an affliction,🔽feeling should be given attention as alien,

original: vedanā pralopadharmato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā calato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanā prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā calataḥ manasi kartavyā  vedanā manasi kartavyā
translated: feeling should be given attention as subject to destruction,🔽feeling should be given attention as subject to change,🔽feeling should be given attention as subject to grief,🔽feeling should be given attention as subject to stain,🔽feeling should be given attention as subject to cankers,

original: vedanā bhayato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanopasargato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā bhayataḥ manasi kartavyā 🔽vedanā upasargataḥ manasi kartavyā

original: vedanā śūnyato manasikartavyā /🔽vedanānātmīyato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā śūnyatas manasi kartavyā  vedanā an ātmīyataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as empty.🔽Feeling should be given attention as not self.

original: vedanānāśvāsikato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā anāśvāsikataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as not a shelter.

original: vedanā vyābādhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: vedanā vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Feeling should be given attention as a disease,

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: tṛṣṇānityato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā nityataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as impermanent.

original: tṛṣṇā duḥkhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as suffering.

original: tṛṣṇānātmato manasikartavyā /🔽tṛṣṇā śāntato manasikartavyā /🔽tṛṣṇā viviktato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā anātmataḥ manasi kartavyā  tṛṣṇā śāntataḥ manasi kartavyā  tṛṣṇā viviktataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as not self.🔽Craving should be given attention as calm.🔽Craving should be given attention as refined.

original: tṛṣṇā rogato manasikartavyā /🔽tṛsṇā gaṇḍato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā rogataḥ manasi kartavyā  tṛsṇā gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as a disease.🔽Craving should be given attention as a boil.🔽Craving should be given attention as a thorn.

original: tṛṣṇā śalyato manasikartavyā /🔽tṛṣṇāghato manasikartavyā /🔽tṛṣṇābādhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā śalyataḥ manasi kartavyā  tṛṣṇā ghataḥ manasi kartavyā  tṛṣṇā bādhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as a slayer.🔽Craving should be given attention as a plague.🔽Craving should be given attention as a disaster.

original: tṛṣṇā parato manasikartavyā /🔽tṛṣṇā pralopadharmato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā paratas manasi kartavyā  tṛṣṇā pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as subject to change.🔽Craving should be given attention as subject to destruction.

original: tṛṣṇā calato manasikartavyā /🔽tṛṣṇā prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyā /🔽tṛṣṇā bhayato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā calataḥ manasi kartavyā  tṛṣṇā manasi kartavyā  tṛṣṇā bhayataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as subject to vanishing.🔽Craving should be given attention as subject to arising.🔽Craving should be given attention as subject to cessation.

original: tṛṣṇopasargato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā upasargataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as subject to vanishing.

original: tṛṣṇā śūnyato manasikartavyā /🔽tṛṣṇānātmīyato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā śūnyatas manasi kartavyā  tṛṣṇā an ātmīyataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as void.🔽Craving should be given attention as not self.

original: tṛṣṇānāśvāsikato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā anāśvāsikataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as not a shelter.

original: tṛṣṇā vyābādhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Craving should be given attention as a danger.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without taking anything as a basis.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With the production of the thought associated with the knowledge of all modes.

original: upādānam anityato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽upādānaṃ duḥkhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam anityataḥ manasi kartavyam  upādānam duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Clinging should be given attention as impermanent.🔽Clinging should be given attention as painful.🔽Clinging should be given attention as a disease,🔽Clinging should be given attention as a boil,🔽Clinging should be given attention as a dart,🔽Clinging should be given attention as misery,

original: upādānam anātmato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽upādānaṃ śāntato manasikartavyaṃ / upādānaṃ ŚsP II 🔽viviktato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽upādānaṃ rogato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽upādānaṃ gaṇḍato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam anātmataḥ manasi kartavyam  upādānam śāntataḥ manasi kartavyam upādānam  viviktataḥ manasi kartavyam  upādānam rogataḥ manasi kartavyam  upādānam gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Clinging should be given attention as an affliction,🔽Clinging should be given attention as an outrage,🔽Clinging should be given attention as a plague,

original: upādānaṃ śalyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽upādānam aghato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam śalyataḥ manasi kartavyam  upādānam aghataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Clinging should be given attention as a calamity,🔽Clinging should be given attention as a terror,

original: upādānam ābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽upādānaṃ parato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam  upādānam paratas manasi kartavyam
translated: Clinging should be given attention as a menace,🔽Clinging should be given attention as alien,

original: upādānaṃ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽upādānaṃ calato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyam  upādānam calataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Clinging should be given attention as changing,🔽Clinging should be given attention as a plague,

original: upādānaṃ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam manasi kartavyam
translated: Clinging should be given attention as a disaster,

original: upādānaṃ bhayato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam bhayataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Grasping should be given attention as fearful.

original: upādānam upasargato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam upasargataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Grasping should be given attention as a disaster.

original: upādānaṃ śūnyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽upādānam anātmīyato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam śūnyatas manasi kartavyam  upādānam anātmīyataḥ manasikartavyam
translated: Grasping should be given attention as empty.🔽Grasping should be given attention as not self.

original: upādānam anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam manasikartavyam
translated: Grasping should be given attention as not affording protection.

original: upādānaṃ vyābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: upādānam vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Grasping should be given attention as a disease.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of awakening that is connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bhavo 'nityato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ nityatas manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Becoming should be given attention as impermanent.

original: bhavo duḥkhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Becoming should be given attention as suffering.

original: bhava anātmato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhavaḥ śāntato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhava anātmataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  bhavaḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Becoming should be given attention as non-self.🔽Becoming should be given attention as peaceful.

original: bhavo viviktato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhavo rogato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhavo gaṇḍato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ viviktataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  bhavaḥ rogataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  bhavaḥ gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Becoming should be given attention as secluded.🔽Becoming should be given attention as a disease.🔽Becoming should be given attention as a boil.

original: bhavaḥ śalyato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhavo 'ghato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhava ābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ śalyataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  bhavaḥ gha taḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  bhavaḥ ābādhataḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: Becoming should be given attention as a thorn.🔽Becoming should be given attention as a plague.🔽Becoming should be given attention as a disaster.

original: bhavaḥ parato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhavaḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ paratas manasi kartavyaḥ 🔽bhavaḥ pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Becoming should be given attention as subject to change.

original: bhavaś calato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhavaḥ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ calataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  bhavaḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Existence should be seen as unsteady.🔽Existence should be seen as breaking up.

original: bhavo bhayato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhava upasargato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ bhayataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ  bhavaḥ upasargataḥ manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Existence should be seen as fearful.🔽Existence should be seen as a disaster.

original: bhavaḥ śūnyato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ śūnyatas manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: Existence should be seen as empty.

original: bhavo 'nātmīyato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhavo 'nāśvāsikato manasikartavyaḥ /🔽bhavo vyābādhato manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ na ātmīyataḥ manasikartavyaḥ  bhavaḥ na āśvāsikataḥ manasikartavyaḥ  bhavaḥ vyābādhataḥ manasikartavyaḥ
translated: Existence should be seen as not self.🔽Existence should be seen as not affording protection.🔽Existence should be seen as a disease.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of enlightenment that is connected with the knowledge of all modes.

original: jātir anityato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ anityataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be seen as impermanent.

original: jātir duḥkhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be seen as painful.

original: jātir anātmato manasikartavyā /🔽jātiḥ śāntato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ anātmataḥ manasi kartavyā  jātiḥ śāntataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be seen as selfless.🔽Birth should be seen as calm.

original: jātir viviktato manasikartavyā /🔽jātī rogato manasikartavyā /🔽jātir gaṇḍato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ viviktataḥ manasi kartavyā  jātī rogataḥ manasi kartavyā  jātiḥ gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be seen as isolated.🔽Birth should be seen as a disease.🔽Birth should be seen as a boil.

original: jātiḥ śalyato manasikartavyā /🔽jātir aghato manasikartavyā /🔽jātir ābādhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ śalyataḥ manasi kartavyā  jātiḥ aghataḥ manasi kartavyā  jātiḥ ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be seen as a dart.🔽Birth should be seen as misery.🔽Birth should be seen as oppressing.

original: jātiḥ parato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ paratas manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be seen as an affliction.

original: jātiḥ pralopadharmato manasikartavyā /🔽jātiś calato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyā  jātiḥ calataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be paid attention to as having the nature of disappearing.🔽Birth should be paid attention to as unsteady.

original: jātiḥ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyā /🔽jātir bhayato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ manasi kartavyā  jātiḥ bhayataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be paid attention to as breaking up.🔽Birth should be paid attention to as fearful.

original: jātir upasargato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ upasargataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be paid attention to as a disaster.

original: jātiḥ śūnyato manasikartavyā /🔽jātir anātmīyato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ śūnyatas manasi kartavyā  jātiḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be paid attention to as empty.🔽Birth should be paid attention to as not self.

original: jātir anāśvāsikato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ anāśvāsikataḥ manasikartavyā
translated: Birth should be paid attention to as not a refuge.

original: jātir vyābādhato manasikartavyā /
analyzed: jātiḥ vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyā
translated: Birth should be paid attention to as a disease.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of enlightenment that is connected with the knowledge of all modes.

original: jarāmaraṇam anityato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam anityataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be paid attention to as impermanent.

original: jarāmaraṇaṃ duḥkhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam duḥkhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be paid attention to as painful.

original: jarāmaraṇam anātmato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽jarāmaraṇaṃ śāntato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam anātmataḥ manasi kartavyam  jarā maraṇam śāntataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be paid attention to as a selflessness.🔽Old age and death should be paid attention to as calm.

original: jarāmaraṇaṃ viviktato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽jarāmaraṇaṃ rogato manasikartavyaṃ / ŚsP II 🔽jarāmaraṇaṃ gaṇḍato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam viviktataḥ manasi kartavyam  jarā maraṇam rogataḥ manasi kartavyam  jarā maraṇam gaṇḍataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be paid attention to as a seclusion.🔽Old age and death should be paid attention to as a disease.🔽Old age and death should be paid attention to as a boil.

original: jarāmaraṇaṃ śalyato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam śalyataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be paid attention to as a dart.

original: jarāmaraṇam aghato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽jarāmaraṇam ābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam aghataḥ manasi kartavyam  jarā maraṇam ābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be given attention as a thorn.🔽Old age and death should be given attention as a disease.

original: jarāmaraṇaṃ parato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽jarāmaraṇaṃ pralopadharmato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam paratas manasi kartavyam  jarā maraṇam pralopa dharmataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be given attention as an affliction.🔽Old age and death should be given attention as a disaster.

original: jarāmaraṇaṃ calato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽jarāmaraṇaṃ prabhaṅgulato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽jarāmaraṇaṃ bhayato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam calataḥ manasi kartavyam  jarā maraṇam manasi kartavyam  jarā maraṇam bhayataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be given attention as a dart.🔽Old age and death should be given attention as a calamity.🔽Old age and death should be given attention as a plague.

original: jarāmaraṇam upasargato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam upasargataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be given attention as a disaster.

original: jarāmaraṇaṃ śūnyato manasikartavyaṃ /🔽jarāmaraṇam anātmīyato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam śūnyatas manasi kartavyam  jarā maraṇam anātmīyataḥ manasikartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be given attention as empty.🔽Old age and death should be given attention as not self.

original: jarāmaraṇam anāśvāsikato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam manasikartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be given attention as not a shelter.

original: jarāmaraṇaṃ vyābādhato manasikartavyaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇam vyābādhataḥ manasi kartavyam
translated: Old age and death should be given attention as a burden.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: And that should be done without apprehending anything.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādair dānapāramitāyāṃ caraty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ dāna pāramitāyām carati an upalambha yogena
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, practices the perfection of giving by way of the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiḥ śīlapāramitāyāṃ caraty anupalambhayogena /🔽sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiḥ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ caraty anupalambhayogena /🔽sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādair vīryapāramitāyāṃ caraty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ śīla pāramitāyām carati an upalambha yogena  sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ kṣānti pāramitāyām carati an upalambha yogena  sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ vīrya pāramitāyām carati an upalambha yogena
translated: He practices the perfection of morality with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, by way of non-apprehension.🔽He practices the perfection of patience with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, by way of non-apprehension.🔽He practices the perfection of perseverance with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, by way of non-apprehension.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādair dhyānapāramitāyāṃ caraty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ dhyāna pāramitāyām carati an upalambha yogena
translated: He practices the perfection of concentration with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, by way of non-apprehension.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caraty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carati an upalambha yogena
translated: He practices the perfection of wisdom with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, by way of non-apprehension.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiś catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ catvāri smṛti upasthānāni bhāvayati anupalambha yogena
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, cultivates the four establishments of mindfulness by way of non-apprehension.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiś catvāri samyakprahāṇāni bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ catvāri samyakprahāṇāni bhāvayati an upalambha yogena
translated: With thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, he cultivates the four right efforts by way of non-apprehension.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiś catvāra ṛddhipādaṃ bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /🔽sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiḥ pañcendriyāṇi bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ catvāraḥ ṛddhipādam bhāvayati an upalambha yogena  sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ pañca indriyāṇi bhāvayati anupalambha yogena
translated: with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes he cultivates the four bases of psychic power, by way of nonapprehending.🔽with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes he cultivates the five faculties, by way of nonapprehending.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiḥ pañca balāni bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ pañca balāni bhāvayati anupalambha yogena
translated: with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes he cultivates the five powers, by way of nonapprehending.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiḥ sapta bodhyaṅgāni bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ sapta bodhyaṅgāni bhāvayati an upalambha yogena
translated: with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes he cultivates the seven limbs of enlightenment, by way of nonapprehending.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādair aṣṭāṅgamārgāni bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /🔽sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiś catvāry āryasatyāni bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ aṣṭāṅga mārgāni bhāvayati anupalambha yogena  sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ catvāri ārya satyāni bhāvayati an upalambha yogena
translated: with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes he cultivates the eightfold path, by way of nonapprehending.🔽with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes he cultivates the four noble truths, by way of nonapprehending.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiś catvāri dhyānāni bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ catvāri dhyānāni bhāvayati an upalambha yogena
translated: with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes he cultivates the four meditations, by way of nonapprehending.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiś catvāry apramāṇāni bhāvayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ catvāri apramāṇāni bhāvayati anupalambha yogena
translated: With thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes he cultivates the four Unlimited, by way of nonapprehending.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś ŚsP II
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ
translated: With thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes
