analyzed: śrotra vijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in ear-consciousness, in the sense of apprehending something.

original: ghrāṇavijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇa vijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that there is eye-consciousness, in an apprehending manner.🔽One should not stand in the notion that there is ear-consciousness, in an apprehending manner.

original: jihvāvijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that there is nose-consciousness, in an apprehending manner.🔽One should not stand in the notion that there is tongue-consciousness, in an apprehending manner.

original: kāyavijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that there is body-consciousness, in an apprehending manner.

original: manovijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that there is mind-consciousness, in an apprehending manner.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśa iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśa iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśa iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśe iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śrotra saṃsparśe iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  ghrāṇa saṃsparśe iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that there is eye contact, in an apprehending manner.🔽One should not stand in the notion that there is ear contact, in an apprehending manner.🔽One should not stand in the notion that there is nose contact, in an apprehending manner.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśa iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśe iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that there is tongue contact, in an apprehending manner.

original: kāyasaṃsparśa iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśe iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that there is body contact, in an apprehending manner.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśa iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedaneti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedaneti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśe iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that there is mind contact, in an apprehending manner.🔽One should not stand in the notion that there is a feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, in an apprehending manner.🔽One should not stand in the notion that there is a feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact, in an apprehending manner.

original: ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedaneti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that there is a feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact, in an apprehending manner.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedaneti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue-contact’ exists, in an apprehending manner.

original: kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedaneti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘the feeling that arises from the condition of body-contact’ exists, in an apprehending manner.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedaneti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘the feeling that arises from the condition of mind-contact’ exists, in an apprehending manner.

original: pṛthivīdhātāv iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽abdhātāv iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽tejodhātāv iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātau iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  ap dhātau iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  tejaḥ dhātau iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘the earth element’ exists, in an apprehending manner.🔽One should not stand in the idea that ‘the water element’ exists, in an apprehending manner.🔽One should not stand in the idea that ‘the fire element’ exists, in an apprehending manner.

original: vāyudhātāv iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vāyu dhātau iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘the wind element’ exists, in an apprehending manner.

original: ākāśadhātāv iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽vijñānadhātāv iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ākāśa dhātau iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  vijñāna dhātau iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘the space element’ exists, in an apprehending manner.🔽One should not stand in the idea that ‘the consciousness element’ exists, in an apprehending manner.

original: avidyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: avidyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘ignorance’ exists, in an apprehending manner.

original: saṃskārā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘volitional actions’ exist, in an apprehending manner.

original: vijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘consciousness’ exists, in an apprehending manner.

original: nāmarūpam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: nāma rūpam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘name-and-form’ exists, in an apprehending manner.

original: ṣaḍāyatanam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatanam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that ‘the six sense spheres’ exist, in an apprehending manner.

original: sparśa iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśe iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in contact as a basis for apprehending.

original: vedaneti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedanā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in feeling as a basis for apprehending.

original: tṛṣṇeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽upādānam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  upādānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in craving as a basis for apprehending.🔽One should not stand in grasping as a basis for apprehending.

original: bhava iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽jātir iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: bhave iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  jātiḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in existence as a basis for apprehending.🔽One should not stand in birth as a basis for apprehending.

original: jarāmaraṇam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽ŚsP II
analyzed: jarā maraṇam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śsp ii
translated: One should not stand in old age and death as a basis for apprehending.

original: dānapāramiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śīlapāramiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śīla pāramitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the perfection of giving as a basis for apprehending.🔽One should not stand in the perfection of morality as a basis for apprehending.

original: kṣāntipāramiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽vīryapāramiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  vīrya pāramitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the perfection of patience as a basis for apprehending.🔽One should not stand in the perfection of perseverance as a basis for apprehending.

original: dhyānapāramiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the perfection of concentration as a basis for apprehending.

original: prajñāpāramiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽adhyātmaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  adhyātma śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the perfection of wisdom as a basis for apprehending.🔽One should not stand in inner emptiness as a basis for apprehending.

original: bahirdhāśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in outer emptiness as a basis for apprehending.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “One should not stand in the notion that ‘inner and outer emptiness is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’

original: śūnyatāśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śūnyatā a śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of emptiness is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’

original: mahāśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽paramārthaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  paramārtha śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘great emptiness is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of ultimate reality is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽asaṃskṛtaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽atyantaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  asaṃskṛta śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  atyanta śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of conditioned phenomena is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of the unlimited is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’

original: anavarāgraśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽anavakāraśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  anavakāra śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of non-dispersal is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’

original: prakṛtiśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of inherent existence is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’

original: sarvadharmaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of all phenomena is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of individual characteristics is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’

original: anupalambhaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the emptiness of non-apprehension is calm,’ and one should not stand in the notion that ‘it is not calm.’

original: abhāvaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽svabhāvaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  svabhāva śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “Emptiness of non-existence” is not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.🔽“Emptiness of own-nature” is not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “Emptiness of own-nature and of what belongs to it” is not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: smṛtyupasthānānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽samyakprahāṇānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: smṛti upasthānāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  samyak prahāṇāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The applications of mindfulness are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.🔽The right efforts are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: ṛddhipādā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽indriyāṇīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ṛddhipādāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  indriyāṇi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The bases of spiritual success are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.🔽The faculties are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: balānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: balāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The powers are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: bodhyaṅgānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: bodhyaṅgāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The limbs of awakening are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārga iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The noble eightfold path is not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: āryasatyānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ārya satyāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The noble truths are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: dhyānānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dhyānāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The meditative absorptions are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: apramāṇānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: apramāṇāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The immeasurables are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: ārūpyasamāpattaya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpattaye iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The formless meditative attainments are not to be stood for in the manner of taking something up.

original: vimokṣā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vimokṣāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eight liberations through a yoga of objectification.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattaya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the nine successive meditative absorptions through a yoga of objectification.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation through a yoga of objectification.

original: abhijñā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽samādhaya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: abhijñāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  samādhayaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the [five] supernatural powers through a yoga of objectification.🔽One should not stand in the meditative absorptions through a yoga of objectification.

original: dhāraṇīmukhānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukhāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the dhāraṇī gateways through a yoga of objectification.

original: tathāgatabalānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽vaiśāradyānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathāgata balāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  vaiśāradyāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the powers of the Tathāgata through a yoga of objectification.🔽One should not stand in the fearlessnesses through a yoga of objectification.

original: pratisaṃvida iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / ŚsP II 🔽mahāmaitrīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratisaṃvide iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  mahā maitrī iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the detailed and thorough knowledges through a yoga of objectification.🔽One should not stand in great love through a yoga of objectification.

original: mahākaruṇeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in great compassion through a yoga of objectification.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the unique qualities of a Buddha through a yoga of objectification.

original: śrāvakayānam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrāvaka yānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the Śrāvakayāna through a yoga of objectification.

original: pratyekabuddhayānam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha yānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas through a yoga of objectification.

original: buddhayānam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽srotaāpattiphalam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sakṛdāgāmiphalam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: buddha yānam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  srotaāpatti phalam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sakṛdāgāmi phalam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the vehicle of the buddhas through a yoga of objectification.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of entering the stream through a yoga of objectification.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth through a yoga of objectification.

original: anāgāmiphalam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽arhattvam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  arhat tvam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth through a yoga of objectification.🔽One should not stand in arhatship through a yoga of objectification.

original: pratyekabuddhatvam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha tvam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in individual enlightenment through a yoga of objectification.

original: sarvajñateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarvajña tā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in omniscience through a yoga of objectification.

original: mārgākārajñateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the knowledge of path aspects through a yoga of objectification.

original: sarvākārajñateti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽rūpaṃ nityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  rūpam nityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the knowledge of all aspects through a yoga of objectification.🔽One should not stand in form as permanent through a yoga of objectification.

original: rūpam anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in form as impermanent through a yoga of objectification.

original: rūpaṃ sukham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam sukham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in form as happiness through a yoga of objectification.

original: rūpaṃ duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in form as suffering through a yoga of objectification.

original: rūpam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽rūpaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  rūpam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in form as the self or not the self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in form as good or not good, by way of apprehending something.

original: rūpaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in form as calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: rūpaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in form as isolated or not isolated, by way of apprehending something.

original: rūpaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in form as empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.

original: rūpaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in form as a sign or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: rūpaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in form as having a goal or not having a goal, by way of apprehending something.

original: vedanā nityety anityeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / vedanā sukheti duḥkheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedanā nityā iti anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena vedanā sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in feeling as permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something. One should not stand in feeling as happy or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: vedanā ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedanā ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in feeling as a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.

original: vedanā śubhety aśubheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedanā śubhā iti aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in feeling as pure or impure, by way of apprehending something.

original: vedanā śāntety aśānteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedanā śāntā iti a śāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that feeling is calm or not calm, in the notion that it is grasped or not grasped.

original: vedanā viviktety avivikteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedanā viviktā iti a viviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that feeling is void or not void, in the notion that it is afflicted or unafflicted.

original: vedanā śūnyety aśūnyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽vedanā nimittety animitteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedanā śūnyā iti a śūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  vedanā nimittā iti animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that feeling is empty or not empty, in the notion that it is with signs or signless.🔽One should not stand in the notion that feeling is with wishes or wishless, in the notion that it is calm or not calm.

original: vedanā praṇihitety apraṇihiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedanā praṇihitā iti apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that feeling is with cultivation or without cultivation, in the notion that it is compounded or uncompounded.

original: saṃjñā nityety anityeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽saṃjñā sukheti duḥkheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃjñā nityā iti anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  saṃjñā sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that perception is permanent or impermanent, in the notion that it is easeful or stressful.

original: saṃjñā ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽saṃjñā śubhety aśubheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽saṃjñā śāntety aśānteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / ŚsP II 🔽saṃjñā viviktety avivikteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃjñā ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  saṃjñā śubhā iti aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  saṃjñā śāntā iti a śāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  saṃjñā viviktā iti a viviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that perception is a self or not a self, in the notion that it is attractive or unattractive.🔽One should not stand in the notion that perception is empty or not empty, in the notion that it is with signs or signless.🔽One should not stand in the notion that perception is with wishes or wishless, in the notion that it is calm or not calm.

original: saṃjñā śūnyety aśūnyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃjñā śūnyā iti a śūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that perception is with cultivation or without cultivation, in the notion that it is compounded or uncompounded.

original: saṃjñā nimittety animitteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃjñā nimittā iti animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that perception is with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: saṃjñā praṇihitety apraṇihiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃjñā praṇihitā iti a praṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that perception is with will or without will, by way of apprehending something.

original: saṃskārā nityā ity anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ nityāḥ iti anityāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that volitional formations are permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: saṃskārāḥ sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ sukhāḥ iti duḥkhāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that volitional formations are happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: saṃskārā ātmāna ity anātmāna iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽saṃskārāḥ śubhā ity aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ ātmānaḥ iti anātmānaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  saṃskārāḥ śubhāḥ iti aśubhāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that volitional formations are a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that volitional formations are beautiful or ugly, by way of apprehending something.

original: saṃskārāḥ śāntā ity aśāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ śāntāḥ iti a śāntāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that volitional formations are peaceful or not peaceful, by way of apprehending something.

original: saṃskārā viviktā ity aviviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ viviktāḥ iti a viviktāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that volitional formations are secluded or not secluded, by way of apprehending something.

original: saṃskārāḥ śūnyā ity aśūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽saṃskārā nimittā ity animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ śūnyāḥ iti a śūnyāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  saṃskārāḥ nimittāḥ iti animittāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that volitional formations are empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that volitional formations are with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: saṃskārāḥ praṇihitā ity apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ praṇihitāḥ iti apraṇihitāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that volitional formations are with will or without will, by way of apprehending something.

original: vijñānaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: vijñānaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: vijñānam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.

original: vijñānaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽vijñānaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  vijñānam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is beautiful or ugly, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.

original: vijñānaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is isolated or not isolated, by way of apprehending something.

original: vijñānaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽vijñānaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  vijñānam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is a sign or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: vijñānaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that consciousness is wished for or not wished for, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣur nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the eye is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣuḥ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the eye is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣur ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽cakṣuḥ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽cakṣuḥ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  cakṣuḥ śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  cakṣuḥ śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye as a self or not a self, by way of taking something as a basis.🔽One should not stand in the eye as attractive or unattractive, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: cakṣur viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye as calm or not calm, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: cakṣuḥ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽cakṣur nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  cakṣuḥ nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye as empty or not empty, by way of taking something as a basis.🔽One should not stand in the eye as with signs or signless, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: cakṣuḥ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ praṇihitam iti a praṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye as having wishes or wishless, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: śrotraṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotram nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the ear as permanent or impermanent, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: śrotraṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotram sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the ear as ease or stress, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: śrotram ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śrotraṃ śubham ity ŚsP II
analyzed: śrotram ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śrotram śubham iti
translated: One should not stand in the ear as a self or not a self, by way of taking something as a basis.🔽One should not stand in the ear as attractive or unattractive, by way of taking something as a basis.🔽One should not stand in the ear as calm or not calm, by way of taking something as a basis.🔽One should not stand in the ear as empty or not empty, by way of taking something as a basis.🔽One should not stand in the ear as with signs or signless, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the ear as having wishes or wishless, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: śrotraṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotram śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the ear as calm or not calm through the yoga of apprehension.

original: śrotraṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotram viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the ear as secluded or not secluded through the yoga of apprehension.

original: śrotraṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śrotraṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotram śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śrotram nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the ear as empty or not empty through the yoga of apprehension.🔽One should not stand in the ear as a sign or signless through the yoga of apprehension.

original: śrotraṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotram praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the ear as appropriated or not appropriated through the yoga of apprehension.

original: ghrāṇaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the nose as permanent or impermanent through the yoga of apprehension.

original: ghrāṇaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the nose as happiness or suffering through the yoga of apprehension.

original: ghrāṇam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the nose as self or not self through the yoga of apprehension.

original: ghrāṇaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽ghrāṇaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  ghrāṇam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the nose as beautiful or ugly through the yoga of apprehension.🔽One should not stand in the nose as calm or not calm through the yoga of apprehension.

original: ghrāṇaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the nose as secluded or not secluded through the yoga of apprehension.

original: ghrāṇaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽ghrāṇaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  ghrāṇam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the nose is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that the nose is a sign or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: ghrāṇaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the nose is appropriated or not appropriated, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvā nityety anityeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā nityā iti anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the tongue is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvā sukheti duḥkheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the tongue is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvā ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽jihvā śubhety aśubheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  jihvā śubhā iti aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the tongue is a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that the tongue is beautiful or ugly, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvā śāntety aśānteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā śāntā iti a śāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the tongue is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvā viviktety avivikteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā viviktā iti a viviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the tongue is isolated or not isolated, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvā śūnyety aśūnyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā śūnyā iti a śūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the tongue is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvā nimittety animitteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā nimittā iti animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the tongue is a sign or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvā praṇihitety apraṇihiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā praṇihitā iti apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the tongue is with dedication or without dedication, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyo nitya ity anitya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāyaḥ nityaḥ iti anityaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the body is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyaḥ sukha iti duḥkha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāyaḥ sukhaḥ iti duḥkhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the body is ease or stress, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāya ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāyaḥ ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the body is self or not self, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyaḥ śubha ity aśubha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽kāyaḥ śānta ity aśānta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāyaḥ śubhaḥ iti aśubhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  kāyaḥ śāntaḥ iti a śāntaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the body is lovely or repulsive, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that the body is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that the body is with or without self, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyo vivikta ity avivikta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāyaḥ viviktaḥ iti a viviktaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the body is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyaḥ śūnya ity aśūnya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽kāyo nimitta ity animitta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāyaḥ śūnyaḥ iti a śūnyaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  kāyaḥ nimittaḥ iti animittaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the body is void or not void, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that the body is afflicted or unafﬂicted, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that the body is with or without signs, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyaḥ praṇihita ity apraṇihita iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāyaḥ praṇihitaḥ iti apraṇihitaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the body is with or without aspirations, by way of apprehending something.

original: mano nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the mind is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: manaḥ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the mind is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: mana ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the mind is a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.

original: manaḥ śubham ity aśubham iti ŚsP II
analyzed: manaḥ śubham iti aśubham iti
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the mind is good or not good,

original: na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽manaḥ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  manaḥ śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that the mind is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: mano viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the mind is separated or not separated, by way of apprehending something.

original: manaḥ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽mano nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  manaḥ nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the mind is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that the mind has signs or is signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: manaḥ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that the mind is with wishes or is wishless, by way of apprehending something.

original: rūpaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that form is lasting or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: rūpaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that form is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: rūpam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that form is a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.

original: rūpaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that form is beautiful or ugly, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: rūpaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that form is calm or not calm, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: rūpaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that form is isolated or not isolated, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: rūpaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that form is empty or not empty, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: rūpaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that form is a sign or signless, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: rūpaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that form is empty or not empty, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: śabdo nitya ity anitya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śabdaḥ nityaḥ iti anityaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that sound is permanent or impermanent, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: śabdaḥ sukha iti duḥkha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śabdaḥ sukhaḥ iti duḥkhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that sound is happiness or suffering, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: śabda ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śabdaḥ śubha ity aśubha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śabdaḥ ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śabdaḥ śubhaḥ iti aśubhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that sound is a self or not a self, in the notion that it is grasped.🔽One should not stand in the notion that sound is beautiful or ugly, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: śabdaḥ śānta ity aśānta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śabdaḥ śāntaḥ iti a śāntaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that sound is calm or not calm, in the notion that it is grasped.

original: śabdo vivikta ity avivikta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śabdaḥ śūnya ity aśūnya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śabdo nimitta ity animitta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śabdaḥ viviktaḥ iti a viviktaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śabdaḥ śūnyaḥ iti a śūnyaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śabdaḥ nimitte iti animitte iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that sound is empty or not empty, in the notion that it is with signs or signless, in the notion that it is having aspirations or without aspirations.

original: śabdaḥ praṇihita ity apraṇihita iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽gandho nitya ity anitya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śabdaḥ praṇihitaḥ iti apraṇihitaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  gandhaḥ nityaḥ iti anityaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that sound is calm or not calm, in the notion that it is void or not void, in the notion that it is afflicted or unafflicted, in the notion that it is purified or not purified.

original: gandhaḥ sukha iti duḥkha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: gandhaḥ sukhaḥ iti duḥkhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that sound is produced or stopped, in the notion that it is good or bad, in the notion that it is appropriated or not appropriated.

original: gandha ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽gandhaḥ śubha ity aśubha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽gandhaḥ śānta ity aśānta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽gandho vivikta ity avivikta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: gandhaḥ ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  gandhaḥ śubhaḥ iti aśubhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  gandhaḥ śāntaḥ iti a śāntaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  gandhaḥ viviktaḥ iti a viviktaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that sound is past, future, or present, in the notion that it is internal or external, or in the notion that it is in between the two.

original: gandhaḥ śūnya ity aśūnya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: gandhaḥ śūnyaḥ iti a śūnyaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that smell is permanent or impermanent, in the notion that it is easeful or stressful, in the notion that it is self or not self, in the notion that it is pleasant or unpleasant, in the notion that it is pure or impure, in the notion that it is empty or not empty, in the notion that it is with signs or signless, in the notion that it is having aspirations or without aspirations, in the notion that it is calm or not calm, in the notion that it is void or not void, in the notion that it is afflicted or unafflicted, in the notion that it is purified or not purified, in the notion that it is produced or stopped, in the notion that it is good or bad, in the notion that it is appropriated or not appropriated, in the notion that it is past, future, or present, in the notion that it is internal or external, or in the notion that it is in between the two.

original: gandho nimitta ity animitta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: gandhaḥ nimitte iti animitte iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that smell is with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: gandhaḥ praṇihita ity apraṇihita iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: gandhaḥ praṇihitaḥ iti apraṇihitaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that smell is with wishes or without wishes, by way of apprehending something.

original: raso nitya ity anitya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rasaḥ nityaḥ iti anityaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that taste is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: rasaḥ sukha iti duḥkha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rasaḥ sukhaḥ iti duḥkhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that taste is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: rasa ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rasaḥ ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that taste is a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.

original: rasaḥ śubha ity aśubha iti na sthātavyam ŚsP II 🔽upalambhayogena /🔽rasaḥ śānta ity aśānta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rasaḥ śubhaḥ iti aśubhaḥ iti na sthātavyam  upalambha yogena  rasaḥ śāntaḥ iti a śāntaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that taste is beautiful or ugly, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that taste is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.

original: raso vivikta ity avivikta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽rasaḥ śūnya ity aśūnya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rasaḥ viviktaḥ iti a viviktaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  rasaḥ śūnyaḥ iti a śūnyaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that taste is with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that taste is with wishes or without wishes, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that taste is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that taste is void or not void, by way of apprehending something.

original: raso nimitta ity animitta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rasaḥ nimitte iti animitte iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that taste is afflicted or unafflicted, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that taste is arising or ceasing, by way of apprehending something.

original: rasaḥ praṇihita ity apraṇihita iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: rasaḥ praṇihitaḥ iti apraṇihitaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that taste is compounded or uncompounded, by way of apprehending something.

original: sparśo nitya ity anitya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśaḥ nityaḥ iti anityaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that contact is permanent or impermanent.

original: sparśaḥ sukha iti duḥkha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśaḥ sukhaḥ iti duḥkhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that contact is happiness or suffering.

original: sparśa ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśaḥ ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that contact has a self or is without a self.

original: sparśaḥ śubha ity aśubha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sparśaḥ śānta ity aśānta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśaḥ śubhaḥ iti aśubhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sparśaḥ śāntaḥ iti a śāntaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that contact is good or bad.🔽One should not stand in the notion that contact is calm or not calm.

original: sparśo vivikta ity avivikta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśaḥ viviktaḥ iti a viviktaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that contact is isolated or not isolated.

original: sparśaḥ śūnya ity aśūnya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sparśo nimitta ity animitta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśaḥ śūnyaḥ iti a śūnyaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sparśaḥ nimitte iti animitte iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that contact is empty or not empty.🔽One should not stand in the notion that contact has signs or is signless.

original: sparśaḥ praṇihita ity apraṇihita iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśaḥ praṇihitaḥ iti apraṇihitaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that contact has wishes or is without wishes.

original: dharmā nityā ity anitya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dharmāḥ nityāḥ iti anitye iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that dharmas are permanent or impermanent.

original: dharmāḥ sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dharmāḥ sukhāḥ iti duḥkhāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that dharmas are happiness or suffering.

original: dharmā ātmāna ity anātmāna iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dharmāḥ ātmānaḥ iti anātmānaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that dharmas are the self or not the self, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: dharmāḥ śubhā ity aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽dharmāḥ śāntā ity aśāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dharmāḥ śubhāḥ iti aśubhāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  dharmāḥ śāntāḥ iti a śāntāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that dharmas are good or not good, by way of taking something as a basis.🔽One should not stand in the idea that dharmas are calm or not calm, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: dharmā viviktā ity aviviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dharmāḥ viviktāḥ iti a viviktāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that dharmas are secluded or not secluded, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: dharmāḥ śūnyā ity aśūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽dharmā nimittā ity animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dharmāḥ śūnyāḥ iti a śūnyāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  dharmāḥ nimittāḥ iti animittāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that dharmas are empty or not empty, by way of taking something as a basis.🔽One should not stand in the idea that dharmas have signs or are signless, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: dharmāḥ praṇihitā ity apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dharmāḥ praṇihitāḥ iti apraṇihitāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that dharmas have wishes or are wishless, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: cakṣurvijñānaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that eye consciousness is permanent or impermanent, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: cakṣurvijñānaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that eye consciousness is happiness or suffering, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: cakṣurvijñānam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that eye consciousness is a self or not a self, by way of taking something as a basis.

original: cakṣurvijñānaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽cakṣurvijñānaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  cakṣuḥ vijñānam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye consciousness as attractive or unattractive, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as void or not void, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as afflicted or unafflicted, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣurvijñānaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye consciousness as purified or not purified, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as arising or ceasing, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as compounded or uncompounded, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣurvijñānaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽cakṣurvijñānaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽cakṣurvijñānaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  cakṣuḥ vijñānam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  cakṣuḥ vijñānam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye consciousness as empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as having an intrinsic nature or not having an intrinsic nature, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as arisen or ceased, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: śrotravijñānaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotra vijñānam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye consciousness as void or not void, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as afflicted or unafflicted, by way of apprehending something.

original: śrotravijñānaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / ŚsP II
analyzed: śrotra vijñānam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye consciousness as purified or not purified, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as arising or ceasing, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as compounded or uncompounded, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.

original: śrotravijñānam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotra vijñānam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the eye consciousness as having an intrinsic nature or not having an intrinsic nature, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the eye consciousness as arisen or ceased, by way of apprehending something.

original: śrotravijñānaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śrotravijñānaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotra vijñānam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śrotra vijñānam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that auditory consciousness is attractive or unattractive, in relation to anything at all.🔽One should not stand in the idea that auditory consciousness is calm or not calm, in relation to anything at all.

original: śrotravijñānaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotra vijñānam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that auditory consciousness is isolated or not isolated, in relation to anything at all.

original: śrotravijñānaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śrotravijñānaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotra vijñānam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śrotra vijñānam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that auditory consciousness is empty or not empty, in relation to anything at all.🔽One should not stand in the idea that auditory consciousness is with signs or signless, in relation to anything at all.

original: śrotravijñānaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotra vijñānam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that auditory consciousness is with wishes or wishless, in relation to anything at all.

original: ghrāṇavijñānaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇa vijñānam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that olfactory consciousness is permanent or impermanent, in relation to anything at all.

original: ghrāṇavijñānaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇa vijñānam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that olfactory consciousness is easeful or stressful, in relation to anything at all.

original: ghrāṇavijñānam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇa vijñānam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that olfactory consciousness is a self or not a self, in relation to anything at all.

original: ghrāṇavijñānaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇa vijñānam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that olfactory consciousness is pleasant or that it is unpleasant, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.

original: ghrāṇavijñānaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇa vijñānam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that olfactory consciousness is calm or that it is not calm, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.

original: ghrāṇavijñānaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽ghrāṇavijñānaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽ghrāṇavijñānaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇa vijñānam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  ghrāṇa vijñānam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  ghrāṇa vijñānam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that olfactory consciousness is isolated or that it is not isolated, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.🔽One should not stand in the notion that olfactory consciousness is empty or that it is not empty, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.🔽One should not stand in the notion that olfactory consciousness has signs or that it is signless, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.

original: ghrāṇavijñānaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇa vijñānam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that olfactory consciousness has a specific characteristic or that it is without a specific characteristic, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.

original: jihvāvijñānaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that gustatory consciousness is permanent or that it is impermanent, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.

original: jihvāvijñānaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that gustatory consciousness is happiness or that it is suffering, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.

original: jihvāvijñānam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that gustatory consciousness has a self or that it is without a self, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.

original: jihvāvijñānaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that gustatory consciousness is pure or that it is impure, not to mention in the notion that it is perceived.

original: jihvāvijñānaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the tongue consciousness is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvāvijñānaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the tongue consciousness is isolated or not isolated, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvāvijñānaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽jihvāvijñānaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  jihvā vijñānam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the tongue consciousness is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the tongue consciousness is with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: jihvāvijñānaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the tongue consciousness is with wishes or wishless, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyavijñānaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the body consciousness is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyavijñānaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the body consciousness is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyavijñānam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽kāyavijñānaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  kāya vijñānam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the body consciousness is a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the body consciousness is clean or unclean, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyavijñānaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the body consciousness is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyavijñānaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / ŚsP II 🔽kāyavijñānaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽kāyavijñānaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  kāya vijñānam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  kāya vijñānam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that body consciousness is isolated or not isolated, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that body consciousness is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that body consciousness is a sign or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: kāyavijñānaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya vijñānam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that body consciousness is with a focus or without a focus, by way of apprehending something.

original: manovijñānaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that mind consciousness is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: manovijñānaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that mind consciousness is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: manovijñānam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that mind consciousness is a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.

original: manovijñānaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽manovijñānaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  manaḥ vijñānam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that mind consciousness is beautiful or ugly, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the idea that mind consciousness is peaceful or not peaceful, by way of apprehending something.

original: manovijñānaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the idea that mind consciousness is isolated or not isolated, by way of apprehending something.

original: manovijñānaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽manovijñānaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  manaḥ vijñānam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that mind consciousness is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that mind consciousness is a sign or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: manovijñānaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that mind consciousness is with preparation or without preparation, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśo nitya ity anitya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ nityaḥ iti anityaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that eye contact is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaḥ sukha iti duḥkha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ sukhaḥ iti duḥkhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that eye contact is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśa ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaḥ śubha ity aśubha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ śubhaḥ iti aśubhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that eye contact is a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that eye contact is beautiful or ugly, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaḥ śānta ity aśānta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ śāntaḥ iti a śāntaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that eye contact is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśo vivikta ity avivikta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ viviktaḥ iti a viviktaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that eye contact is isolated or not isolated, by way of apprehending something.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaḥ śūnya ity aśūnya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
