original: dhāraṇīmukhāni praṇihitānīty apraṇihitānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukhāni praṇihitāni iti apraṇihitāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the dhāraṇī gateways as having aspirations or lacking aspirations, by way of apprehending something.

original: tathāgatabalāni nityānīty anityānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / ŚsP II
analyzed: tathāgata balāni nityāni iti anityāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the powers of the tathāgatas as having a core or lacking a core, by way of apprehending something.

original: tathāgatabalāni sukhānīti duḥkhānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathāgata balāni sukhāni iti duḥkhāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the powers of the tathāgatas as calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: tathāgatabalāny ātmānīty anātmānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽tathāgatabalāni śubhānīty aśubhānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽tathāgatabalāni śāntānīty aśāntānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathāgata balāni ātmāni iti anātmāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  tathāgata balāni śubhāni iti aśubhāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  tathāgata balāni śāntāni iti a śāntāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the powers of the tathāgatas as void or not void, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the powers of the tathāgatas as afflicted or purified, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the powers of the tathāgatas as arising or ceasing, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the powers of the tathāgatas as taken up or abandoned, by way of apprehending something.

original: tathāgatabalāni viviktānīty aviviktānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathāgata balāni viviktāni iti a viviktāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the powers of the tathāgatas as pure or impure, by way of apprehending something.

original: tathāgatabalāni śūnyānīty aśūnyānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽tathāgatabalāni nimittānīty animittānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathāgata balāni śūnyāni iti a śūnyāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  tathāgata balāni nimittāni iti animittāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the powers of the Tathāgata are with signs or signless,🔽One should not stand in the notion that the powers of the Tathāgata are with wishes or without wishes,

original: tathāgatabalāni praṇihitānīty apraṇihitānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathāgata balāni praṇihitāni iti apraṇihitāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the powers of the Tathāgata are empty or not empty,

original: vaiśāradyāni nityānīty anityānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni nityāni iti anityāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are permanent or impermanent,

original: vaiśāradyāni sukhānīti duḥkhānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni sukhāni iti duḥkhāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are happy or suffering,

original: vaiśāradyāny ātmānīty anātmānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽vaiśāradyāni śubhānīty aśubhānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni ātmāni iti anātmāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  vaiśāradyāni śubhāni iti aśubhāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are self or not self,🔽One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are pure or impure,

original: vaiśāradyāni śāntānīty aśāntānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽vaiśāradyāni viviktānīty aviviktānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni śāntāni iti a śāntāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  vaiśāradyāni viviktāni iti aviviktāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are calm or not calm,🔽One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are void or not void,

original: vaiśāradyāni śūnyānīty aśūnyānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni śūnyāni iti a śūnyāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are afflicted or unafflicted,🔽One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are arising or ceasing,

original: vaiśāradyāni nimittānīty animittānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni nimittāni iti animittāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: vaiśāradyāni praṇihitānīty apraṇihitānīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni praṇihitāni iti apraṇihitāni iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the fearlessnesses are with wishes or without wishes, by way of apprehending something.

original: pratisaṃvido nityā ity anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ nityāḥ iti anityāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the detailed and thorough knowledges are permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: pratisaṃvidaḥ sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ sukhāḥ iti duḥkhāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the detailed and thorough knowledges are happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: pratisaṃvida ātmāna ity anātmāna iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽pratisaṃvidaḥ śubhā ity aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ ātmānaḥ iti anātmānaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  pratisaṃvidaḥ śubhāḥ iti aśubhāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the detailed and thorough knowledges are a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the detailed and thorough knowledges are pure or impure, by way of apprehending something.

original: pratisaṃvidaḥ śāntā ity aśāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽pratisaṃvido viviktā ity aviviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ śāntāḥ iti a śāntāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  pratisaṃvidaḥ viviktāḥ iti a viviktāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the detailed and thorough knowledges are calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the detailed and thorough knowledges are empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.

original: pratisaṃvidaḥ śūnyā ity aśūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ śūnyāḥ iti a śūnyāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the detailed and thorough knowledges are with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: pratisaṃvido nimittā ity animitta iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ nimittāḥ iti animitte iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the detailed and thorough knowledges are with wishes or without wishes, by way of apprehending something.

original: pratisaṃvidaḥ praṇihitā ity apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ praṇihitāḥ iti apraṇihitāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the analytical knowledges are with or without passion.

original: mahāmaitrī nityety anityeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahāmaitrī nityā iti anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is permanent or impermanent.

original: mahāmaitrī sukheti duḥkheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā maitrī sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is happiness or suffering.

original: mahāmaitry ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahāmaitri ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is a self or not a self.

original: mahāmaitrī śubhety aśubheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽mahāmaitrī śāntety aśānteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā maitrī śubhā iti aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  mahā maitrī śāntā iti a śāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is lovely or repulsive.🔽One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is empty or not empty.🔽One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is with or without a basic nature.

original: mahāmaitrī viviktety avivikteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽mahāmaitrī śūnyety aśūnyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā maitrī viviktā iti aviviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  mahā maitrī śūnyā iti a śūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is with or without outflows.🔽One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is with or without defilements.🔽One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is with or without a residual substratum.

original: mahāmaitrī nimittety animitteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / ŚsP II 🔽mahāmaitrī praṇihitety apraṇihiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā maitrī nimittā iti animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  mahā maitrī praṇihitā iti apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is calm or not calm.🔽One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is with or without skillful qualities.🔽One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is with or without outflows.🔽One should not stand in the notion that great lovingkindness is with or without a residual substratum.

original: mahākaruṇā nityety anityeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā nityā iti anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that great compassion is permanent or impermanent.

original: mahākaruṇā sukheti duḥkheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽mahākaruṇātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  mahā karuṇā ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in great compassion as happiness or suffering through a method of apprehending.🔽One should not stand in great compassion as a self or not a self through a method of apprehending.

original: mahākaruṇā śubhety aśubheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽mahākaruṇā śāntety aśānteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā śubhā iti aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  mahā karuṇā śāntā iti a śāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in great compassion as attractive or unattractive through a method of apprehending.🔽One should not stand in great compassion as calm or not calm through a method of apprehending.

original: mahākaruṇā viviktety avivikteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā viviktā iti aviviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in great compassion as isolated or not isolated through a method of apprehending.

original: mahākaruṇā śūnyety aśūnyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽mahākaruṇā nimittety animitteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā śūnyā iti a śūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  mahā karuṇā nimittā iti animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in great compassion as empty or not empty through a method of apprehending.🔽One should not stand in great compassion as a sign or signless through a method of apprehending.

original: mahākaruṇā praṇihitety apraṇihiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā praṇihitā iti apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in great compassion as having aspirations or lacking aspirations through a method of apprehending.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmā nityā ity anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ nityāḥ iti anityāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The unique qualities of a buddha should not be stood in as permanent or impermanent through a method of apprehending.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ sukhāḥ iti duḥkhāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The unique qualities of a buddha should not be stood in as happiness or suffering through a method of apprehending.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmā ātmāna ity anātmāna iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ ātmānaḥ iti anātmānaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the unique qualities of the Buddha are a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ śubhā ity aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽āveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ śāntā ity aśāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ śubhāḥ iti aśubhāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ śāntāḥ iti a śāntāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the unique qualities of the Buddha are good or not good, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the unique qualities of the Buddha are calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmā viviktā ity aviviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽āveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ śūnyā ity aśūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽āveṇikabuddhadharmā nimittā ity animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ viviktāḥ iti a viviktāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ śūnyāḥ iti a śūnyāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ nimittāḥ iti animittāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the unique qualities of the Buddha are isolated or not isolated, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the unique qualities of the Buddha are empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the unique qualities of the Buddha are signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ praṇihitā ity apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ praṇihitāḥ iti apraṇihitāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the unique qualities of the Buddha are aspirations or no aspirations, by way of apprehending something.

original: srotaāpattiphalaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the fruit of stream-entry is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: srotaāpattiphalaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the fruit of stream-entry is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: srotaāpattiphalam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽srotaāpattiphalaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽srotaāpattiphalaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  srotaāpatti phalam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  srotaāpatti phalam śāntam iti aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of stream-entry as having a self or as being without a self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of stream-entry as having form or as being formless, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of stream-entry as having a pleasant feeling or as having an unpleasant feeling, by way of apprehending something.

original: srotaāpattiphalaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam viviktam iti aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of stream-entry as having a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant or as being without a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, by way of apprehending something.

original: srotaāpattiphalaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽srotaāpattiphalaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽srotaāpattiphalaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  srotaāpatti phalam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  srotaāpatti phalam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of stream-entry as empty or as not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of stream-entry as having a sign or as being signless, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of stream-entry as having a particular inherent nature or as being without a particular inherent nature, by way of apprehending something.

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of once-returning as having a self or as being without a self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of once-returning as having form or as being formless, by way of apprehending something.

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of once-returning as having a pleasant feeling or as having an unpleasant feeling, by way of apprehending something.

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as good or not good, by way of apprehending something.

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam ŚsP II 🔽upalambhayogena /🔽sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam  upalambha yogena  sakṛdāgāmi phalam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as having aspirations or without aspirations, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as peaceful or not peaceful, by way of apprehending something.

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam viviktam iti aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as secluded or not secluded, by way of apprehending something.

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sakṛdāgāmi phalam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of being a once-returner as having signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: anāgāmiphalaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of being a non-returner as permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: anāgāmiphalaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of being a non-returner as easeful or stressful, by way of apprehending something.

original: anāgāmiphalam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of being a non-returner as a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.

original: anāgāmiphalaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of non-returning as pleasant or unpleasant, by way of apprehending something.

original: anāgāmiphalaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam śāntam iti aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of non-returning as calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: anāgāmiphalaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam viviktam iti aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of non-returning as secluded or not secluded, by way of apprehending something.

original: anāgāmiphalaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽anāgāmiphalaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  anāgāmi phalam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of non-returning as empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the fruit of non-returning as with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: anāgāmiphalaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of non-returning as having wishes or wishless, by way of apprehending something.

original: arhattvaṃ nityam ity anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhat tvam nityam iti anityam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in arhatship as permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: arhattvaṃ sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhat tvam sukham iti duḥkham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in arhatship as happy or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: arhattvam ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhat tvam ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in arhatship as self or not self, by way of apprehending something.

original: arhattvaṃ śubham ity aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhat tvam śubham iti aśubham iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in arhatship as pure or impure, by way of apprehending something.

original: arhattvaṃ śāntam ity aśāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhat tvam śāntam iti a śāntam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is calm’ or ‘is not calm’, in relation to it.

original: arhattvaṃ viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhat tvam viviktam iti aviviktam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is isolated’ or ‘is not isolated’, in relation to it.

original: arhattvaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽arhattvaṃ nimittam ity animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhat tvam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  arhat tvam nimittam iti animittam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is empty’ or ‘is not empty’, in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is a sign’ or ‘is signless’, in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is a basis for attraction’ or ‘is a basis for repulsion’, in relation to it.

original: arhattvaṃ praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽pratyekabodhir nityety anityeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhat tvam praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  pratyeka bodhiḥ nityā iti anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is a basis for accumulation’ or ‘is a basis for dispersion’, in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is a basis for affliction’ or ‘is a basis for purification’, in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is conditioned’ or ‘is unconditioned’, in relation to it.

original: pratyekabodhiḥ sukheti duḥkheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhiḥ sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is compounded’ or ‘is uncompounded’, in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is arising’ or ‘is ceasing’, in relation to it.

original: pratyekabodhir ātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽pratyekabodhiḥ śubhety aśubheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhiḥ ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  pratyeka bodhiḥ śubhā iti aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is empty’ or ‘is not empty’, in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is a basis for attraction’ or ‘is a basis for repulsion’, in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is a basis for accumulation’ or ‘is a basis for dispersion’, in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is a basis for affliction’ or ‘is a basis for purification’, in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is conditioned’ or ‘is unconditioned’, in relation to it.

original: pratyekabodhiḥ śāntety aśānteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhiḥ śāntā iti a śāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the state of an arhat is compounded’ or ‘is uncompounded’, in relation to it.

original: pratyekabodhir viviktety avivikteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhiḥ viviktā iti aviviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is with wishes or without wishes, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: pratyekabodhiḥ śūnyety aśūnyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽pratyekabodhir nimittety animitteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhiḥ śūnyā iti a śūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  pratyeka bodhiḥ nimittā iti animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is void or not void, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is afflicted or purified, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is arising or ceasing, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: pratyekabodhiḥ praṇihitety apraṇihiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽ŚsP II 🔽sarvajñatā nityety anityeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhiḥ praṇihitā iti apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śsp ii  sarvajña tā nityā iti anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is with wishes or without wishes, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is void or not void, by way of apprehending something.

original: sarvajñatā sukheti duḥkheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sarvajñatātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarvajña tā sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sarvajña tā ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is afflicted or purified, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is arising or ceasing, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.

original: sarvajñatā śubhety aśubheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sarvajñatā śāntety aśānteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarvajña tā śubhā iti aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sarvajña tā śāntā iti a śāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is with signs or signless, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is with wishes or without wishes, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is void or not void, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is afflicted or purified, by way of apprehending something.

original: sarvajñatā viviktety avivikteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sarvajñatā śūnyety aśūnyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarvajña tā viviktā iti a viviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena 🔽sarvajña tā śūnyā iti a śūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that individual enlightenment is arising or ceasing, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that

original: sarvajñatā nimittety animitteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarvajña tā nimittā iti animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘omniscience is with signs’ or ‘is signless,’ in relation to it.

original: sarvajñatā praṇihitety apraṇihiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarvajña tā praṇihitā iti apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘omniscience is with wishes’ or ‘is wishless,’ in relation to it.

original: mārgākārajñatā nityety anityeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā nityā iti anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the knowledge of path aspects is permanent’ or ‘is impermanent,’ in relation to it.

original: mārgākārajñatā sukheti duḥkheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the knowledge of path aspects is happiness’ or ‘is suffering,’ in relation to it.

original: mārgākārajñatātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the knowledge of path aspects is a self’ or ‘is not a self,’ in relation to it.

original: mārgākārajñatā śubhety aśubheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽mārgākārajñatā śāntety aśānteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā śubhā iti aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  mārga ākāra jña tā śāntā iti a śāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the knowledge of path aspects is lovely’ or ‘is not lovely,’ in relation to it.🔽One should not stand in the notion that ‘the knowledge of path aspects is calm’ or ‘is not calm,’ in relation to it.

original: mārgākārajñatā viviktety avivikteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā viviktā iti aviviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the knowledge of path aspects is isolated’ or ‘is not isolated,’ in relation to it.

original: mārgākārajñatā śūnyety aśūnyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā śūnyā iti a śūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the knowledge of path aspects is empty’ or ‘is not empty,’ in relation to it.

original: mārgākārajñatā nimittety animitteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā nimittā iti animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘the knowledge of path aspects is with signs’ or ‘is signless,’ in relation to it.

original: mārgākārajñatā praṇihitety apraṇihiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā praṇihitā iti apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of path aspects is with dedication or not with dedication, by way of apprehending something.

original: sarvākārajñatā nityety anityeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā nityā iti anityā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is permanent or impermanent, by way of apprehending something.

original: sarvākārajñatā sukheti duḥkheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā sukhā iti duḥkhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is happiness or suffering, by way of apprehending something.

original: sarvākārajñatātmety anātmeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sarvākārajñatā śubhety aśubheti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sarvākārajñatā śāntety aśānteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā ātmā iti anātmā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sarva ākāra jña tā śubhā iti aśubhā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sarva ākāra jña tā śāntā iti aśāntā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is a self or not a self, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is lovely or repulsive, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is calm or not calm, by way of apprehending something.

original: sarvākārajñatā viviktety avivikteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā viviktā iti aviviktā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is isolated or not isolated, by way of apprehending something.

original: sarvākārajñatā śūnyety aśūnyeti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sarvākārajñatā nimittety animitteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā śūnyā iti a śūnyā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sarva ākārajña tā nimittā iti animittā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is empty or not empty, by way of apprehending something.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is a sign or signless, by way of apprehending something.

original: sarvākārajñatā praṇihitety apraṇihiteti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā praṇihitā iti apraṇihitā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is with a wish or wishless, by way of apprehending something.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika srotaāpattiphalam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sakṛdāgāmiphalam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽anāgāmiphalam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽arhattvam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika srotaāpatti phalam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sakṛdāgāmi phalam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  anāgāmi phalam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  arhat tvam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, one should not stand in the notion that the fruit of entering the stream is manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that the fruit of being tied to one more birth is manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth is manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that arhatship is manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that individual enlightenment is manifested by the unconditioned, or in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is manifested by the unconditioned.

original: pratyekabodhir asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodhir asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam ŚsP II 🔽iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽srotaāpannā dakṣiṇīyam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sakṛdāgāmī dakṣiṇīyam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhiḥ a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodhiḥ a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam  iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  srotaāpannāḥ dakṣiṇīyam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sakṛdāgāmī dakṣiṇīyam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, one should not stand in the notion that the fruit of entering the stream is manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that the fruit of being tied to one more birth is manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth is manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that arhatship is manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that individual enlightenment is manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is manifested by the unconditioned.

original: anāgāmī dakṣiṇīyam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: anāgāmī dakṣiṇīyam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the stream-enterer is a worthy recipient manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that the once-returner is a worthy recipient manifested by the unconditioned, in the notion that the non-returner is a worthy recipient manifested by the unconditioned,

original: arhan dakṣiṇīyam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhan dakṣiṇīyam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The Worthy One, the One Who Should Receive Offerings, is manifested in the unconditioned—one should not dwell on that as a basis.

original: pratyekabuddho dakṣiṇīya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhaḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The Solitary Buddha, the One Who Should Receive Offerings—one should not dwell on that as a basis.

original: tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho dakṣiṇīya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the One Who Should Receive Offerings—one should not dwell on that as a basis.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathamāyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathamāyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not dwell in the first ground as a basis.

original: dvitīyāyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dvitīyāyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: He should not dwell in the second ground as a basis.

original: tṛtīyāyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tṛtīyāyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: He should not dwell in the third ground as a basis.

original: caturthāyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: caturthāyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: He should not dwell in the fourth ground as a basis.

original: pañcamyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pañcamyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: He should not dwell in the fifth ground as a basis.

original: ṣaṣṭamyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭamyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: He should not dwell in the sixth ground as a basis.

original: saptamyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: saptamyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: He should not dwell in the seventh ground as a basis.

original: aṣṭamyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: aṣṭamyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: He should not dwell in the eighth ground as a basis.

original: navamyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: navamyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: He should not dwell in the ninth ground as a basis.

original: daśamyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: daśamyām bhūmau na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: On the tenth level, one should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathamacittotpāde sthitvā dānapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathama citta utpāde sthitvā dāna pāramitām paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, having stood in the first production of the thought [of enlightenment], should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained, thinking, I will perfect the perfection of giving.

original: śīlapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽kṣāntipāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śīla pāramitām paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  kṣānti pāramitām paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: [He should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained, thinking, I will perfect the perfection of morality.🔽[He should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained, thinking, I will perfect the perfection of patience.

original: vīryapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitām paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: [He should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained, thinking, I will perfect the perfection of effort.

original: dhyānapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitām paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: [He should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained, thinking, I will perfect the perfection of concentration.

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽smṛtyupasthānāni paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  smṛti upasthānāni paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: [He should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained, thinking, I will perfect the perfection of wisdom.🔽[He should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained, thinking, I will perfect the applications of mindfulness.

original: samyakprahāṇāni paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: samyakprahāṇāni paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: [He should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained, thinking, I will perfect the right efforts.

original: ṛddhipādāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ṛddhipādām paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: [He should not stand [as if] there is something to be attained, thinking, I will perfect the bases of supernatural power.

original: indriyāṇi paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: indriyāṇi paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the faculties,” they should not stand in anything at all.

original: balāni paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: balāni paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the powers,” they should not stand in anything at all.

original: bodhyaṅgāni paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: bodhyaṅgāni paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the branches of enlightenment,” they should not stand in anything at all.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgam paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the noble eightfold path,” they should not stand in anything at all.

original: bodhisattvaniyāmam avakramiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: bodhisattva niyāmam avakramiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will enter into the certainty of bodhisattvas,” they should not stand in anything at all.

original: bodhisattvaniyāmam avakramya buddhabhūmau sthāsyāmīti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽ŚsP II
analyzed: bodhisattva niyāmam avakramya buddha bhūmau sthāsyāmi iti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śsp ii
translated: “Having entered into the certainty of bodhisattvas, I will stand in the stage of a Buddha,” the bodhisattva great being should not stand in anything at all.

original: pañcabodhisattvābhijñāḥ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: pañca bodhisattva abhijñāḥ paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the five superknowledges of a bodhisattva,” they should not stand in anything at all.

original: pañcasu bodhisattvābhijñāsu sthitvā aprameyāny asaṃkhyeyāni buddhakṣetrāṇy upasaṃkramiṣyāmi
analyzed: pañcasu bodhisattva abhijñāsu sthitvā aprameyāni asaṃkhyeyāni buddhakṣetrāṇi upasaṃkramiṣyāmi
translated: “Having stood in the five superknowledges of a bodhisattva, I will go to innumerable, incalculable buddhafields

original: buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya śrutvā ca
analyzed: buddhānām bhagavatām darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya śrutvā ca
translated: to see the lord buddhas, to pay homage to them, to attend on them, to hear the Dharma,🔽and having heard it, to understand it,” they should not stand in anything at all.

original: tathatvāya parebhyo deśayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathatvāya parebhyaḥ deśayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will teach this to others” — the Bodhisattva Mahasattva should stand in that way, but not by way of apprehending anything.

original: yādṛśāni ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ buddhakṣetrāni tadṛśāni eva pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: yādṛśāni ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām buddhakṣetrāni tadṛśāni eva pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will fully accomplish Buddha-fields just like those of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones” — the Bodhisattva Mahasattva should not stand in that way, but not by way of apprehending anything.

original: sattvān bodhau paripācayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽aprameyāsaṃkhyeyāṃś ca lokadhātuṃ gatvā tān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān satkariṣyāmīti gurukariṣyāmīti mānayiṣyāmīti pūjayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: sattvān bodhau paripācayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyam upalambha yogena  aprameya asaṃkhyeyān ca lokadhātum gatvā tān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān satkariṣyāmi iti gurukariṣyāmi iti mānayiṣyāmi iti pūjayiṣyāmi iti
translated: “I will ripen beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening” — the Bodhisattva Mahasattva should stand in that way, but not by way of apprehending anything.

original: puṣpamālyagandhavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ koṭīniyutaśatasahasraiś ca tāṃs tathāgatāṃ pūjayiṣyāmīty evam api na sthātavyam
analyzed: puṣpa mālya gandha vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ ca tān tathāgatām pūjayiṣyāmi iti evam api na sthātavyam
translated: “Having gone to immeasurable, incalculable world systems, I will honor those Tathagatas, those Saints, the perfectly awakened ones, I will respect, revere, adore, and worship them with flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, aromatic powders, cloths, parasols, flags, and banners, and with hundreds of thousands of koṭis of niyutas of gems” — in that way also one should not stand.

original: aprameyāsaṃkhyeyāṃ sattvān anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: aprameya asaṃkhyeyām sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will establish immeasurable, incalculable sentient beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,” the bodhisattva mahāsattva should stand in that, joined in devotion.

original: pañcacakṣuṣy utpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / katamāni pañca /
analyzed: pañca cakṣuṣi utpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena katamāni pañca
translated: “I will produce the five eyes,” he should not stand in that, joined in devotion. What are the five?

original: māṃsacakṣur divyacakṣuḥ prajñācakṣur dharmacakṣur buddhacakṣur utpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: māṃsa cakṣuḥ divya cakṣuḥ prajñā cakṣuḥ dharma cakṣuḥ buddha cakṣuḥ utpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The flesh eye, the deva eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the Buddha eye. “I will produce the five eyes,” he should not stand in that, joined in devotion.

original: sarvasamādhīṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva samādhīm paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will fulfill all the meditative stabilities,” he should not stand in that, joined in devotion.

original: yena yena punaḥ samādhīn ākāṅkṣayiṣyāmi vikrīḍituṃ tena tena samādhinā vikrīḍiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogema /
analyzed: yena yena punar samādhīn ākāṅkṣayiṣyāmi vikrīḍitum tena tena samādhinā vikrīḍiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogema
translated: “I will play with whatever meditative stabilities I want,” he should not stand in that, joined in devotion.

original: sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect all the doors of retention,” he should not stand in that, joined in devotion.

original: daśatathāgatabalāni pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: daśa tathāgata balāni pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the ten tathāgata powers,” he should not stand in that, joined in devotion.

original: catvāri vaiśāradyāni pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: catvāri vaiśāradyāni pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the four fearlessnesses” — one should not stand in that.

original: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the four detailed and thorough knowledges” — one should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect great love” — one should not stand in that.

original: mahāmaitrīṃ pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā maitrīm pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect great compassion” — one should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect the eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha” — in this way also the Bodhisattva, the great being, should not stand in that.

original: mahākaruṇāṃ pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇām pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the thirty-two major marks of a great man in my body” — one should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect the eighty minor characteristics in my body” — the Bodhisattva, the great being, should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect the ten powers of a Tathagata” — one should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect the four assurances” — one should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect the four unhindered knowledges” — one should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect great compassion” — one should not stand in that.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti evam api bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti evam api bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha” — in this way also the Bodhisattva, the great being, should not stand in that.

original: dvātriṃśatāni mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇāni kāye pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam ŚsP II 🔽upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dvātriṃśatāni mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇāni kāye pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam  upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the thirty-two major marks of a great man in my body” — one should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect the eighty minor characteristics in my body” — the Bodhisattva, the great being, should not stand in that.

original: aśīty anuvyañjanāni kāye pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽śuddhānusārīni na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: aśi iti anuvyañjanāni kāye pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  śuddha anusārīni na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the ten powers of a Tathagata” — one should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect the four assurances” — one should not stand in that.

original: dharmānusārīni na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dharma anusārīni na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: “I will perfect the four unhindered knowledges” — one should not stand in that.🔽“I will perfect great compassion” — one should not stand in that.

original: aṣṭamaka iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽srotaāpanna iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽saptakṛtvabhavaparamam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽kulaṃkula ity ekavīcika iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽samaśīrṣapudgala iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽āyuḥkṣaye kleśakṣaye ceti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽avinipātadharmā iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽sakṛdāgāmi sakṛd imaṃ lokam āgamya duḥkhasyāṃ taṃ kariṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽anāgagāmiphalasākṣātkriyāyai pratikannaka iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: aṣṭamakaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  srotaāpanne iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sapta kṛtva bhava paramam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  kulaṃkulaḥ iti ekavīcikaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sama śīrṣa pudgalaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  āyuḥ kṣaye kleśa kṣaye ca iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  a vinipāta dharmāḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  sakṛdāgāmi sakṛt imam lokam āgamya tam kariṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  anāga gāmi phala sākṣātkriyāyai pratikannakaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
