original: arhann ihaivānupadhiśeṣanirvāṇadhātau parinirvāpayiṣyatīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽pratyekabuddha iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: arhan iha eva an upadhi śeṣa nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvāpayiṣyati iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  pratyekabuddhaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘I will attain parinirvāṇa in this very life in the realm of nirvāṇa that is with the remainder of the aggregates,’ thinking that ‘I am a worthy one.’

original: atikramya śrāvakabhūmiṃ pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ ca bodhisattvabhūmau sthāsyāmīti iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽mārgākārajñatājñāne sarvākārajñatāyāṃ ca na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: atikramya śrāvaka bhūmim pratyekabuddha bhūmim ca bodhisattva bhūmau sthāsyāmi iti iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  mārga ākāra jña tā jñāne sarva ākāra jña tāyām ca na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘I am a pratyekabuddha,’ thinking that ‘I have transcended the stage of the śrāvakas and the stage of the pratyekabuddhas and will stand on the stage of the bodhisattvas.’

original: sarvākāraiḥ sarvadharmān abhisaṃbuddhā sarvāvāsanā na saṃvikte śakṣayāyāṃ na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya dharmacakrapravartayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākāraiḥ sarva dharmān abhisaṃbuddhā sarva āvāsanā na saṃvikte śakṣayāyām na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya dharma cakra pravartayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘I will attain the knowledge of the modes of the path and the knowledge of all modes,’ thinking that ‘I will fully awaken to all modes of the Dharma and destroy all the latent tendencies.’

original: buddhakārye kṛtvā aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān lokadhātūn parinirvāpayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: buddha kārye kṛtvā aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān lokadhātūn parinirvāpayiṣyāmi iti
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and turn the wheel of the Dharma,’ thinking that ‘I will perform the duties of a buddha and lead to parinirvāṇa immeasurable and incalculable world systems.’

original: evam api na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: evam api na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that ‘I will do this,’ thinking that ‘I will do this.’

original: caturṣu ṛddhipādeṣu sthitvā tathārūpaṃ samādhiṃ samāpatsye yathārūpaṃ samādhiṃ samāpadya gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpān tiṣṭheyam iti na sthātavyam
analyzed: caturṣu ṛddhipādeṣu sthitvā tathārūpam samādhim samāpatsye yathārūpam samādhim samāpadya gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān tiṣṭheyam iti na sthātavyam
translated: Having stood in the four bases of supernatural power, one should not stand thinking, 'I will attain such a concentration that, having attained that concentration, I will remain for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River.'

original: aparimitaś ca me āyur bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: aparimitaḥ ca me āyuḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand thinking, 'May my lifespan be immeasurable,' by way of apprehending.

original: dvātriṃśatāṃ me mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇānām ekaikalakṣaṇaṃ śatapuṇyapariniṣpannaṃ bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: dvātriṃśatām me mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇānām ekaika lakṣaṇam śata puṇya pariniṣpannam bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand thinking, 'May each of my thirty-two marks of a great person be perfected by a hundred merits,' by way of apprehending.

original: yāvanto gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavaḥ pūrveṇa /🔽yāvanto gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavo dakṣiṇena /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ pūrveṇa  yāvantaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ dakṣiṇena
translated: As many world systems as there are, equal to the sands of the Ganges River, to the east.🔽As many world systems as there are, equal to the sands of the Ganges River, to the south.

original: yāvanto gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavaḥ paścimena /🔽yāvanto gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātava uttareṇa /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ paścimena  yāvantaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ uttareṇa
translated: As many world systems as there are, equal to the sands of the Ganges River, to the west.🔽As many world systems as there are, equal to the sands of the Ganges River, to the north.🔽As many world systems as there are, equal to the sands of the Ganges River, to the northeast.

original: yāvanto gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavaḥ uttarapūrveṇa /🔽yāvanto gaṅgānadīvālukopamā ŚsP II
analyzed: yāvantaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ uttara pūrveṇa  yāvantaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ
translated: As many world systems as there are, equal to the sands of the Ganges River,

original: lokadhātavaḥ pūrvadakṣiṇena /
analyzed: lokadhātavaḥ pūrvadakṣiṇena
translated: to the southeast.

original: yāvanto gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavo dakṣiṇapaścimena /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ dakṣiṇa paścimena
translated: As many world systems as there are, as many as there are sands in the Ganges River, to the south,

original: yāvanto gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavaḥ paścimottareṇa /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ paścimottareṇa
translated: as many world systems as there are, as many as there are sands in the Ganges River, to the northwest,🔽as many of them as there are, as many as there are sands in the Ganges River, to the northeast,🔽as many of them as there are, as many as there are sands in the Ganges River, above,🔽as many of them as there are, as many as there are sands in the Ganges River, below,

original: tāvanta ekaṃ me buddhakṣetraṃ bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tāvantaḥ ekam me buddhakṣetram bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: I should have one Buddha-field, it should not be dwelled in by means of apprehending.

original: vajropamo me trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātur bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: vajra upamaḥ me tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: My great trichiliocosm should be like a diamond, it should not be dwelled in by means of apprehending.

original: bodhivṛkṣāś ca me tādṛśo gandho niścaret /
analyzed: bodhivṛkṣāḥ ca me tādṛśaḥ gandhaḥ niścaret
translated: And from my Bodhi tree, such a fragrance should issue forth,

original: ye sattvās taṃ gandham ājighreyus teṣām na rāgadveṣamohāś ca vyābādheyur iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ tam gandham ājighreyuḥ teṣām na rāga dveṣa mohāḥ ca vyābādheyuḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: and those beings who would smell that fragrance, for them, passion, aversion, and delusion should not be rampant, it should not be dwelled in by means of apprehending.

original: na śrāvakacittaṃ na pratyekabuddhacittam utpadyeyur iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na śrāvaka cittam na pratyekabuddha cittam utpadyeyuḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: The thought of a Disciple or the thought of a Pratyekabuddha should not arise, it should not be dwelled in by means of apprehending.

original: sarve ca te niyatā bhaveyur anuttarāyā samyaksaṃbuddhāv iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarve ca te niyatāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyā samyaksaṃbuddhau iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: And all of them should be destined for the supreme perfect enlightenment, it should not be dwelled in by means of apprehending.

original: ye ca sattvās taṃ bodhivṛkṣagandham ājighreyus teṣāṃ na kaścid vyādhir bhaved kāye vā citte veti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tam bodhivṛkṣa gandham ājighreyuḥ teṣām na kaścid vyādhiḥ bhavet kāye vā citte vā iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: And if any beings were to smell the scent of that Bodhi tree, none of them would have any physical or mental illness.

original: tatra ca me buddhakṣetre na rūpaśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: tatra ca me buddhakṣetre na rūpa śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: And in that Buddha-field of mine, there should be no sound of form.

original: na vedanāśabdo bhaven na saṃjñāśabdo bhaven na saṃskāraśabdo bhaven na vijñānaśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na vedanā śabdaḥ bhavet na saṃjñā śabdaḥ bhavet na saṃskāra śabdaḥ bhavet na vijñāna śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: There should be no sound of feeling, no sound of perception, no sound of volitional formations, and no sound of consciousness.

original: na dhātuśabdo nāyatanaśabdo na pratītyasamutpādaśabdo bhaved iti sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na dhātu śabdaḥ na āyatana śabdaḥ na pratītyasamutpāda śabdaḥ bhavet iti sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: There should be no sound of the elements, no sound of the sense bases, and no sound of dependent origination.

original: na dānapāramitāśabdo bhaven na śīlapāramitāśabdo bhaven na kṣāntipāramitāśabdo bhaven
analyzed: na dāna pāramitā śabdaḥ bhavet na śīla pāramitā śabdaḥ bhavet na kṣānti pāramitā śabdaḥ bhavet
translated: There should be no sound of the perfection of giving, no sound of the perfection of morality, no sound of the perfection of patience,

original: na vīryapāramitāśabdo bhaven na dhyānapāramitāśabdo bhaven na prajñāpāramitāśabdo🔽bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na vīrya pāramitā śabdaḥ bhavet na dhyāna pāramitā śabdaḥ bhavet na prajñāpāramitā śabdaḥ 🔽bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: no sound of the perfection of diligence, no sound of the perfection of concentration, and no sound of the perfection of wisdom.🔽There should be no sound of the four noble truths, no sound of the four dhyanas, no sound of the four formless states, and no sound of the five faculties.🔽There should be no sound of the five powers, no sound of the seven factors of awakening, and no sound of the eightfold noble path.

original: nādhyātmaśūnyatāśabdo bhaven na bahirdhāśūnyatāśabdo bhaven nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na adhyātma śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na bahirdhā śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the words ‘emptiness of internal’ should not exist, the words ‘emptiness of external’ should not exist, the words ‘emptiness of internal and external’ should not exist.

original: na śūnyatāśūnyatāśabdo bhaven na mahāśūnyatāśabdo bhaven na paramārthaśūnyatāśabdo
analyzed: na śūnyatā śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na mahā śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na paramārtha śūnyatā śabdaḥ
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the words ‘emptiness of emptiness’ should not exist, the words ‘great emptiness’ should not exist, the words ‘ultimate emptiness’ should not exist,

original: bhaven na saṃsrtaśūnyatāśabdo bhaven nāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽nātyantaśūnyatāśabdo bhaven nānavarāgraśūnyatāśabdo bhaven nānavakāraśūnyatāśabdo bhaven na prakṛtiśūnyatāśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: bhavet na saṃsrta śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na asaṃskṛta śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  na atyanta śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na an avara agra śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na an avakāra śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na prakṛti śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: the words ‘emptiness of the compounded’ should not exist, the words ‘emptiness of the uncompounded’ should not exist.🔽One should not stand in the notion that the words ‘absolute emptiness’ should not exist, the words ‘emptiness of what is endless and beginningless’ should not exist, the words ‘emptiness of non-dispersal’ should not exist, the words ‘emptiness of inherent existence’ should not exist.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāśabdo bhaven na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāśabdo bhaven nānupalambhaśūnyatāśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na anupalambha śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand in the notion that the words ‘emptiness of all dharmas’ should not exist, the words ‘emptiness of own-marks’ should not exist, the words ‘emptiness of non-apprehension’ should not exist.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāśabdo bhaven na svabhāvaśūnyatāśabdo bhaven nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / ŚsP II
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na svabhāva śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: There would be no words for the emptiness of non-existence, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, or the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence. One should not stand in them by way of grasping.

original: na smṛtyupasthānaśabdo bhaven na samyakprahāṇaśabdo bhaven na ṛddhipādaśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthāna śabdaḥ bhavet na samyak prahāṇa śabdaḥ bhavet na ṛddhipāda śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: There would be no words for the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, or the bases of supernatural power. One should not stand in them by way of grasping.

original: nendriyaśabdo bhaven na balaśabdo bhaven na bodhyaṅgaśabdo bhaven nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgaśabdo bhaven nāryasatyaśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavaym upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na indriya śabdaḥ bhavet na bala śabdaḥ bhavet na bodhyaṅga śabdaḥ bhavet na ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga śabdaḥ bhavet na ārya satya śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavaym upalambha yogena
translated: There would be no words for the faculties, the powers, the factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path, or the noble truths. One should not stand in them by way of grasping.

original: na dhyānaśabdo bhaven nāpramāṇaśabdo bhaven nārūpyasamāpattiśabdo bhaven na vimokṣaśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na dhyāna śabdaḥ bhavet na apramāṇa śabdaḥ bhavet na ārūpya samāpatti śabdaḥ bhavet na vimokṣa śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: There would be no words for the meditative absorptions, the immeasurables, the formless attainments, or the liberations. One should not stand in them by way of grasping.

original: nānupūrvavihārasamāpattiśabdo bhaven na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhaśabdo
analyzed: na anupūrva vihāra samāpatti śabdaḥ bhavet na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha śabdaḥ
translated: There would be no words for the successive meditative stabilizations, the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: bhaven nābhijñāśabdo bhaven na samādhiśabdo bhaven na dhāraṇīmukhaśabdo bhaved iti🔽na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽na tathāgatabalaśabdo bhaven na vaiśāradyaśabdo bhaven na pratisaṃvidśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /🔽na mahāmaitrīśabdo bhaven na mahākaruṇāśabdo bhaven nāveṇikabuddhadharmaśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: bhavet na abhijñā śabdaḥ bhavet na samādhi śabdaḥ bhavet na dhāraṇī mukha śabdaḥ bhavet iti  na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  na tathāgata bala śabdaḥ bhavet na vaiśāradya śabdaḥ bhavet na pratisaṃvid śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena  na mahā maitrī śabdaḥ bhavet na mahā karuṇā śabdaḥ bhavet na āveṇika buddha dharma śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: There should be no word for the higher knowledges, there should be no word for meditative absorption, there should be no word for the dhāraṇī gateways,🔽one should not stand in them.🔽There should be no word for the powers of the Tathāgata, there should be no word for the fearlessnesses, there should be no word for the forms of correct understanding, one should not stand in them.🔽There should be no word for great loving kindness, there should be no word for great compassion, there should be no word for the unique qualities of a buddha, one should not stand in them.🔽🔽

original: na srotaāpattiśabdo bhaven na sakṛdāgāmiśabdo bhaven nānāgāmiśabdo bhaven nārhattvaśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: na srotaāpatti śabdaḥ bhavet na sakṛdāgāmi śabdaḥ bhavet na anāgāmi śabdaḥ bhavet na arhat tva śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: There would be no word for the higher knowledges, there would be no word for the meditative absorptions, there would be no word for the dhāraṇī gateways, there would be no word for the ten powers of the tathāgatas, there would be no word for the four fearlessnesses, there would be no word for the four kinds of unimpeded knowledge, there would be no word for the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, there would be no word for great love, there would be no word for great compassion, there would be no word for the thirty-two major marks of a great being, there would be no word for the eighty minor marks of a great being, there would be no word for the stream enterers, there would be no word for the once-returners, there would be no word for the non-returners, there would be no word for the arhats, there would be no word for the pratyekabuddhas, there would be no word for the buddhas.

original: na pratyekabuddhaśabdo bhaven na buddhaśabdo bhaved iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na pratyekabuddha śabdaḥ bhavet na buddha śabdaḥ bhavet iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: tathā hi tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhya sarvadharmā nopalabdhāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhya sarva dharmāḥ na upalabdhāḥ
translated: Because the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, did not apprehend any dharma at all.

original: evaṃ khalu kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: evam khalu kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: Thus, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not stand in the perfection of wisdom by way of apprehending anything.

original: athāyuṣmataḥ śāradvatīputasyaitad abhūt /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmataḥ śāradvatīputasya etat abhūt
translated: Then this occurred to the Venerable Śāradvatīputra:

original: kathaṃ punar bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /🔽athāyuṣmataḥ subhūtir āyuṣmataḥ śāradvatīputrasya cetasyaiva cetaḥparivitarkam ājñāyāyuṣmataṃ śāradvatīputram āmantrayati sma / tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: katham punar bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam  atha āyuṣmataḥ subhūtiḥ āyuṣmataḥ śāradvatīputrasya cetasya eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmatam śāradvatīputram āmantrayati sma tat kim manyase
translated: But how should the bodhisattva mahāsattva stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra kva tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sthitaḥ /🔽āha / na kvacid āyuṣman subhūte tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sthita iti apratisthitamānasaḥ
analyzed: āyuṣman chāradvatī putra kva tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sthitaḥ  āha na kvacid āyuṣman subhūte tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sthitaḥ iti a pratisthita mānasaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti, knowing in his mind the thought that had occurred to the Venerable Śāradvatīputra, said to the Venerable Śāradvatīputra: What do you think, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, where does the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One stand?🔽He said: Venerable Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One does not stand anywhere. The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, whose mind is not standing anywhere,

original: khalu punar āyuṣman subhūte tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sa rūpe na sthito vedanāyāṃ
analyzed: khalu punar āyuṣman subhūte tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sa rūpe na sthitaḥ vedanāyām
translated: is not standing in form, Venerable Subhūti, is not standing in feeling,

original: na sthitaḥ saṃjñāyāṃ na sthitaḥ saṃskāreṣu na sthito vijñāne na sthitaḥ /
analyzed: na sthitaḥ saṃjñāyām na sthitaḥ saṃskāreṣu na sthitaḥ vijñāne na sthitaḥ
translated: is not standing in perception, is not standing in volitional formations, is not standing in consciousness.

original: na cakṣuṣi sthito na śrotre sthito na ghrāṇe sthito na jihvāyāṃ sthito na kāye sthito na manasi sthitaḥ /🔽ŚsP II
analyzed: na cakṣuṣi sthitaḥ na śrotre sthitaḥ na ghrāṇe sthitaḥ na jihvāyām sthitaḥ na kāye sthitaḥ na manasi sthitaḥ  śsp ii
translated: He is not located in the eye, nor is he located in the ear, nor is he located in the nose, nor is he located in the tongue, nor is he located in the body, nor is he located in the mind.

original: na rūpe sthito na śabde sthito na gandhe sthito na rase sthito na sparśe sthito na dharmeṣu sthitaḥ /🔽na cakṣurvijñāne sthito na śrotravijñāne sthito na ghrāṇavijñāne sthito na jihvāvijñāne sthito na kāyavijñāne sthito na manovijñāne sthitaḥ /
analyzed: na rūpe sthitaḥ na śabde sthitaḥ na gandhe sthitaḥ na rase sthitaḥ na sparśe sthitaḥ na dharmeṣu sthitaḥ  na cakṣuḥ vijñāne sthitaḥ na śrotra vijñāne sthitaḥ na ghrāṇa vijñāne sthitaḥ na jihvā vijñāne sthitaḥ na kāya vijñāne sthitaḥ na manaḥ vijñāne sthitaḥ
translated: He is not located in form, nor is he located in sound, nor is he located in smell, nor is he located in taste, nor is he located in touch, nor is he located in dharmas.🔽He is not located in eye consciousness, nor is he located in ear consciousness, nor is he located in nose consciousness, nor is he located in tongue consciousness, nor is he located in body consciousness, nor is he located in mind consciousness.

original: na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśe sthito na śrotrasaṃsparśe sthito na ghrāṇasaṃsparśe sthito na jihvāsaṃsparśe sthito na kāyasaṃsparśe sthito na manaḥsaṃsparśe
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśe sthitaḥ na śrotra saṃsparśe sthitaḥ na ghrāṇa saṃsparśe sthitaḥ na jihvā saṃsparśe sthitaḥ na kāya saṃsparśe sthitaḥ na manaḥ saṃsparśe
translated: He is not located in eye contact, nor is he located in ear contact, nor is he located in nose contact, nor is he located in tongue contact, nor is he located in body contact, nor is he located in mind contact.

original: na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ sthito na śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ sthito
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām sthitaḥ na śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām sthitaḥ
translated: He is not located in the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, nor is he located in the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact,

original: na ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ sthito na jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ sthito
analyzed: na ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām sthitaḥ na jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām sthitaḥ
translated: nor is he located in the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact, nor is he located in the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact,🔽nor is he located in the feeling that arises from the condition of body contact, nor is he located in the feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact.

original: na kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ sthito na manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: na kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām sthitaḥ na manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām sthitaḥ
translated: He is not established in the feeling that arises from the contact of body and mind.

original: na pṛthivīdhātau sthito nābdhātau sthito na tejodhātau sthito na vāyudhātau sthito nākāśadhātau sthito na vijñānadhātau sthitaḥ /
analyzed: na pṛthivī dhātau sthitaḥ na ap dhātau sthitaḥ na tejaḥ dhātau sthitaḥ na vāyu dhātau sthitaḥ na ākāśa dhātau sthitaḥ na vijñāna dhātau sthitaḥ
translated: He is not established in the earth element, not established in the water element, not established in the fire element, not established in the wind element, not established in the space element, not established in the consciousness element.

original: nāvidyāyāṃ sthito na saṃskāreṣu sthito na vijñāne sthito na nāmarūpe sthito na ṣaḍāyatane
analyzed: na avidyāyām sthitaḥ na saṃskāreṣu sthitaḥ na vijñāne sthitaḥ na nāma rūpe sthitaḥ na ṣaṣ āyatane
translated: He is not established in ignorance, not established in volitional actions, not established in consciousness, not established in name-and-form, not established in the six sense bases,

original: sthito na sparśe sthito na vedanāyāṃ sthito na tṛṣṇāyāṃ sthito nopādāne sthito na
analyzed: sthitaḥ na sparśe sthitaḥ na vedanāyām sthitaḥ na tṛṣṇāyām sthitaḥ na upādāne sthitaḥ na
translated: not established in contact, not established in feeling, not established in craving, not established in grasping, not established in

original: bhave sthito na jātau sthito na jarāmaraṇe sthitaḥ /
analyzed: bhave sthitaḥ na jātau sthitaḥ na jarā maraṇe sthitaḥ
translated: existence, not established in birth, not established in old age and death.

original: na dānapāramitāyāṃ sthito na śīlapāramitāyāṃ sthito na kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ sthito na vīryapāramitāyāṃ sthito na dhyānapāramitāyāṃ sthito na prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: na dāna pāramitāyām sthitaḥ na śīla pāramitāyām sthitaḥ na kṣānti pāramitāyām sthitaḥ na vīrya pāramitāyām sthitaḥ na dhyāna pāramitāyām sthitaḥ na prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He is not established in the perfection of giving, not established in the perfection of morality, not established in the perfection of patience, not established in the perfection of vigor, not established in the perfection of meditation, not established in the perfection of wisdom,

original: nādhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ sthito na bahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ sthito nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: na adhyātma śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na bahirdhā śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyām
translated: not established in inner emptiness, not established in outer emptiness, not established in inner and outer emptiness,

original: sthito na śūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ sthito na mahāśūnyatāyāṃ sthito na paramārthaśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: sthitaḥ na śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na mahā śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na paramārtha śūnyatāyām
translated: He is not established in emptiness of emptiness, not established in great emptiness, not established in ultimate emptiness,

original: sthito na saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāṃ sthito nāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāṃ sthito nātyantaśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: sthitaḥ na saṃskṛta śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na atyanta śūnyatāyām
translated: not established in emptiness of conditioned phenomena, not established in emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, not established in emptiness of the unlimited,

original: sthito nānavarāgraśūnyatāyāṃ sthito nānavakāraśūnyatāyāṃ sthito na prakṛtiśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: sthitaḥ na an avara agra śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na anavakāra śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na prakṛti śūnyatāyām
translated: not established in emptiness of the beginningless and endless, not established in emptiness of non-discarded, not established in emptiness of inherent nature,

original: sthito na sarvadharmaśūnyatāyāṃ sthito na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyāṃ sthito nānupalambhaśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: sthitaḥ na sarva dharma śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na anupalambha śūnyatāyām
translated: not established in emptiness of all phenomena, not established in emptiness of individual characteristics, not established in emptiness of non-apprehension,

original: sthito nābhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ sthito na svabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ sthito nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: sthitaḥ na abhāva śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na svabhāva śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ
translated: not established in emptiness of non-existence, not established in emptiness of inherent nature, not established in emptiness of the inherent nature of non-existence.

original: na smṛtyupasthāneṣu sthito na samyakprahāṇeṣu sthito na ṛddhipādeṣu sthito nendriyeṣu
analyzed: na smṛti upasthāneṣu sthitaḥ na samyakprahāṇeṣu sthitaḥ na ṛddhipādeṣu sthitaḥ na indriyeṣu
translated: He is not established in the applications of mindfulness, not established in the right efforts, not established in the bases of supernatural power, not established in the faculties,

original: sthito na baleṣu sthito na bodhyaṅgeṣu sthito nāryāṣṭāṅge marge sthito nāryasatyeṣu
analyzed: sthitaḥ na baleṣu sthitaḥ na bodhyaṅgeṣu sthitaḥ na ārya aṣṭāṅge marge sthitaḥ na ārya satyeṣu
translated: not established in the powers, not established in the branches of enlightenment, not established in the noble eightfold path, not established in the noble truths,

original: sthito na dhyāneṣu sthito nāpramāṇeṣu sthito nārūpyasamāpattiṣu sthito na vimokṣeṣu
analyzed: sthitaḥ na dhyāneṣu sthitaḥ na apramāṇeṣu sthitaḥ na ārūpya samāpattiṣu sthitaḥ na vimokṣeṣu
translated: not established in the meditative absorptions, not established in the immeasurables, not established in the formless attainments, not established in the liberations,

original: sthito nānupūrvavihārasamāpattiṣu sthito na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukheṣu🔽sthito nābhijñāsu sthito na samādhiṣu sthito na dhāraṇīmukheṣu ŚsP II 🔽sthito na tathāgatabaleṣu sthito na vaiśāradyeṣu sthito na pratisaṃvitsu sthito na
analyzed: sthitaḥ na anupūrva vihāra samāpattiṣu sthitaḥ na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukheṣu  sthitaḥ na abhijñāsu sthitaḥ na samādhiṣu sthitaḥ na dhāraṇī mukheṣu  sthitaḥ na tathāgata baleṣu sthitaḥ na vaiśāradyeṣu sthitaḥ na pratisaṃvitsu sthitaḥ na
translated: He is not established in the formless absorptions, he is not established in the eight liberations, he is not established in the nine serial absorptions, he is not established in the concentrations, he is not established in the immeasurables, he is not established in the formless absorptions, he is not established in the emptiness, signless, and wishless liberations,

original: mahāmaitryā sthito na mahākaruṇāyāṃ sthito nāveṇikabuddhadharmeṣu sthito na sarvajñatāyāṃ
analyzed: mahā maitryā sthitaḥ na mahā karuṇāyām sthitaḥ na āveṇika buddha dharmeṣu sthitaḥ na sarvajña tāyām
translated: he is not established in the eight perfect knowledges, he is not established in the ten universal bases, he is not established in the four forms of correct knowledge, he is not established in the four forms of exact knowledge, he is not established in the four forms of supernatural knowledge, he is not established in the five forms of spiritual faculty, he is not established in the five forms of power, he is not established in the seven aspects of enlightenment, he is not established in the noble eightfold path, he is not established in the three forms of knowledge, he is not established in the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, he is not established in the three forms of training, he is not established in the ten powers of the Tathāgata, he is not established in the four forms of fearlessness, he is not established in the four forms of unobstructed understanding, he is not established in the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, he is not established in great love, he is not established in great compassion, he is not established in the qualities unique to a Buddha, he is not established in omniscience,

original: sthito na mārgākārajñatāyāṃ sthito na sarvākārajñatāyāṃ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: sthitaḥ na mārga ākārajña tāyām sthitaḥ na sarva ākārajña tāyām sthitaḥ
translated: he is not established in the knowledge of paths, he is not established in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: evaṃ khalv āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyaṃ /
analyzed: evam khalu āyuṣman chāradvatī putra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: yathā tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho rūpe naiva sthito nāsthito vedanāyāṃ naiva
analyzed: yathā tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rūpe na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ vedanāyām na eva
translated: Just as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, is not standing in form, nor not standing, he is not standing in feeling,

original: sthito nāsthitaḥ samjñāyām naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ saṃskāreṣu naiva sthito nāsthito
analyzed: sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ samjñāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ saṃskāreṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: nor not standing, he is not standing in perception, nor not standing, he is not standing in volitional formations, nor not standing,

original: vijñāne naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: vijñāne na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: he is not standing in consciousness, nor not standing.

original: cakṣuṣi naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ śrotre naiva sthito nāsthito ghrāṇe naiva sthito nāsthito jihvāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ kāye naiva sthito
analyzed: cakṣuṣi na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ śrotre na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ ghrāṇe na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ jihvāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ kāye na eva sthitaḥ
translated: He is not present in the eye, nor is he absent. He is not present in the ear, nor is he absent. He is not present in the nose, nor is he absent. He is not present in the tongue, nor is he absent. He is not present in the body,

original: nāsthito manasi naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: na asthitaḥ manasi nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: nor is he absent. He is not present in the mind, nor is he absent.

original: rūpe naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ śabde naiva sthito nāsthito gandhe naiva sthito nāsthito rase naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ sparśe naiva sthito nāsthito
analyzed: rūpe na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ śabde na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ gandhe na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ rase na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ sparśe na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is not present in form, nor is he absent. He is not present in sound, nor is he absent. He is not present in smell, nor is he absent. He is not present in taste, nor is he absent. He is not present in touch,

original: dharmeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /🔽cakṣurvijñāne naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ śrotravijñāne naiva sthito nāsthito ghrāṇavijñāne
analyzed: dharmeṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ  cakṣuḥ vijñāne na eva sthitaḥ na a sthitaḥ śrotra vijñāne na eva sthitaḥ na a sthitaḥ ghrāṇa vijñāne
translated: nor is he absent. He is not present in phenomena, nor is he absent.🔽He is not present in eye consciousness, nor is he absent. He is not present in ear consciousness, nor is he absent. He is not present in nose consciousness,

original: naiva sthito nāsthito jihvāvijñāne naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ kāyavijñāne naiva sthito
analyzed: na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ jihvā vijñāne na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ kāya vijñāne na eva sthitaḥ
translated: nor is he absent. He is not present in tongue consciousness, nor is he absent. He is not present in body consciousness,

original: nāsthito manovijñāne naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: na asthitaḥ manaḥ vijñāne na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: nor is he absent. He is not present in mind consciousness, nor is he absent.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśe naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ śrotrasaṃsparśe naiva sthito nāsthito ghrāṇasaṃsparśe
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśe na eva sthitaḥ na a sthitaḥ śrotra saṃsparśe na eva sthitaḥ na a sthitaḥ ghrāṇa saṃsparśe
translated: He is not present in eye contact, nor is he absent. He is not present in ear contact, nor is he absent. He is not present in nose contact,🔽nor is he absent.

original: naiva sthito nāsthito jihvāsaṃsparśe naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ kāyasaṃsparśe naiva sthito
analyzed: na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ jihvā saṃsparśe na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ kāya saṃsparśe na eva sthitaḥ
translated: He is not established in or detached from tongue contact, not established in or detached from body contact, not established in or detached from mind contact.

original: nāsthito manaḥsaṃsparśe naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ
analyzed: na asthitaḥ manaḥ saṃsparśe na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ  cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām
translated: He is not established in the tongue sense-sphere, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the body sense-sphere, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the mind sense-sphere, nor is he non-established.

original: naiva sthito nāsthito ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthito jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ
analyzed: na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām
translated: He is not established in the eye sense-sphere, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the ear sense-sphere, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the nose sense-sphere, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the tongue sense-sphere, nor is he non-established.

original: naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthito manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāṃ🔽naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ🔽pṛthivīdhātau naiva sthito nāsthito 'bdhātau naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ tejodhātau naiva
analyzed: na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyām  na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ  pṛthivī dhātau na eva sthitaḥ na a sthitaḥ a dhātau na eva sthitaḥ na a sthitaḥ tejaḥ dhātau na eva
translated: He is not established in the body sense-sphere, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the mind sense-sphere, nor is he non-established.

original: sthito nāsthito vāyudhātau naiva sthito nāsthita ākāśadhātau naiva sthito nāsthito
analyzed: sthitaḥ na a sthitaḥ vāyu dhātau na eva sthitaḥ na a sthitaḥ ākāśa dhātau na eva sthitaḥ na a sthitaḥ
translated: He is not established in the earth element, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the water element, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the fire element, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the wind element, nor is he non-established. He is not established in the space element, nor is he non-established.

original: vijñānadhātau naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna dhātau na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is not established in the consciousness element, nor is he non-established.

original: avidyāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ saṃskāreṣu naiva sthito nāsthito vijñāne naiva sthito
analyzed: avidyāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ saṃskāreṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ vijñāne na eva sthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in ignorance, he is neither standing nor not standing in volitional formations, he is neither standing nor not standing in consciousness,

original: nāsthito nāmarūpe naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ ṣaḍāyatane naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ sparśe🔽naiva sthito nāsthito vedanāyāṃ naiva sthito ŚsP II 🔽nāsthitaḥ tṛṣṇāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthita upādāne naiva sthito nāsthito bhave naiva sthito nāsthito jātau naiva sthito nāsthito jarāmaraṇe naiva
analyzed: na asthitaḥ nāma rūpe na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ ṣaṣ āyatane na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ sparśe  na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ vedanāyām na eva sthitaḥ  na asthitaḥ tṛṣṇāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ upādāne na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ bhave na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ jātau na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ jarā maraṇe na eva
translated: he is neither standing nor not standing in name and form, he is neither standing nor not standing in the six sense bases, he is neither standing nor not standing in contact,

original: sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: he is neither standing nor not standing in feeling, he is neither standing nor not standing in craving, he is neither standing nor not standing in grasping, he is neither standing nor not standing in becoming, he is neither standing nor not standing in birth, he is neither standing nor not standing in old age and death.

original: dānapāramitāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ śīlapāramitāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ śīla pāramitāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ kṣānti pāramitāyām
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the perfection of giving, he is neither standing nor not standing in the perfection of morality, he is neither standing nor not standing in the perfection of patience,

original: naiva sthito nāsthito vīryapāramitāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthito dhyānapāramitāyāṃ naiva
analyzed: na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ vīrya pāramitāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ dhyāna pāramitāyām na eva
translated: he is neither standing nor not standing in the perfection of vigor, he is neither standing nor not standing in the perfection of concentration,

original: sthito nāsthitaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: he is neither standing nor not standing in the perfection of wisdom.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthito bahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthito
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatāyām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ bahirdhā śūnyatāyām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor is he standing or not standing in the emptiness of external phenomena.

original: 'dhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ śūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito
analyzed: dhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ śūnyatā śūnyatāyām nā eva sthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, nor is he standing or not standing in the emptiness of emptiness.

original: nāsthito mahāśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ paramārthaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito
analyzed: na asthitaḥ mahāśūnyatāyām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ paramārtha śūnyatāyām nā eva sthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in great emptiness, nor is he standing or not standing in ultimate emptiness.

original: nāsthitaḥ saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthito 'saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito🔽nāsthito 'tyantaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthito navarāgraśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito
analyzed: na asthitaḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatāyām na eva sthitaḥ  tyanta śūnyatāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ navara agra śūnyatāyām na eva sthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in conditioned emptiness, nor is he standing or not standing in unconditioned emptiness.🔽He is neither standing nor not standing in absolute emptiness, nor is he standing or not standing in emptiness without beginning or end.

original: nāsthito 'navakāraśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ prakṛtiśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito
analyzed: na asthitaḥ navakāra śūnyatāyām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ prakṛti śūnyatāyām nā eva sthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in emptiness without cessation, nor is he standing or not standing in the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: nāsthitaḥ sarvadharmaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva
analyzed: na asthitaḥ sarva dharma śūnyatāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyām na eva
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the emptiness of all phenomena, nor is he standing or not standing in the emptiness of specific characteristics.

original: sthito nāsthito 'nupalambhaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthito 'bhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva
analyzed: sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ na upalambha śūnyatāyām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ bhāva śūnyatāyām nā eva
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the emptiness of non-apprehension, nor is he standing or not standing in the emptiness of non-existence.

original: sthito nāsthitaḥ svabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthito 'bhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ svabhāva śūnyatāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ bhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyām
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the emptiness of inherent nature, nor is he standing or not standing in the emptiness of the inherent nature of non-existence.

original: naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /🔽smṛtyupasthāneṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ  smṛti upasthāneṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing.🔽He is neither standing nor not standing in the applications of mindfulness.

original: samyakprahāṇeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /🔽ṛddhipādeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /🔽indriyeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: samyakprahāṇeṣu nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ  ṛddhipādeṣu nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ  indriyeṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the right efforts.🔽He is neither standing nor not standing in the bases of supernatural power.🔽He is neither standing nor not standing in the faculties.

original: baleṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: baleṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the powers.

original: bodhyaṅgeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: bodhyaṅgeṣu nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the limbs of enlightenment.

original: āryāṣṭāṅge marge naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅge marge nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the noble eightfold path.

original: āryasatyeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: ārya satyeṣu nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the noble truths.

original: dhyāneṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: dhyāneṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the concentrations.

original: apramāṇeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: apramāṇeṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the immeasurables.

original: ārūpyasamāpattiṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpattiṣu nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the formless attainments.

original: vimokṣeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: vimokṣeṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the liberations.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattiṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpattiṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the successive attainments.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukheṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukheṣu nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: abhijñāsu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: abhijñāsu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the superknowledges.

original: samādhiṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: samādhiṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the meditative absorptions.

original: dhāraṇīmukheṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukheṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: tathāgatabaleṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /🔽vaiśāradyeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata baleṣu nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ  vaiśāradyeṣu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the powers of the tathāgatas.🔽He is neither standing nor not standing in the fearlessnesses.

original: pratisaṃvitsu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /🔽mahāmaitryāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: pratisaṃvitsu na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ  mahāmaitryām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽He is neither standing nor not standing in great love.

original: mahākaruṇāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: mahā karuṇāyām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in great compassion.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmeṣu naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmeṣu nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the unique qualities of a buddha.

original: sarvajñatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: sarvajña tāyām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in omniscience.

original: mārgākārajñatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tāyām nā eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: sarvākārajñatāyāṃ naiva sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tāyām na eva sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: He is neither standing nor not standing in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: evaṃ khalv āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyaṃ sthātavyam ity asthānayogena /
analyzed: evam khalu āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam sthātavyam iti asthāna yogena
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom, should stand in the perfection of wisdom, by way of not standing.

original: ŚsP II
analyzed: śsp ii
translated: ŚSK_2

original: atha khalu tatra parṣadi keṣāñcid devaputrāṇām etad abhavat /
analyzed: atha khalu tatra parṣadi keṣāñcid deva putrāṇām etat abhavat
translated: Then, in that assembly, some gods thought this:

original: yāni tāni yakṣāṇāṃ yakṣapadāni yakṣamantritāni yakṣarutāni yakṣapravyāhṛtāni vijñāyante /
analyzed: yāni tāni yakṣāṇām yakṣa padāni yakṣa mantritāni yakṣa rutāni yakṣa pravyāhṛtāni vijñāyante
translated: Those are the words, mantras, sounds, and expressions of the yakshas that are known.

original: tāni mantrayamāṇāni /
analyzed: tāni mantrayamāṇāni
translated: When they are being mantrified,

original: idaṃ punar api na vijñāyate yad āryasubhūtiḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāṣate pravyāharati deśayati vibhajaty uttānīkaroti upadiśati /
analyzed: idam punar api na vijñāyate yat ārya subhūtiḥ prajñāpāramitām bhāṣate pravyāharati deśayati vibhajati uttānīkaroti upadiśati
translated: but it is not known again what the noble Subhuti is speaking, expressing, teaching, analyzing, clarifying, and instructing about the perfection of wisdom.

original: athāyuṣmān subhūtis teṣāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkam ājñāya tān devaputrān āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ teṣām deva putrāṇām cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya tān deva putrān āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti, knowing with his own mind the thoughts of those gods, addressed those gods, saying:

original: na vijñāyate devaputrāṇām āmantrayate /
analyzed: na vijñāyate deva putrāṇām āmantrayate
translated: Gods, it is not known by the gods.

original: devaputrā āhuḥ /
analyzed: deva putrāḥ āhuḥ
translated: The gods said:

original: na vijñāyate āryasubhūte /
analyzed: na vijñāyate ārya subhūte
translated: It is not known, noble Subhuti.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: tathā hi devaputrā ekākṣaram api na pravyāhrite tan na śruyate yan na śruyate tan na vijñāyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi deva putrāḥ eka akṣaram api na pravyāhrite tat na śruyate yat na śruyate tat na vijñāyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, gods, not even a single syllable is uttered, and that is not heard. What is not heard is not known. Why is that?

original: na hy akṣarāṇi prajñāpāramitā na cātra kaścid deśayitā na śrotā na vijñātā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na hi akṣarāṇi prajñāpāramitā na ca atra kaścid deśayitā na śrotā na vijñātā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because the syllables are not the perfection of wisdom, and there is no one here who teaches, hears, or knows. Why is that?

original: anakṣarā hi devaputrās tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ bodhiḥ tad yathāpi🔽nāma devaputrās tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho buddhanirmitaṃ nirmimīte / sa ca punar
analyzed: anakṣarā hi deva putrāḥ tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām bodhiḥ tat yathā api  nāma deva putrāḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ buddha nirmitam nirmimīte sa ca punar
translated: The bodhi of the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones is indeed without syllables.🔽Just as, sons of gods, a Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One creates a Buddha emanation, and that emanation creates another emanation.

original: nirmitaś catasraparṣado nirmimītaḥ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikāḥ /
analyzed: nirmitaḥ catasraḥ parṣadaḥ nirmimītaḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ
translated: The bodhi of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, O sons of gods, is without syllables. It is just as, O sons of gods, a Tathagata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One creates a Buddha emanation, and that emanation creates the four assemblies of monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.

original: atha sa nirmitaḥ tābhyo nirmitābhyaś catasṛbhyaḥ parṣadbhyo dharmaṃ deśayet / tat kiṃ manyadhve /🔽devaputrāḥ / api tu tatra parṣadi kenacid deśitaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: atha sa nirmitaḥ tābhyaḥ nirmitābhyaḥ catasṛbhyaḥ parṣadbhyaḥ dharmam deśayet tat kim manyadhve  deva putrāḥ api tu tatra parṣadi kenacid deśitam bhavet
translated: If that emanation were to teach the Dharma to those four assemblies, what do you think, O sons of gods?

original: kenacic chrutam ājñātaṃ ca bhavet /
analyzed: kenacid śrutam ājñātam ca bhavet
translated: Is there anyone in that assembly who teaches, or who hears and understands?

original: āhuḥ / no hīdaṃ bhadanta subhūte /
analyzed: āhuḥ no hi idam bhadanta subhūte
translated: They said, No, Venerable Subhuti.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said,

original: evam eva devaputrāḥ sarvadharmā nirmitopamās tatra kenacid deśitaṃ na kenacic chrutaṃ na kenacid ājñātaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva deva putrāḥ sarva dharmāḥ nirmita upamāḥ tatra kenacid deśitam na kenacid śrutam na kenacid ājñātam
translated: In the same way, O sons of gods, all dharmas are like an emanation. There, nothing is taught, nothing is heard or understood.

original: tad yathāpi nāma devaputrāḥ svapnāntaragataḥ puruṣas tathāgatam arhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhadharmaṃ deśayantaṃ paśyet / tat kiṃ manyadhve /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma deva putrāḥ svapna antara gataḥ puruṣaḥ tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddha dharmam deśayantam paśyet tat kim manyadhve
translated: Devaputras, it is just as if a man in a dream were to see the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One teaching the Dharma. What do you think?

original: devaputrāḥ / api nu tatra deśitaṃ vā śrutaṃ vā ājñātaṃ vā bhavet /
analyzed: deva putrāḥ api nu tatra deśitam vā śrutam vā ājñātam vā bhavet
translated: Devaputras, would there be anything taught, heard, or understood there?

original: āhuḥ / no hīdaṃ bhadanta subhūte /
analyzed: āhuḥ no hi idam bhadanta subhūte
translated: They said, No, Venerable Subhuti.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said,

original: evam eva devaputrāḥ svapnopamāḥ sarvadharmās tatra na kenacid deśitaṃ na kenacid
analyzed: evam eva deva putrāḥ svapna upamāḥ sarva dharmāḥ tatra na kenacid deśitam na kenacid
translated: In the same way, Devaputras, all dharmas are like a dream. There, nothing is taught by anyone,

original: śrutaṃ na kenacid ājñātaṃ tad yathāpi nāma devaputrāḥ dvau puruṣau parvatakandare
analyzed: śrutam na kenacid ājñātam tat yathā api nāma deva putrāḥ dvau puruṣau parvata kandare
translated: heard by anyone, or understood by anyone. It is just as if, Devaputras, two men were to stand in a mountain ravine

original: sthitvā buddhasya varṇaṃ bhāṣeyātāṃ dharmasya varṇaṃ bhāṣeyātāṃ saṃghasya varṇaṃ bhāṣeyātāṃ /🔽tatra ubhayataḥ pratiśrutkāt svaro niścatet / tat kiṃ manyadhve / ŚsP II
analyzed: sthitvā buddhasya varṇam bhāṣeyātām dharmasya varṇam bhāṣeyātām saṃghasya varṇam bhāṣeyātām  tatra ubhayatas pratiśrutkāt svaraḥ niścatet tat kim manyadhve
translated: and praise the Buddha, praise the Dharma, and praise the Sangha.🔽Then, an echo would resound from both of them. What do you think, Devaputras?

original: devaputrāḥ / api nu tenaikena pratiśrutkāśabdena dvitīyapratiśrutkāśabdo vijñāpito bhavet /
analyzed: deva putrāḥ api nu tena ekena pratiśrutkā śabdena dvitīya pratiśrutkā śabdaḥ vijñāpitaḥ bhavet
translated: Would the sound of one echo be made known by the second echo?

original: āhuh / no hīdaṃ bhadanta subhūte /
analyzed: āhuḥ no hi idam bhadanta subhūte
translated: They said, No, Venerable Subhuti.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: evam eva devaputrāḥ sarvadharmāḥ pratiśrutkopamāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva deva putrāḥ sarva dharmāḥ pratiśrutkā upamāḥ
translated: Sons of gods, all dharmas are like an echo in the same way.

original: tatra na kenacid deśitaṃ na kenacic chrutaṃ na kenacid ājñātaṃ /🔽tad yathāpi nāma devaputrā dakṣo māyākāro vā māyākārāntevāsī vā caturmahāpathe tathāgatam
analyzed: tatra na kenacid deśitam na kenacid śrutam na kenacid ājñātam  tat yathā api nāma deva putrāḥ dakṣaḥ māyākāraḥ vā māyākāra antevāsī vā catur mahāpathe tathāgatam
translated: There, nothing is taught by anyone, heard by anyone, or understood by anyone.🔽Sons of gods, it is just as if a skilled magician or the apprentice of a magician would conjure up a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One at a crossroads,

original: arhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddham abhinirmimīte / catasraś ca parṣado 'binirmimīto bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāśikāḥ🔽sa ca nirmitas tābhyo nirmitābhyaḥ parṣadbhyo dharmaṃ deśayet / tat kiṃ manyadhve /
analyzed: arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham abhinirmimīte catasraḥ ca parṣadaḥ binirmimītaḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāśikāḥ  sa ca nirmitaḥ tābhyaḥ nirmitābhyaḥ parṣadbhyaḥ dharmam deśayet tat kim manyadhve
translated: and would conjure up the four assemblies of monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen,

original: devaputrāḥ /
analyzed: deva putrāḥ
translated: and that conjured one would teach the Dharma to those conjured assemblies. What do you think, sons of gods?

original: api nu tatra kenacid deśitaṃ vā śrutaṃ vā ājñātaṃ vā bhavet /
analyzed: api nu tatra kenacid deśitam vā śrutam vā ājñātam vā bhavet
translated: Would there be anything taught, heard, or understood there by anyone?

original: āhuh / no hīdaṃ bhadanta subhūte /
analyzed: āhuḥ no hi idam bhadanta subhūte
translated: They said: No, Venerable Subhūti.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: evam eva devaputrā māyopamāḥ sarvadharmās tatra na kenacic chrutaṃ na kenacid deśitaṃ na kenacid ājñātam /
analyzed: evam eva deva putrāḥ māyā upamāḥ sarva dharmāḥ tatra na kenacid śrutam na kenacid deśitam na kenacid ājñātam
translated: Sons of gods, all dharmas are like an illusion in the same way. There, nothing is heard by anyone, taught by anyone, or understood by anyone.

original: atha teṣām devaputrāṇām etad abhūt /
analyzed: atha teṣām deva putrāṇām etat abhūt
translated: Then this occurred to those sons of gods:

original: uttarīkariṣyati batāyam āryasthaviraḥ subhūtir uttānīkariṣyati batāyam āryasthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ prajñāpāramitām iti /🔽atha ca punar gambhīrād gambhīrataraṃ deśayati /🔽śūkṣmāt śūkṣmataraṃ praviśati /🔽athāyuṣmān subhūtis teṣām devaputrāṇām cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkam ājñāya tān devaputrān etad avocat /

translated: The noble elder Subhūti will make it rise up, the noble elder Subhūti will make it stand out.🔽And yet he teaches what is deeper and deeper.🔽He penetrates what is more subtle and subtle.🔽Then the Venerable Subhūti, knowing with his mind the thoughts in the minds of those gods, said this to those gods:🔽🔽Gods! Gods!

original: na cakṣur gambhīraṃ na śūkṣmaṃ /🔽na śrotraṃ gambhīraṃ na śūkṣmaṃ /🔽na ghrāṇaṃ gambhīraṃ na śūkṣmaṃ /

translated: The eye is not deep or subtle.🔽The ear is not deep or subtle.🔽The nose is not deep or subtle.

analyzed: na jihvā gambhīrā na śūkṣmā

translated: The nature of the eye is not deep or subtle.🔽The nature of the ear is not deep or subtle.🔽The nature of the nose is not deep or subtle.

translated: The nature of mind contact is neither profound nor subtle.🔽The feelings that arise from eye contact are neither profound nor subtle.

original: na śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā gambhīrā na śūkṣmāḥ /

analyzed: na ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāḥ gambhīrāḥ na śūkṣmāḥ  na jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāḥ gambhīrāḥ na śūkṣmāḥ

original: na kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā gambhīrā na śūkṣmāḥ /

original: na manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā gambhīrā na śūkṣmāḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /

translated: The feeling that arises from the condition of contact at the mind is not deep or subtle. Why is that?

original: na jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāsvabhāvo gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā svabhāvaḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ
translated: The nature of the feeling that arises from the condition of contact at the tongue is not deep or subtle.

original: na kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāsvabhāvo ŚsP II 🔽gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā svabhāvaḥ  gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ

original: na manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāsvabhāvo gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /🔽na pṛthivīdhātur gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā svabhāvaḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ  na pṛthivī dhātuḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ
translated: The nature of the feeling that arises from the condition of contact at the mind is not deep or subtle.🔽The earth element is not deep or subtle.

original: nābdhātur gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na ap dhātuḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ
translated: The water element is not deep or subtle.

original: na tejodhātur gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /🔽na vāyudhātur gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātuḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ  na vāyu dhātuḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ
translated: The earth element is not deep or subtle.🔽The water element is not deep or subtle.🔽The fire element is not deep or subtle.

original: nākāśadhātur gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na ākāśa dhātuḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ
translated: The wind element is not deep or subtle.🔽The space element is not deep or subtle.

original: na vijñānadhātur gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na vijñāna dhātuḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The consciousness element is not deep or subtle. Why is that?

original: na pṛthivīdhātusvabhāvo gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /🔽nābdhātusvabhāvo gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /🔽na tejodhātusvabhāvo gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /🔽na vāyudhātusvabhāvo gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na pṛthivī dhātu svabhāvaḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ  na ap dhātu svabhāvaḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ  na tejaḥ dhātu svabhāvaḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ  na vāyu dhātu svabhāvaḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ
translated: The nature of the earth element is not deep or subtle.🔽The nature of the water element is not deep or subtle.🔽The nature of the fire element is not deep or subtle.

original: nākāśadhātusvabhāvo gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /🔽na vijñānadhātusvabhāvo gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na ākāśa dhātu svabhāvaḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ  na vijñāna dhātu svabhāvaḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ
translated: The nature of the wind element is not deep or subtle.🔽The nature of the space element is not deep or subtle.🔽The nature of the consciousness element is not deep or subtle.

original: nāvidyā gambhīrā na śūkṣmā /
analyzed: na avidyā gambhīrā na śūkṣmā
translated: Ignorance is not deep or subtle.

original: na saṃskārā gambhīrā na śūkṣmāḥ /
analyzed: na saṃskārāḥ gambhīrāḥ na śūkṣmāḥ
translated: Formations are not deep or subtle.

original: na vijñānaṃ gambhīraṃ na śūkṣmaṃ /
analyzed: na vijñānam gambhīram na śūkṣmam
translated: Consciousness is not deep or subtle.

original: na nāmarūpaṃ gambhīraṃ na śūkṣmaṃ /
analyzed: na nāma rūpam gambhīram na śūkṣmam
translated: Name-and-form is not deep or subtle.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanaṃ gambhīraṃ na śūkṣmaṃ /🔽na sparśo gambhiro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanam gambhīram na śūkṣmam  na sparśaḥ gambhiraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ
translated: The six sense bases are not deep or subtle.🔽Contact is not deep or subtle.

original: na vedanā gambhīrā na śūkṣmā /
analyzed: na vedanā gambhīrā na śūkṣmā
translated: Feeling is not deep or subtle.

original: na tṛṣṇā gambhīrā na śūkṣmā /
analyzed: na tṛṣṇā gambhīrā na śūkṣmā
translated: Craving is not deep or subtle.

original: nopādānaṃ gambhīraṃ na śūkṣmaṃ /🔽na bhavo gambhīro na śūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: na upādānam gambhīram na śūkṣmam  na bhavaḥ gambhīraḥ na śūkṣmaḥ
translated: Appropriation is neither deep nor subtle.🔽Becoming is neither deep nor subtle.

original: na jātir gambhīrā na śūkṣmā /
analyzed: na jātiḥ gambhīrā na śūkṣmā
